column3:
On September 27, 2016, leading minds in data and analytics will come together and unveil the latest in cloud technology, enabling you to more efficiently put data to work. Experience how Spark, Hadoop, Python, and more are being used to bring together all types of data professionals –from data engineers, to data scientists, developers and business analysts –to work in new collaborative ways.

The IBM DataFirst Launch Event will unite data and analytics leaders and practitioners from the open source community, startups, and enterprises. Check the event site for the latest lineup of guest speakers. The event takes place @ 6pm at the Hudson Mercantile Building, NYC.

Here’s the plan:
• The Big Reveal –Experience new ways to work for data engineers, data scientist, developers, and business analysts, both individually and collectively.

•Hands-on sessions – With interactive experiences for each of these professions.

•Use Cases –Community leaders and guest speakers will share their expertise and vision
•Networking Opportunity – Food, drinks, data, collaborative demos, and a party on the rooftop

Learn more here:  DataFirst Launch Event

Check-in and networking begins at 6:00 PM EST.  Food and drinks will be served. You must register for this event.

To get your ticket, and attend in person, click HERE.  

Can't attend in person? We'll be live streaming this event.  Register for the LIVE STREAM and we'll send you a calendar update and login link.
column17: DataFirst Launch Event – Experience new ways to put your data to work

column3:
Join us for some food, drinks, mingle and interesting Weather talk with Margriet on October 12. 

Weather is a source of fascination and endless conversation. When you combine weather data sets with twitter chatter about the weather, what kinds of surprising insights might you find? Are the weather sentiments on Twitter related to the actual weather and forecasts? 

This talk shows you how to extract, combine, and analyze Twitter and weather feeds in Python, using Spark, Insight for Twitter, Weather Company Data for Bluemix and Watson Tone Analyser. We will explore how to analyse this data in a Python notebook to draw insights into patterns and sentiment that may not otherwise be apparent. The talk covers how to:

- Extract Twitter feeds daily and store them into Cloudant database. 
- Analyze the tweet sentiment using Watson Tone Analyzer.
- Deploy Weather Company Data for Bluemix to collect daily weather data and load it into Hadoop.
- Combine and analyze the stored data to understand correlations between sentiment and weather in a Python notebook using Spark and multivariate statistical methods. We’ll also use clustering algorithms to compare correlations between regions to find out if the English weather really is as bad as they say.

This is a fun sample problem showing how you can combine and analyse large and small data sets to uncover trends and patterns. The techniques presented in this talk are applicable to a wide variety of questions. You can easily add or swap out data sources to extend or adapt the examples given. This session is recommended for anyone looking to widen their skill set in working with data, particularly in a cloud environment.

Speaker Bio:
Margriet Groenendijk is a Developer Advocate at IBM Cloud Data Services. She is all about data: from storing, cleaning, and munging through to analysing and visualising. She has a passion for creating clear plots and models that tease new insights from diverse data sets using tools like Cloudant NoSQL databases, data warehouses, Spark, and Python notebooks. Her PhD work explored large datasets of carbon uptake by forests. As a Research Fellow, she analysed very large observational datasets and the output of global scale climate models. She has written several scientific articles and regularly presents her work at international conferences. You can find Margriet on twitter @margrietgr, on LinkedIn https://uk.linkedin.com/in/margrietgroenendijk and on IBM blog https://developer.ibm.com/clouddataservices/author/mgroenen/
column17: Analyse weather data and twitter sentiment using Spark and Watson

column3:
Bring your laptop - Now it's time for some real exercises

We show you Data Science Experience and  for those of you who wants we continue with a hands-on workshop.

https://youtu.be/1HjzkLRdP5k

IBM Data Science Experience (DSX) is an interactive, collaborative, cloud-based environment where data scientists can use multiple tools to activate their insights. Data scientists can use the best of open source, tap into IBM's unique features, grow their capabilities, and share their successes.   

One can use Python, R, or Scala in Jupyter Notebooks already connected to Spark. Or use RStudio to deliver the most widely used open-source R statistical computing environment.   

In this meetup we will delve into IBM Data Science Experience, its core capabilities around community, notebooks, maker palette and projects.   

We will also look into upcoming Watson Machine Learning for DSX.    

 We split the meetup in 2 sessions.    

 1). Introduction and a demo session (around 1.5 hours) 

 2). Hands-on sessions with Notebooks and RStudio. In these two session we will take a problem statement and a data-set, and let participants write an R asset, and a Spark notebook, share data and results among the team. During this session we will cover basics of R and Spark and assist in solving the problem. (around 2 x 45 min).
column17: Hands on Workshop - Data Science Experience

column3:
IBM values our community of clients and business partners. Each year, we support and build our community by working closely with IBM advocates and helping them to become 

IBM Champions

IBM Champions are a select group of external advocates made up of clients, business partners and independent consultants who make exceptional contributions to the technical community by speaking at conferences, running or actively participating in user groups, evangelizing relevant technical topics via social media, and helping our clients make the most of IBM technology. 

We are looking for clients and business partners to join the program and are looking for applications in the areas of data science, data engineering, application development, and business analytics.

Nominations are due by Monday, November 28, 2016

The Champion program is open to candidates worldwide, and candidates may self-nominate or be nominated by someone else. IBM employees are not eligible for the program.  Some benefits of the IBM Champion program: 
- IBM Champions advocate IBM offerings in the community with competence and credibility (content, blogs, presentations, customer references, analyst/press, videos/podcasts, etc.)
- IBM Champions share knowledge with and provide support to the IBM user community (books, articles, blogs, forums, presentations, education, beta programs and customer advisory councils etc.)
- IBM Champions support IBM as brand ambassadors who build awareness, share product knowledge, and provide product feedback as users and beta testers

Read this  blog post  for full IBM Champion program criteria, guidelines and the <a>nomination form</a>.

To learn more about the IBM Champion program from current Champions and Worldwide IBM Champion coordinator Libby Ingrassia, listen to this webcast. Be sure to share the blog and webcast with clients and colleagues who would make great IBM Champions.
column17: IBM Champions - Call for Nominations

column3:
The demand for machine learning is booming! 

Calling all IT executives, data scientists, Chief Data Officers, data architects and other data geeks.  Join us on February 15th from 2:00-5:30 pm ET via livestream  (replay available starting February 16th) , and discover how machine learning is fundamentally changing the way we work and live.  Hear about cognitive applications that anticipate behavior and learn from data without being explicitly programmed.

You'll learn about the latest breakthrough developments on machine learning as well as Spark, data and analytics. Mike Gualtieri, Vice President and Principal Analyst, Forrester, will present his view on how to best leverage technologies such as big data, predictive analytics, Hadoop/Spark, machine learning, data science, and AI.  Rob Thomas, General Manager, IBM Analytics will host an agenda which will include guest speakers and cover the following topics:

•  Machine Learning Overview

•  Top Trends in Machine Learning & Cognitive Applications

•  Cognitive Analytics and Machine Learning for the Enterprise

•  Live Product Demonstration & Client Roundtable on Machine Learning

•  Data Innovation with Hybrid Transaction/Analytical Processing

•  Spark & Machine Learning for Enterprise Systems

For additional details and to REGISTER, please visit MACHINE LEARNING.

Register NOW and we'll send you a reminder!

THIS IS A WEB CONFERENCE ONLY - TIME INDICATED IS LOCAL START TIME. SEE BELOW FOR DETAILS.

IBM InfoSphere Streams V3.2 (referred to as Streams) delivers a highly scalable, agile software infrastructure to perform in-motion analytics on a wide variety of relational and non-relational data types that enter the enterprise at unprecedented volumes and speed, and from thousands of real-time sources. Streams V3.2 includes new features and functions designed to instantly analyze and fuse massive volumes of data and integrates with existing infrastructures. It delivers new capabilities to improve usability, support enterprise readiness, and streamline enterprise integration.

WHAT:

The following new features and functions, which will be covered during the Streams Developer Conference:

Usability:
• Remote Development with Streams Studio for Windows and Linux
• User Defined Parallelism
• Java Streams development simplification

Enterprise readiness:
• Operational Decision Management adapter for business rules
• Access to application data using Representational State Transfer (REST)

Enterprise integration:
• MQTT adapters
• Hadoop Big SQL support
• HP Vertica Analytic Database support

Who should attend:

The event assumes you are familiar with Streams. If you are not, please either try the Big Data University Streams course or review some of the Streams videos on YouTube.

WHEN:

Webcast on Thursday November 14, 2013 from 10:00AM to 6:00PM U.S. Eastern Standard Time.

WHERE:

The webcast will be recorded and posted to Big Data University (BDU) at the following Big Data University course ID.

NOTE: There will be no physical location for this meetup and it will all be online.

To get more info, download presentations, get detailed agenda and to register for the event check out the BDU Streams Developers Virtual Conference landing page.

The detailed agenda will be posted at the BDU class/event page after Oct 31.

Please join us on the live LotusLive meeting webcast. The conference ID is 2058889. Audio in listen only mode will be available on the webcast.

To ask questions during Q&A periods, please use the following conference information:

USA Toll-Free: 1-888-426-6840


USA Caller Paid: 1-215-861-6239


For Other Countries call in numbers use this link.

Participant Code: 7821035

We look forward to sharing details about these new capabilities.

column3:
CALLING ALL DEVELOPERS .... JOIN THE BIG DATA FOR SOCIAL GOOD CHALLENGE

Big data exists in just about everything we use and do. It comes from phones, cars, roads, power lines, waterways, food crates, and innumerable other items you’d never think of as computers. This data speaks volumes about our collective behavior and society – so let’s use it to do something incredible! IBM invites developers and data enthusiasts to take a deep dive into real world civic issues using big data and the IBM Bluemix Analytics for Hadoop service. Analyze one of our curated datasets or bring your own (provided it meets these requirements)! Use Hadoop and your data to create a clickable and interactive data visualization to highlight insights that you’ve found.

Ready to get started? $40,000 in prizes will be awarded....

Register here:http://ibmhadoop.challengepost.com/

What to Create: Participants must create a working, clickable, and interactive data visualization utilizing the Analytics for Hadoop service on IBM Bluemix.

Data Requirements: Your data visualization must analyze one or more datasets included in the curated list of datasets on the Data page OR meet the data size, content, and licensing requirements described on the Data page. The total size of the Datasets analyzed must be between 500MB - 7GB in size.

Check out the requirements then go get your IBM Bluemix extended promo code and check out the datasets!

column3:
THIS IS A WEB CONFERENCE ONLY.  TIME OF WEB CONFERENCE LOCALLY IS BASED ON LIVE-STREAM START - PACIFIC DAYLIGHT TIME. DETAILS TO CONNECT TO LIVE-STREAM ARE INDICATED BELOW. 

Apache Spark is an open source processing engine built around speed, ease of use, and analytics. If you have large amounts of data that requires low latency processing that a typical Map Reduce program cannot provide, Spark is the alternative.

Spark performs at speeds up to 100 times faster than Map Reduce for iterative algorithms or interactive data mining. Spark provides in-memory cluster computing for lightning fast speed and supports Java, Scala, and Python APIs for ease of development. Spark allows data scientists to build models quickly and supports iterative jobs on distributed datasets. This means more people can apply deep intelligence into applications to make everything smarter, including the Internet of Things (IoT), machine learning, web, mobile, social, business process and more. 

Do you believe in the value of Spark, in the speed, efficiency and flexibility of this in-memory compute engine? IBM does.  Emphatically.That's why we're committed to do everything we can to accelerate the adoption of Spark for enterprise analytics, where Spark promises seemingly unlimited value.

On June 15, 2015, IBM will host a Spark Community event in San Francisco, California: IBM | Spark - The Start of Something Big in Data and Design. There will be a live demo showcase, refreshments, and a Town Hall discussion featuring some of the most trail-blazing data scientists in today's Spark Community, including:
  Edd Dumbill, VP Strategy, Silicon Valley Data Science
•  Mike Tamir, Chief Science Officer & VP of Data Science & Education at Galvanize
•   Fernando Perez, Staff Scientist at Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory & Founding Investigator of the Berkeley Institute for Data Science
•   Haoyuan Li, CEO and Founder of Tachyon Nexus
•   Shankar Venkataraman, Distinguished Engineer & CTO, IBM Analytics Platform at IBM
•   Paco Nathan, Director, Community Evangelism, Databricks

Spark Community members will also deliver 5-minute lightning talks to describe exciting projects they're working on.

We will provide a livestream presentation of what these Spark leaders have to say.

Live Streaming Link:

To get additional details about Spark you can sign up now for a reminder at:

http://www.ibm.com/analytics/us/en/technology/spark/

Scroll down to "Can't attend in Person"?  Sign up for a reminder and add it to your calendar.

Additional information on Spark:

Link to Spark Fundamentals Course in Big Data University

http://bigdatauniversity.com/bdu-wp/bdu-course/spark-fundamentals/

Link to Spark Technology Information

http://www.ibm.com/analytics/us/en/technology/spark/

Happy Sparking.
column17: IBM | Spark - The start of something big in data & design (Web Conference Only))

On June 6, 2016, leading minds in data and analytics from Tesla, Netflix, Silicon Valley Data Science, and IBM will come together to demonstrate how open data and analytics technologies such as R, Spark, Python and more are forming a vibrant ecosystem.  The community has a shared goal of working with all data to build unexpected insights and launch new business applications.

The Apache Spark Maker Community Event will bring together data scientists, data engineers, data developers, and data designers June 6th @ 6pm at Galvanize, San Francisco. Here’s the plan:   

- The Big Reveal – New sample Apache Spark apps and tools

- Use Cases – Monsanto will share how they are using R and Spark to optimize their supply chain

- Learning Session - Hear from experts working on Spark projects and building the Spark ecosystem of open data and analytics technologies

- Networking Opportunity – Food, drinks and data, explore a Hall of Innovation showcasing Spark demos

Join us. Learn more here: 

Apache Spark Maker Community Event 

We realize you may not be able to attend in person, however, we are live streaming the event.  Register for the live stream and we'll send you a calendar update and login link.

Let's Get Hands-on with Big Data!


When: Monday,  19th May 2014

Time: 6 – 8 p.m.

Place: Strathmore University, Madaraka Estate, Ole Sangale Road, 00200 City SquareRoom MSB11

Management Science Building (room MSB11)


Geared towards developers, data scientists and ALL Big Data enthusiasts, our meetups provide an opportunity to work hands on with the solutions and tools in our Big Data portfolio.

Agenda: 6:00 – 6:45 p.m. – presentation that serves as an introduction and overview for a specific Big Data technology

6:45 – 8:00 p.m. – Hands-on experience with technologies that makes big data processing possible 

Anything and everything about Big Data Join us today for a hands on software development experience.

Pre-requisites:- Please bring your laptop- Do the following registrations:

1. Register for an “IBM ID” on https://www.ibm.com/account/profile/us?page=reg

2. Register for BlueMix  (click on “Already have an IBM ID”) https://apps.admin.ibmcloud.com/manage/trial/bluemix.htm     

-     Attendance is free (no marketing or sales pitches are permitted)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=B27SpLOOhWw

Download

  - Hadoop

  - Real Time Analytics

Learn more about Big Data for FREE at Big Data University and StreamsDev

Today's business environment is demanding greater flexibility in order to introduce newproducts to market faster. This requirement demands that new tools be available that promotesuch products to an ever increasingly interconnected, mobile, and social world. As a result, thedigital fabric supporting the business must be designed for utmost flexibility in order to supportmodern business processes, and customer and partner interactions.IBM has led the way in embracing new technologies to provide business solutions that benefitenterprises. Now, IBM is helping to define this new era of cloud computing via the IBM opencloud architecture, which reduces concerns of vendor lock-in and fosters an open API economy.Through Bluemix and SoftLayer, IBM has introduced the core capabilities necessary to enablethe enterprise for the world of systems of interaction and cloud-centric applications. IBMcontinues to enhance Bluemix and continues this journey of innovation for its clients.

Learn how IBM Bluemix – Digital Innovation Platform, helps you to innovate your business andrevolutionize the way you think and bring to life disruptive ideas. Do you think about how much you might learn from analyzing social data, but don't act because you don't have enough time or resource to build what you need? In this session, we show you how easy it is to use the Node-RED workflow editor in IBM Bluemix™ to capture a social data feed (a Twitter feed) and then build a Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) file from that data. We also show you how to use the IBM Analytics for Hadoop service to analyze the data and produce summary charts. You’ll be amazed at how easy it is to turn an unknown data set into information you can use.

Please follow below action before come :

THIS IS A WEB CONFERENCE ONLY - TIME INDICATED IS LOCAL START TIME. SEE BELOW FOR DETAILS.

IBM InfoSphere Streams V3.2 (referred to as Streams) delivers a highly scalable, agile software infrastructure to perform in-motion analytics on a wide variety of relational and non-relational data types that enter the enterprise at unprecedented volumes and speed, and from thousands of real-time sources. Streams V3.2 includes new features and functions designed to instantly analyze and fuse massive volumes of data and integrates with existing infrastructures. It delivers new capabilities to improve usability, support enterprise readiness, and streamline enterprise integration.

WHAT:

The following new features and functions, which will be covered during the Streams Developer Conference:

Usability:
• Remote Development with Streams Studio for Windows and Linux
• User Defined Parallelism
• Java Streams development simplification

Enterprise readiness:
• Operational Decision Management adapter for business rules
• Access to application data using Representational State Transfer (REST)

Enterprise integration:
• MQTT adapters
• Hadoop Big SQL support
• HP Vertica Analytic Database support

Who should attend:

The event assumes you are familiar with Streams. If you are not, please either try the Big Data University Streams course or review some of the Streams videos on YouTube.

WHEN:

Webcast on Thursday November 14, 2013 from 10:00AM to 6:00PM U.S. Eastern Standard Time.

WHERE:

The webcast will be recorded and posted to Big Data University (BDU) at the following Big Data University course ID.

NOTE: There will be no physical location for this meetup and it will all be online.

To get more info, download presentations, get detailed agenda and to register for the event check out the BDU Streams Developers Virtual Conference landing page.

The detailed agenda will be posted at the BDU class/event page after Oct 31.

Please join us on the live LotusLive meeting webcast. The conference ID is 2058889. Audio in listen only mode will be available on the webcast.

To ask questions during Q&A periods, please use the following conference information:

USA Toll-Free: 1-888-426-6840

USA Caller Paid: 1-215-861-6239

For Other Countries call in numbers use this link.

Participant Code: 7821035

We look forward to sharing details about these new capabilities.

Our clients are acquiring new customers with data. How is possible to get business insights from data ? Let's find out. Join in for a Big data and Analytics session with IBM.

Time - 3 PM onwards

Venue - IBM Innovation Center, IBM A Block. Embassy Golf Links Business Park. Inner Ring Road. Bangalore - 37.


Agenda Overview -

- Opening Address - Mona Bhardwaj. Manager, IBM Innovation Center. Bangalore.

- Keynote by Shyam Mudambi, Big Data and Analytics Expert.  

- Deep dive / Demo - Big Data

- Q & A / Networking followed by hi-tea

- This is Free event

RSVP - Neha N - nehan1@in.ibm.com

Speaker profile -


Shyam Mudambi is the Development Director for InfoSphere BigInsights, IBM's Enterprise Hadoop distribution. Shyam has been in the parallel computing world since the late 80s, when he worked on optimal scheduling of parallel processes on early NUMA (Non-Uniform Memory Architecture) machines. He came into IBM as part of the Ascential acquisition, where he led the DataStage and Parallel DataFlow Engine (aka PX Engine) teams. Prior to Ascential, Shyam ran engineering at Torrent Systems, where he was also one of early engineers who developed the shared memory transport for the PX Engine and DB2/Oracle connectors. Shyam received his PhD in Computer Science from Brandeis University and has worked in several research labs in the area of parallel languages, including Argonne National Labs (Chicago), the European Computer Industry Research Center (Munich) and GTE Labs (Waltham, MA).

CALLING ALL DEVELOPERS .... JOIN THE BIG DATA FOR SOCIAL GOOD CHALLENGE

Big data exists in just about everything we use and do. It comes from phones, cars, roads, power lines, waterways, food crates, and innumerable other items you’d never think of as computers. This data speaks volumes about our collective behavior and society – so let’s use it to do something incredible! IBM invites developers and data enthusiasts to take a deep dive into real world civic issues using big data and the IBM Bluemix Analytics for Hadoop service. Analyze one of our curated datasets or bring your own (provided it meets these requirements)! Use Hadoop and your data to create a clickable and interactive data visualization to highlight insights that you’ve found.

Ready to get started? $40,000 in prizes will be awarded....

Data Requirements: Your data visualization must analyze one or more datasets included in the curated list of datasets on the Data page OR meet the data size, content, and licensing requirements described on the Data page. The total size of the Datasets analyzed must be between 500MB - 7GB in size.

column3:
THIS IS A WEB CONFERENCE ONLY.  TIME OF WEB CONFERENCE LOCALLY IS BASED ON LIVE-STREAM START - PACIFIC DAYLIGHT TIME. DETAILS TO CONNECT TO LIVE-STREAM ARE INDICATED BELOW.  

Apache Spark is an open source processing engine built around speed, ease of use, and analytics. If you have large amounts of data that requires low latency processing that a typical Map Reduce program cannot provide, Spark is the alternative.

Spark performs at speeds up to 100 times faster than Map Reduce for iterative algorithms or interactive data mining. Spark provides in-memory cluster computing for lightning fast speed and supports Java, Scala, and Python APIs for ease of development. Spark allows data scientists to build models quickly and supports iterative jobs on distributed datasets. This means more people can apply deep intelligence into applications to make everything smarter, including the Internet of Things (IoT), machine learning, web, mobile, social, business process and more. 

Do you believe in the value of Spark, in the speed, efficiency and flexibility of this in-memory compute engine? IBM does.  Emphatically.

That's why we're committed to do everything we can to accelerate the adoption of Spark for enterprise analytics, where Spark promises seemingly unlimited value. On June 15, 2015, IBM will host a Spark Community event in San Francisco, California: IBM | Spark - The Start of Something Big in Data and Design. There will be a live demo showcase, refreshments, and a Town Hall discussion featuring some of the most trail-blazing data scientists in today's Spark Community, including:
-  Edd Dumbill, VP Strategy, Silicon Valley Data Science
-  Mike Tamir, Chief Science Officer & VP of Data Science & Education at Galvanize
-   Fernando Perez, Staff Scientist at Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory & Founding Investigator of the Berkeley Institute for Data Science
-   Haoyuan Li, CEO and Founder of Tachyon Nexus
-   Shankar Venkataraman, Distinguished Engineer & CTO, IBM Analytics Platform at IBM
-   Paco Nathan, Director, Community Evangelism, Databricks

Spark Community members will also deliver 5-minute lightning talks to describe exciting projects they're working on.

We will provide a livestream presentation of what these Spark leaders have to say.

To get additional details about Spark and access the live-stream, you can sign up now for a reminder.  Please go to:

http://www.ibm.com/analytics/us/en/technology/spark/

Scroll down to "Can't attend in Person"?  Sign up for a reminder and add it to your calendar.

Link to Spark Fundamentals Course in Big Data University


http://bigdatauniversity.com/bdu-wp/bdu-course/spark-fundamentals/

Link to Spark Technology Information


http://www.ibm.com/analytics/us/en/technology/spark/

Happy Sparking.

IBM India Labs is hosting a 48hr hackathon on Aug 31 & Sep 1 for technology enthusiasts to collaboratively use Apache Spark to  solve the real world challenges based on the following themes:

New digital India

Enabling digital commerce

Creating a safer, clean & healthy India

The team size is limited to 5 persons at the max & not less than 3

Agenda (Total 2 Days)

Aug 31, Day 1: 9am-6pm

Kick-off by IBM

Registration & Start of Hackathon

Interaction with Distinguished Engineers  during lunch

Sep 1, Day 2: 9am-6pm

Completion & Submission of Projects

Evaluation by Jury

Winner Announcement & Prize Distribution

This event is for people who would like to bond with Apache Spark, so we recommend that you have basic knowledge of Java, Scala, Python or Apache Spark, as we wont be able to teach them during the event

You all need get your laptops.

P.S.  Once you have signed up we expect you to show up. Since we have only limited availability your sign-up will potentially prevent another person from coming. If you find that you cannot make it please inform us at least 3 days prior to the event, so we can invite another person from the waiting list.

We will give a detailed introduction to Apache Spark and why and how Spark can change the analytics world.

Apache Spark's memory abstraction is RDD (Resilient Distributed DataSet). One of the key reason why Apache Spark is so different is because of the introduction of RDD.

You cannot do anything in Apache Spark without knowing about RDDs.

We will give a high level introduction to RDD and in the second half we will have a  deep dive into RDDs.

Speakers -


Paranth (Architect (STSM), Analytics Platform at IBM Labs)

LinkedIn - https://in.linkedin.com/pub/paranth-thiruvengadam/9/771/256

Hi Spark Enthusiasts,

Pallavi Priyadarshini and Praveen Devarao both from the Spark Technology Center at IBM Software Lab will walk you through on how to develop high speed connectors for Spark. Our agenda for the meetup on Saturday, May 14th -


Agenda:

• Connectors - background, motivation and use cases

• How to build your own connector - code walk through

This session will introduce you to Spark connectors and take you through the out-of-the-box connectors available in Spark and others available as Spark packages. This session will brief you on the background of why customized connectors are needed followed by a developer session on writing your own Spark connectors that covers how Spark recognizes the extensions and how you can write your own Spark extension, illustrating with IBM use cases. At the end of the session you should be able to learn when and why customized connectors are needed and be able to write one for your use case, if not available already.

Venue: IBM's Embassy Golf Links Campus ( Block A Cafeteria)
Please spread the word and encourage your friends and colleagues to signup for this meetup.


Cheers,

Spark Technology Center

On June 6, 2016, leading minds in data and analytics from Tesla, Netflix, Silicon Valley Data Science, and IBM will come together to demonstrate how open data and analytics technologies such as R, Spark, Python and more are forming a vibrant ecosystem.  The community has a shared goal of working with all data to build unexpected insights and launch new business applications.

The Apache Spark Maker Community Event will bring together data scientists, data engineers, data developers, and data designers June 6th @ 6pm at Galvanize, San Francisco. Here’s the plan:

- Use Cases – Monsanto will share how they are using R and Spark to optimize their supply chain

- Learning Session - Hear from experts working on Spark projects and building the Spark ecosystem of open data and analytics technologies

Apache Spark Maker Community Event

THIS IS A GLOBAL ON-LINE HACKATHON THAT BEGINS MAY 23, 2016 AND NOW ENDS AUGUST 23, 2016.  SUBMISSIONS DUE AUGUST 23rd BY 5:00 PM EST. 

We’re extending the hackathon deadline to August 23 - that’s 20 additional days to build your Spark enterprise app. (View the revised competition calendar HERE.  We're giving you more time because....

We’re adding new enterprise data resources to the site and we want to give you a chance to incorporate these into your projects, if you so choose.  Our awesome data co-sponsors Yelp and Uncharted Software have generously shared some of their enterprise data sets for you to use during the hackathon.

Yelp’s data includes 2.2M reviews by 552K users for 77K businesses. The Uncharted data includes Bitcoin network transactions from processing the Bitcoin blockchain as of mid-2014 and Amazon product reviews from 1995 through 2003. For a fuller description and data access, visit our resources page.

Uncharted Software also has a couple cool Spark data visualization libraries you should check out: Salt and SparkPipe.

And, in case you’d like to weigh the effects of weather on business operations, we’re also offering access to the full suite of Weather Company APIs for the duration of the hackathon.

Finally, if you’re looking for a hosting solution for your Spark app, we’re now offering extended Bluemix trials for all hackathon participants. Using Bluemix services to build your project is totally optional, but might be a good way to get your app up and running — particularly with the IBM Analytics for Apache Spark service.

You can request your extended Bluemix trial code here. 

For all hackathon participants, trials will extend through November 1, 2016.

Now go forth and optimize for the enterprise!

---------------------

Build an Apache Spark application to address a real business problem or core concern related to customer care, marketing, risk management or operations. Join IBM and Devpost for a global hackathon using Apache Spark Makers Build.  There are $100,000 in cash prizes.  Submissions can be sent in up to August 23rd.

Participation Details: To participate in the global virtual hackathon, you can register here.  Please review all registration guidelines.

For the hack, you will apply Apache Spark's powerful analytics capabilities to enterprise and other relevant data so data scientists and software developers can build an analytics or mobile/web app that tackles a key business problem in marketing, customer case, operations or risk management.  The grand prize is $50,000, and the top three winners each get a meeting with the judge or
Spark community expert of their choice; the judging panel includes data experts from Tesla, Netflix, and Silicon Valley Data Science.

Go to apachespark.devpost.com for full details and registration.  Please review all registration rules.

Questions?

We're here to help. If you have any questions about the hackathon, post on the

discussion forum

or email

support@devpost.com

and we'll respond as soon as we can.

IBM values our community of clients and business partners. Each year, we support and build our community by working closely with IBM advocates and helping them to become 

IBM Champions

IBM Champions are a select group of external advocates made up of clients, business partners and independent consultants who make exceptional contributions to the technical community by speaking at conferences, running or actively participating in user groups, evangelizing relevant technical topics via social media, and helping our clients make the most of IBM technology. 

We are looking for clients and business partners to join the program and are looking for applications in the areas of data science, data engineering, application development, and business analytics.

Nominations are due by Monday, November 28, 2016

The Champion program is open to candidates worldwide, and candidates may self-nominate or be nominated by someone else. IBM employees are not eligible for the program.  Some benefits of the IBM Champion program: 
- IBM Champions advocate IBM offerings in the community with competence and credibility (content, blogs, presentations, customer references, analyst/press, videos/podcasts, etc.)
- IBM Champions share knowledge with and provide support to the IBM user community (books, articles, blogs, forums, presentations, education, beta programs and customer advisory councils etc.)
- IBM Champions support IBM as brand ambassadors who build awareness, share product knowledge, and provide product feedback as users and beta testers

Read this  blog post  for full IBM Champion program criteria, guidelines and the <a>nomination form</a>.

To learn more about the IBM Champion program from current Champions and Worldwide IBM Champion coordinator Libby Ingrassia, listen to this webcast. Be sure to share the blog and webcast with clients and colleagues who would make great IBM Champions.

CALLING ALL DEVELOPERS .... JOIN THE BIG DATA FOR SOCIAL GOOD CHALLENGE

Big data exists in just about everything we use and do. It comes from phones, cars, roads, power lines, waterways, food crates, and innumerable other items you’d never think of as computers. This data speaks volumes about our collective behavior and society – so let’s use it to do something incredible! IBM invites developers and data enthusiasts to take a deep dive into real world civic issues using big data and the IBM Bluemix Analytics for Hadoop service. Analyze one of our curated datasets or bring your own (provided it meets these requirements)! Use Hadoop and your data to create a clickable and interactive data visualization to highlight insights that you’ve found.

Ready to get started? $40,000 in prizes will be awarded....

Register here:http://ibmhadoop.challengepost.com/

What to Create: Participants must create a working, clickable, and interactive data visualization utilizing the Analytics for Hadoop service on IBM Bluemix.

Data Requirements: Your data visualization must analyze one or more datasets included in the curated list of datasets on the Data page OR meet the data size, content, and licensing requirements described on the Data page. The total size of the Datasets analyzed must be between 500MB - 7GB in size.

Check out the requirements then go get your IBM Bluemix extended promo code and check out the datasets!

column3:
THIS IS A WEB CONFERENCE ONLY.  TIME OF WEB CONFERENCE LOCALLY IS BASED ON LIVE-STREAM START - PACIFIC DAYLIGHT TIME. DETAILS TO CONNECT TO LIVE-STREAM ARE INDICATED BELOW. 


Apache Spark is an open source processing engine built around speed, ease of use, and analytics. If you have large amounts of data that requires low latency processing that a typical Map Reduce program cannot provide, Spark is the alternative.

Spark performs at speeds up to 100 times faster than Map Reduce for iterative algorithms or interactive data mining. Spark provides in-memory cluster computing for lightning fast speed and supports Java, Scala, and Python APIs for ease of development. Spark allows data scientists to build models quickly and supports iterative jobs on distributed datasets. This means more people can apply deep intelligence into applications to make everything smarter, including the Internet of Things (IoT), machine learning, web, mobile, social, business process and more. 

Do you believe in the value of Spark, in the speed, efficiency and flexibility of this in-memory compute engine? IBM does.  Emphatically.

That's why we're committed to do everything we can to accelerate the adoption of Spark for enterprise analytics, where Spark promises seemingly unlimited value. On June 15, 2015, IBM will host a Spark Community event in San Francisco, California: IBM | Spark - The Start of Something Big in Data and Design. There will be a live demo showcase, refreshments, and a Town Hall discussion featuring some of the most trail-blazing data scientists in today's Spark Community, including: 

-   Edd Dumbill, VP Strategy, Silicon Valley Data Science
-   Mike Tamir, Chief Science Officer & VP of Data Science & Education at Galvanize
-   Fernando Perez, Staff Scientist at Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory & Founding Investigator of the Berkeley Institute for Data Science
-   Haoyuan Li, CEO and Founder of Tachyon Nexus
-   Shankar Venkataraman, Distinguished Engineer & CTO, IBM Analytics Platform at IBM
-   Paco Nathan, Director, Community Evangelism, Databricks

Spark Community members will also deliver 5-minute lightning talks to describe exciting projects they're working on.

We will provide a livestream presentation of what these Spark leaders have to say.

To get additional details about Spark and access the live-stream, you can sign up now for a reminder.  Please go to:

http://www.ibm.com/analytics/us/en/technology/spark/

Mike Gualtieri, Vice President and Principal Analyst, Forrester, will present his view on how to best leverage technologies such as big data, predictive analytics, Hadoop/Spark, machine learning, data science, and AI.  Rob Thomas, General Manager, IBM Analytics will host an agenda which will include guest speakers and cover the following topics:

•  Cognitive Analytics and Machine Learning for the Enterprise

•  Live Product Demonstration & Client Roundtable on Machine Learning

Participate in an exclusive Big Data Developer Day and experience IBM's enterprise class big data platform that allows you to address the full spectrum of big data business challenges.


The morning will include interactive discussions and live demonstrations of big data for social media and log analytics, then get hands-on with text analytics, stream computing and application development!


This is a unique opportunity to develop skills and learn about exciting technologies and techniques that you can immediately take back to your organisations.


IBM would like to extend an invitation for you to attend a Big Data Developer day to be held in Melbourne on March 12th, 2014. The Big Data Developer Day is at no cost to you.

Location:  IBM Southgate,  Southbank, VIC, 3006.


Agenda


8:30 am ‐ 9:00 am    Arrival and Registration


9:00 am ‐10:00 am    Welcome & Overview of IBM’s Big Data Platform


10:00 am ‐ 10:15 am    Break


10:15 am ‐ 12:00 pm    Social Media Demo, Machine Analytics Demo & Real-Time Analytics Demo


12:00 pm ‐ 1:00 pm    Lunch


1:00 pm ‐ 5:00 pm    Hands-On Labs: Big Data Use Cases


On the day you have two choices for the lab exercises: either,

  Bring your own laptop to run the VMware images - your laptop will need to have a minimum of 8Gb RAM, 30Gb minimum free


  hard disk space and VMware Player 5 or later installed.

  or

  Use a supplied laptop, then take the VMware image you have worked on with you on DVD.


   Note: Please indicate when you register whether you wish to utilise an IBM laptop on the day - the numbers of laptops are very limited, so we might not be able to accommodate you. In your confirmation email we will indicate whether a laptop will be available for your use.

Registration is open now for the event, so be quick to register via email - places are limited. Confirmations for attendance will be sent out approximately one week prior to the event date.

We look forward to seeing you there.

CALLING ALL DEVELOPERS .... JOIN THE BIG DATA FOR SOCIAL GOOD CHALLENGE

Big data exists in just about everything we use and do. It comes from phones, cars, roads, power lines, waterways, food crates, and innumerable other items you’d never think of as computers. This data speaks volumes about our collective behavior and society – so let’s use it to do something incredible! IBM invites developers and data enthusiasts to take a deep dive into real world civic issues using big data and the IBM Bluemix Analytics for Hadoop service. Analyze one of our curated datasets or bring your own (provided it meets these requirements)! Use Hadoop and your data to create a clickable and interactive data visualization to highlight insights that you’ve found.

Ready to get started? $40,000 in prizes will be awarded....

Register here:http://ibmhadoop.challengepost.com/

What to Create: Participants must create a working, clickable, and interactive data visualization utilizing the Analytics for Hadoop service on IBM Bluemix.

Data Requirements: Your data visualization must analyze one or more datasets included in the curated list of datasets on the Data page OR meet the data size, content, and licensing requirements described on the Data page. The total size of the Datasets analyzed must be between 500MB - 7GB in size.

Check out the requirements then go get your IBM Bluemix extended promo code and check out the datasets!

column3:
Your Invitation to a briefing on IBM's announcement to embed Apache® Spark™ into its Analytics platforms.

On June 15 in San Francisco, IBM made its most significant Open Source announcement since the 1990s, with a commitment to accelerate the adoption of Apache® Spark™ .

Spark is an open source processing engine built around speed, ease of use, and analytics. Spark performs at speeds up to 100 times faster than Hadoop for the Map Reduce function which is commonly used by Data Scientists for iterative algorithms or interactive data mining. Spark provides in-memory cluster computing for lightning fast speed and supports Java, Scala, and Python APIs for ease of development. Spark allows data scientists to build models quickly and supports iterative jobs on distributed datasets.

This meetup is targeted at Data scientists, developers, and anyone engaged with reporting and analytics.

At this meetup we will delve deeper into this announcement and provide you with guidance and materials to get started on Spark.

Agenda:

The event will start at 6:00pm sharp and conclude around 8:00pm

6:00pm - 7:00pm

- Recap of announcements made in San Francisco

- IBM's Commitment to Spark

• Benefits of Apache Spark
• Demonstrations of common use cases for Spark
• IBM's innovations for Big Data, hybrid architecture, and Open Data Platform (ODP)
• Timeline for availability of Spark support in IBM's analytics platform

- Helping you get started with Spark
-- Spark education for free at Big Data University

-- Getting a hands-on start to Spark today with access to trial Spark code.

7:00pm - 8:00pm

- Networking drinks and nibbles
column13: IBM Southgate Seminar Room - Level 13 - Enter from Podium level

column3:
THIS IS A WEB CONFERENCE ONLY - TIME INDICATED IS LOCAL START TIME. SEE BELOW FOR DETAILS.

IBM InfoSphere Streams V3.2 (referred to as Streams) delivers a highly scalable, agile software infrastructure to perform in-motion analytics on a wide variety of relational and non-relational data types that enter the enterprise at unprecedented volumes and speed, and from thousands of real-time sources. Streams V3.2 includes new features and functions designed to instantly analyze and fuse massive volumes of data and integrates with existing infrastructures. It delivers new capabilities to improve usability, support enterprise readiness, and streamline enterprise integration.

WHAT:

The following new features and functions, which will be covered during the Streams Developer Conference:

Usability:
• Remote Development with Streams Studio for Windows and Linux
• User Defined Parallelism
• Java Streams development simplification

Enterprise readiness:
• Operational Decision Management adapter for business rules
• Access to application data using Representational State Transfer (REST)

Enterprise integration:
• MQTT adapters
• Hadoop Big SQL support
• HP Vertica Analytic Database support

Who should attend:

The event assumes you are familiar with Streams. If you are not, please either try the Big Data University Streams course or review some of the Streams videos on YouTube.

WHEN:

Webcast on Thursday November 14, 2013 from 10:00AM to 6:00PM U.S. Eastern Standard Time(EST).

WHERE:

The webcast will be recorded and posted to Big Data University (BDU) at the following Big Data University course ID</a>.

NOTE: There will be no physical location for this meetup and it will all be online.

To get more info, download presentations, get detailed agenda and to register for the event check out the <a href="http://bigdatauniversity.com/bdu-wp/bdu-course/ibm-infosphere-streams-3-2-developers-conference/">BDU Streams Developers Virtual Conference landing page.

The detailed agenda will be posted at the BDU class/event page after Oct 31.

Please join us on the live LotusLive meeting webcast. The conference ID is 2058889. Audio in listen only mode will be available on the webcast.

To ask questions during Q&A periods, please use the following conference information:

USA Toll-Free: 1-888-426-6840

USA Caller Paid: 1-215-861-6239

For Other Countries call in numbers use this link.

Participant Code: 7821035

We look forward to sharing details about these new capabilities.

Do let me know if you require additional details.

Happy Streaming.

Tushar Kale
column17: Virtual Conference : Streams Developers v3.2

Join us and participate in an exclusive Big Data Developer Day hosted by the Mumbai - Big Data team. Open source Apache Hadoop is a great framework for distributed processing of large data sets. But there’s a difference between "playing" with big data versus solving real problems. The reality is that Hadoop alone might not be enough. Experience enterprise-class Hadoop product, InfoSphere BigInsights, which enhances open source Hadoop with required enterprise capabilities including: analytics, visualization, security, standard SQL, enterprise HBase, developer/admin tools, learn about the role of Big Data in Motion, Big Data Exploration and more. The morning session will include interactive Big Data use case discussions, an overview of what is big data, live demonstrations of key Big Data components (Big Data at Rest, Big Data in Motion).

What is Big Data - YouTube link :

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=B27SpLOOhWw&feature=player_embedded

In the afternoon, get hands-on with Big Data using InfoSphere BigInsights Quick Start Edition and InfoSphere Streams Quick Start Edition with guidance from development experts. This is a unique opportunity to develop skills and learn about exciting technologies and techniques that you can immediately take back to your organization.

This event is FREE. We shall provide tea and snacks.

Agenda (subject to change) 

9:00 am to 9:30 am Event Registration

9:30 am to 10:15 am Welcome and Keynote - Big Data

10:15 am to 11:30 am Introduction to Big Data

11:30 am to 12:15 am Big Data - Big Data Platform and Use Cases

12:15 am to 12:30 pm - Tea Break

12:30 pm to 1:00 pm - Hadoop Demo using Big Insights

1:00 pm to 1:30 pm - Data in Motion using Streams

Demos will use BigInsights Quickstart Virtual Machine and Streams Quickstart Virtual Machine. To learn more before hand and get hands on please visit Big Data University.

Thank You for Attending 

Kindly register here and RSVP your attendance :

www.meetup.com/Big-Data-Developers-in-Mumbai/

Registration is mandatory.  You may let others know that you are going to this event by clicking on the YES RSVP button on this Meetup page—however— your seat can not be guaranteed until you officially register at the link above.

Thank you and I look forward to meeting you soon!

Tushar Kale

Dear Big Data Enthusiast,


Join Mumbai Big Data Meetup on 8th November to learn the latest on Big Data and Analytics for cutting edge insight, business intelligence and ROI.


The meetup discussions will have specific focus on the financial sector that essentially thrives on data. Data analytics, infrastructure, process, technology and culture all need to be in place and working cohesively to maximize the return of big data and analytics.


We will discuss the latest on Big Data technology covering SQL on Hadoop, Business Intelligence, Streaming Analytics and explore why such technologies have become an area of keen interest for many organizations. We will share Industry use cases for Data Warehouse Modernization and the role of SQL for Hadoop in this space, as well as discuss performance characteristics of SQL on Hadoop when running common query workloads.


This is a FREE event and only requirement is to sign-up at above mentioned link to RSVP and stay connected with Mumbai Big Data community.


Additionally, you may invite your customers as well as post the enclosed event brochure at your customer locations too.


Venue: Don Bosco Institute of Technology, Opposite Kohinoor Mall, Kurla(W)


Time: 8th November, 2014 from 9.30 AM through 1.30 PM


Agenda:


9:00 am to 9:30 am   Registration


9:30 am to 10:15 am   Welcome and Keynote - Honourable Shri Kajal Ghose - SBI, Chief General Manager, Executive Support System


10:15 am to 11:30 am   Overview of Big Data and SQL on Hadoop


11:30 am to 12:15 pm   Big Data Platform Use Cases – Landing Zone, EDW Modernization, Big SQL and BI


12:15 am to 12:30 pm   Tea Break


12:30 pm to 1:00 pm   Streaming Data Analytics


1:00 pm to 1:30 PM   Big Data Challenges for Financial Sector – Hands on Modelling and Demo Sessions


Enclosing a YouTube video of Mr Kajal Ghose, Chief General Manager, State Bank of India delivering a philanthropic talk to an audience during Samaavesh, a cultural evening organized to promote young talent from the slums of Delhi. He spoke highly about the work of Asha and the longstanding relationship between S.B.I. and Asha.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cxxzeBef7zI


Thank you for your support and I look forward meeting up with you soon.

THIS IS A WEB CONFERENCE ONLY.  TIME OF WEB CONFERENCE LOCALLY IS BASED ON LIVE-STREAM START - PACIFIC DAYLIGHT TIME. DETAILS TO CONNECT TO LIVE-STREAM ARE INDICATED BELOW. 


Apache Spark is an open source processing engine built around speed, ease of use, and analytics. If you have large amounts of data that requires low latency processing that a typical Map Reduce program cannot provide, Spark is the alternative.


Spark performs at speeds up to 100 times faster than Map Reduce for iterative algorithms or interactive data mining. Spark provides in-memory cluster computing for lightning fast speed and supports Java, Scala, and Python APIs for ease of development. Spark allows data scientists to build models quickly and supports iterative jobs on distributed datasets. This means more people can apply deep intelligence into applications to make everything smarter, including the Internet of Things (IoT), machine learning, web, mobile, social, business process and more.
Do you believe in the value of Spark, in the speed, efficiency and flexibility of this in-memory compute engine? IBM does.  Emphatically.


That's why we're committed to do everything we can to accelerate the adoption of Spark for enterprise analytics, where Spark promises seemingly unlimited value. On June 15, 2015, IBM will host a Spark Community event in San Francisco, California: IBM | Spark - The Start of Something Big in Data and Design. There will be a live demo showcase, refreshments, and a Town Hall discussion featuring some of the most trail-blazing data scientists in today's Spark Community, including:
   Edd Dumbill, VP Strategy, Silicon Valley Data Science
•    Mike Tamir, Chief Science Officer & VP of Data Science & Education at Galvanize
•    Fernando Perez, Staff Scientist at Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory & Founding Investigator of the Berkeley Institute for Data Science
•    Haoyuan Li, CEO and Founder of Tachyon Nexus
•    Shankar Venkataraman, Distinguished Engineer & CTO, IBM Analytics Platform at IBM
•    Paco Nathan, Director, Community Evangelism, Databricks

Spark Community members will also deliver 5-minute lightning talks to describe exciting projects they're working on.

We will provide a livestream presentation of what these Spark leaders have to say.

Live Streaming Link:

http://www.ibm.com/analytics/us/en/technology/spark/

Scroll down to "Can't attend in Person"?  Sign up for a reminder and add it to your calendar.

Link to Spark Fundamentals Course in Big Data University

http://bigdatauniversity.com/bdu-wp/bdu-course/spark-fundamentals/

Happy Sparkling.

Thank you,

Tushar Kale

column3:
THIS IS A GLOBAL ON-LINE HACKATHON THAT BEGINS MAY 23, 2016 AND NOW ENDS AUGUST 23, 2016.  SUBMISSIONS DUE AUGUST 23rd BY 5:00 PM EST. 

We’re extending the hackathon deadline to August 23 - that’s 20 additional days to build your Spark enterprise app. (View the revised competition calendar HERE.  We're giving you more time because....

We’re adding new enterprise data resources to the site and we want to give you a chance to incorporate these into your projects, if you so choose.  Our awesome data co-sponsors Yelp and Uncharted Software have generously shared some of their enterprise data sets for you to use during the hackathon.

Yelp’s data includes 2.2M reviews by 552K users for 77K businesses. The Uncharted data includes Bitcoin network transactions from processing the Bitcoin blockchain as of mid-2014 and Amazon product reviews from 1995 through 2003. For a fuller description and data access, visit our resources page.

Uncharted Software also has a couple cool Spark data visualization libraries you should check out: Salt and SparkPipe.

And, in case you’d like to weigh the effects of weather on business operations, we’re also offering access to the full suite of Weather Company APIs for the duration of the hackathon.

Finally, if you’re looking for a hosting solution for your Spark app, we’re now offering extended Bluemix trials for all hackathon participants. Using Bluemix services to build your project is totally optional, but might be a good way to get your app up and running — particularly with the IBM Analytics for Apache Spark service.

You can request your extended Bluemix trial code here.  For all hackathon participants, trials will extend through November 1, 2016. Now go forth and optimize for the enterprise!

---------------------

Build an Apache Spark application to address a real business problem or core concern related to customer care, marketing, risk management or operations. Join IBM and Devpost for a global hackathon using Apache Spark Makers Build.  There are $100,000 in cash prizes.  Submissions can be sent in up to August 23rd.

Participation Details: To participate in the global virtual hackathon, you can register here.  Please review all registration guidelines.

For the hack, you will apply Apache Spark's powerful analytics capabilities to enterprise and other relevant data so data scientists and software developers can build an analytics or mobile/web app that tackles a key business problem in marketing, customer case, operations or risk management.  The grand prize is $50,000, and the top three winners each get a meeting with the judge or
Spark community expert of their choice; the judging panel includes data experts from Tesla, Netflix, and Silicon Valley Data Science.

Go to apachespark.devpost.com for full details and registration.  Please review all registration rules.

Questions?

We're here to help. If you have any questions about the hackathon, post on the discussion forum or email support@devpost.com and we'll respond as soon as we can.

column3:
In this inaugural MeetUp we will present for discussion a couple of topics on the benefit of NOSQL to the Banking and Finance sector. 

After an introduction to the MarkLogic NOSQL platform, our sponsors, we will present…

“How NOSQL Can Address Record Retention and Compliance Challenges in the Banking and Finance Sectors”. New online interaction channels are producing massive amounts of data and regulators are demanding the archiving of…everything! How do you query across all these records? And how do you not go broke in doing so?

“Schema on Read in Financial Services”. To meet regulatory requirements whilst undergoing extensive cost reduction programs, Financial Services Organizations need disruptive technologies to centrally store their data and provide real time and batch cross-asset views whilst maintaining the integrity of the source system format. Learn how MarkLogic excels in the role of trade and reference data hub absorbing multiple varieties of source data formats “as is” and dynamically transforming them to meet the expectations of multiple client applications.

Our guest presenter will be Rupert Brown, Chief Technology Officer, Banking and Finance, MarkLogic.

Contact on the evening is Sue Landers, Regional Manager Australia & New Zealand.  0410 563 211


We will be serving drinks and a light snack.
column13: The York. Level 2 99 York St, Sydney
column17: Inaugural MeetUp: Introduction to MarkLogic and discussion on NOSQL in B&F

column3:
Hi, all.

Please lock in this date for the 2nd Sydney MarkLogic NOSQL MeetUp.


Two topics at this session:

1. Making Hadoop Better with NoSQL.

Hadoop has become popular because it is designed to cheaply store that data in the Hadoop Distributed File System(HDFS) and run large-scale MapReduce jobs for batch analysis. However Hadoop is not designed for low latency transactions required for real-time interactive applications, or applications that require enterprise features such as government-grade security and high availability and disaster recovery. Even as the Hadoop ecosystem continues to evolve, the real benefits of Hadoop are enhanced when running alongside an enterprise-grade database.

2. The Requirements of an Enterprise NoSQL platform.


As more and more businesses look towards NoSQL as providing a better platform choice over traditional RDBMS to support business agility, they soon discover a myriad of offerings all pro-porting to deliver on Big Data challenges. However, quite soon small pilots evolve and developers being to encounter coding complexity as they attempt resolve lacking database features which they take for granted from their mature enterprise RDBMS equivalents. 
We will discuss the common enterprise feature challenges and what differentiates an Enterprise NoSQL platform to highlight the pitfalls and considerations of new deployments.

Thanks, James.
column17: Making Hadoop Better with NoSQL.

column3:
Hi all,

this month we will be co-hosting our MeetUp with the  "Big Data for the Banking & Finance sector" Meetup group, for a "NoSQL" / "Big Data" themed event.


This July, we are privileged to have presentations from two thought leaders in security, suspicious activity monitoring and intelligence analysis. Drawing from real-world cases, they will each present a 30-minute thought provoking session on the trends in this fascinating and rapidly evolving area of technology.


"Organisations of all types need to observe behavior, activities, and other changing information over time – and generate actionable intelligence that lets them intervene to keep their customers, the public, or their businesses safe from harm.


• Law enforcement organizations perform suspicious activity monitoring as a foundational part of police and detective work


• Financial services institutions improve oversight with “know your customer” (KYC), anti-money-laundering, and trader surveillance initiatives


• National defence and security agencies “connect the dots” in disparate data to prevent terrorist attacks


• Healthcare and insurance organizations look for potential claims fraud


• Nearly every industry has teams focusing on cyber-crime and cyber-defence


In all cases, it is crucial to integrate data from a variety of heterogeneous sources – as fast as possible – and provide alerts on unusual activities to the people who need to know and respond. Join us as we discuss how to address this imperative."


Our presenters will be Billy Sokol and James Clippinger.


Billy is an industry expert and thought leader in data management, program leadership, solution design, analysis and business process reengineering for defense, security and public safety and has worked with dozens of agencies in over ten countries. He has over 20 years in enterprise technology delivery and management, with deep experience in defense, security & and public safety.


James Clippinger is the Director of Global Technical Services at MarkLogic. James has served as chief data engineer on several US government projects. Prior to MarkLogic, James was a senior search architect at Verity and Autonomy and a consultant at Hamiltonian Solutions. As part of his graduate research at Dartmouth College, he designed algorithms for parallel disk systems, implemented code for optimal parallel fast Fourier transforms, and researched parallel software optimization with Sun Microsystems’ HPC group.


I hope you can join us for these presentations from two extremely knowledgeable experts on this fascinating and highly relevant topic.

Complementary food and drinks will be served.
column17: Data Sharing for the Paranoid - What Financial Services is learning from Govt

column3:
Hi everyone,

This month's meet up will include presentations from two NoSQL experts.

Daniel Holgate, a Senior Sales Engineer at MarkLogic Australia, will be presenting on building a demo with NoSQL in just 15 minutes.   

Watch us build a live prototype using MarkLogic, combining structured and unstructured data in ways you’ve never seen before to get more insight and discovery. Along the way we'll talk about how Enterprise NoSQL can solve your most difficult data problems. 

In the next session, Jason Hunter, MarkLogic's CTO for Asia-Pacific, will explain how MarkLogic works on the inside.

How can MarkLogic do what it does? What black magic lets an Enterprise NoSQL database like MarkLogic load a variety of XML and JSON data with different schemas, then run super fast ad hoc queries against the data without having to know in advance either the shape of the data or the style of the queries? It seems completely impossible, but it's real, its not even that complicated, and yet it fundamentally changes the game for databases.

I hope you can join us for these presentations from two extremely knowledgeable experts on this fascinating and highly relevant topic.

Complementary food and drinks will be served. 

The doors will open at 6 pm for a 6:30 pm start time.
column17: Everything You Wanted To Know About MarkLogic, But Were Too Afraid To Ask

THIS IS A WEB CONFERENCE ONLY - TIME INDICATED IS LOCAL START TIME. SEE BELOW FOR DETAILS.

IBM InfoSphere Streams V3.2 (referred to as Streams) delivers a highly scalable, agile software infrastructure to perform in-motion analytics on a wide variety of relational and non-relational data types that enter the enterprise at unprecedented volumes and speed, and from thousands of real-time sources. Streams V3.2 includes new features and functions designed to instantly analyze and fuse massive volumes of data and integrates with existing infrastructures. It delivers new capabilities to improve usability, support enterprise readiness, and streamline enterprise integration.

WHAT:

The following new features and functions, which will be covered during the Streams Developer Conference:

Usability:
• Remote Development with Streams Studio for Windows and Linux
• User Defined Parallelism
• Java Streams development simplification

Enterprise readiness:
• Operational Decision Management adapter for business rules
• Access to application data using Representational State Transfer (REST)

Enterprise integration:
• MQTT adapters
• Hadoop Big SQL support
• HP Vertica Analytic Database support

Who should attend:

The event assumes you are familiar with Streams. If you are not, please either try the Big Data University Streams course or review some of the Streams videos on YouTube.

WHEN:

Webcast on Thursday November 14, 2013 from 10:00AM to 6:00PM U.S. Eastern Standard Time.

WHERE:

The webcast will be recorded and posted to Big Data University (BDU) at the following Big Data University course ID.

NOTE: There will be no physical location for this meetup and it will all be online.

To get more info, download presentations, get detailed agenda and to register for the event check out the BDU Streams Developers Virtual Conference landing page.

The detailed agenda will be posted at the BDU class/event page after Oct 31.

Please join us on the live LotusLive meeting webcast. The conference ID is 2058889. Audio in listen only mode will be available on the webcast.

To ask questions during Q&A periods, please use the following conference information:

USA Toll-Free: 1-888-426-6840

USA Caller Paid: 1-215-861-6239

For Other Countries call in numbers use this link.

CALLING ALL DEVELOPERS .... JOIN THE BIG DATA FOR SOCIAL GOOD CHALLENGE

Big data exists in just about everything we use and do. It comes from phones, cars, roads, power lines, waterways, food crates, and innumerable other items you’d never think of as computers. This data speaks volumes about our collective behavior and society – so let’s use it to do something incredible! IBM invites developers and data enthusiasts to take a deep dive into real world civic issues using big data and the IBM Bluemix Analytics for Hadoop service. Analyze one of our curated datasets or bring your own (provided it meets these requirements)! Use Hadoop and your data to create a clickable and interactive data visualization to highlight insights that you’ve found.

Ready to get started? $40,000 in prizes will be awarded....

Data Requirements: Your data visualization must analyze one or more datasets included in the curated list of datasets on the Data page OR meet the data size, content, and licensing requirements described on the Data page. The total size of the Datasets analyzed must be between 500MB - 7GB in size.

column3:
Your Invitation to a briefing on IBM's announcement to embed Apache® Spark™ into its Analytics platforms.

On June 15 in San Francisco, IBM made its most significant Open Source announcement since the 1990s, with a commitment to accelerate the adoption of Apache® Spark™ .

Spark is an open source processing engine built around speed, ease of use, and analytics. Spark performs at speeds up to 100 times faster than Hadoop for the Map Reduce function which is commonly used by Data Scientists for iterative algorithms or interactive data mining. Spark provides in-memory cluster computing for lightning fast speed and supports Java, Scala, and Python APIs for ease of development. Spark allows data scientists to build models quickly and supports iterative jobs on distributed datasets.

This meetup is targeted at Data scientists, developers, and anyone engaged with reporting and analytics.

At this meetup we will delve deeper into this announcement and provide you with guidance and materials to get started on Spark.

Agenda:

The event will start at 6:00pm sharp and conclude around 8:00pm

6:00pm - 7:00pm

- Recap of announcements made in San Francisco

-- IBM's Commitment to Spark

• Benefits of Apache Spark
• Demonstrations of common use cases for Spark
• IBM's innovations for Big Data, hybrid architecture, and Open Data Platform (ODP)
• Timeline for availability of Spark support in IBM's analytics platform

- Helping you get started with Spark
-- Spark education for free at Big Data University

-- Getting a hands-on start to Spark today with access to trial Spark code.

7:00pm - 8:00pm

- Networking drinks and nibbles

THIS MEETUP AND LIVE STREAMING IS US PACIFIC STANDARD TIME (PST). PLEASE CONVERT TO YOUR TIME ZONE.

On June 6, 2016, leading minds in data and analytics from Tesla, Netflix, Silicon Valley Data Science, and IBM will come together to demonstrate how open data and analytics technologies such as R, Spark, Python and more are forming a vibrant ecosystem.  The community has a shared goal of working with all data to build unexpected insights and launch new business applications.

The Apache Spark Maker Community Event will bring together data scientists, data engineers, data developers, and data designers June 6th @ 6pm at Galvanize, San Francisco. Here’s the plan:   

- The Big Reveal – New sample Apache Spark apps and tools

- Use Cases – Monsanto will share how they are using R and Spark to optimize their supply chain

- Learning Session - Hear from experts working on Spark projects and building the Spark ecosystem of open data and analytics technologies

- Networking Opportunity – Food, drinks and data, explore a Hall of Innovation showcasing Spark demos

Join us. Learn more here: 

Apache Spark Maker Community Event 

We realize you may not be able to attend in person, however, we are live streaming the event.  Register for the live stream and we'll send you a calendar update and login link.
column17: Apache Spark Maker Community Event

column3:
THIS IS A GLOBAL ON-LINE HACKATHON THAT BEGINS MAY 23, 2016 AND NOW ENDS AUGUST 23, 2016.  SUBMISSIONS DUE AUGUST 23rd BY 5:00 PM EST. 

We’re extending the hackathon deadline to August 23 - that’s 20 additional days to build your Spark enterprise app. (View the revised competition calendar HERE.  We're giving you more time because....

We’re adding new enterprise data resources to the site and we want to give you a chance to incorporate these into your projects, if you so choose.  Our awesome data co-sponsors Yelp and Uncharted Software have generously shared some of their enterprise data sets for you to use during the hackathon.

Yelp’s data includes 2.2M reviews by 552K users for 77K businesses. The Uncharted data includes Bitcoin network transactions from processing the Bitcoin blockchain as of mid-2014 and Amazon product reviews from 1995 through 2003. For a fuller description and data access, visit our resources page.

Uncharted Software also has a couple cool Spark data visualization libraries you should check out: Salt and SparkPipe.

And, in case you’d like to weigh the effects of weather on business operations, we’re also offering access to the full suite of Weather Company APIs for the duration of the hackathon.

Finally, if you’re looking for a hosting solution for your Spark app, we’re now offering extended Bluemix trials for all hackathon participants. Using Bluemix services to build your project is totally optional, but might be a good way to get your app up and running — particularly with the IBM Analytics for Apache Spark service.

You can request your extended Bluemix trial code here.  For all hackathon participants, trials will extend through November 1, 2016. Now go forth and optimize for the enterprise!

---------------------

Build an Apache Spark application to address a real business problem or core concern related to customer care, marketing, risk management or operations. Join IBM and Devpost for a global hackathon using Apache Spark Makers Build.  There are $100,000 in cash prizes.  Submissions can be sent in up to August 23rd.

Participation Details: To participate in the global virtual hackathon, you can register here.  Please review all registration guidelines.

For the hack, you will apply Apache Spark's powerful analytics capabilities to enterprise and other relevant data so data scientists and software developers can build an analytics or mobile/web app that tackles a key business problem in marketing, customer case, operations or risk management.  The grand prize is $50,000, and the top three winners each get a meeting with the judge or
Spark community expert of their choice; the judging panel includes data experts from Tesla, Netflix, and Silicon Valley Data Science.

Go to apachespark.devpost.com for full details and registration.  Please review all registration rules.

Questions?

We're here to help. If you have any questions about the hackathon, post on the discussion forum or email support@devpost.com and we'll respond as soon as we can.
column17: Show Us Your Apps - Apache Spark Maker Build Global Hackathon

column3:
IBM is offering a free proof of technology for clients and practitioners on Apache Spark, at the 2016 IDUG Tech Conference in Australia. This is a full day of education on Spark with hands-on exercises instructed in person by Spark experts. The course will provide a detail overview of Apache Spark with real world hands on examples of data wrangling and machine learning. The exercises will be done in Jupyter notebooks with publicly available datasets. Participants will use IBM’s fully managed free Cloud platform available for educational purposes.

Title:
Hands on Introduction to Apache Spark for Data Engineers, Data Scientist and Developers

Who should go:
Anyone interested in learning more about Apache Spark.

Prerequisite:
A working knowledge of Coding (Preferred Python and/or Scala), understand distributed computing, Spark and SQL.

What to expect:
Expect to spend a full day of lecture and hands on exercises attacking real-world data challenges using Apache Spark. In 8 hours you will learn the basic essentials of Apache Spark and why it's important to your organization. This workshop will focus on data wrangling and machine learning.

Full Day Agenda:

• 8:30am - 9:00am Registration, Welcome, Socialize 

• 9:00am - 10:00am Kick-off, Apache Spark Overview 

• 10:00am - 11:00am Lab 1, Hello Spark - Hands on Exercise 

• 11:00am - 12:00pm Apache Spark SQL Overview 

• 12:00pm - 1:00pm Lunch 

• 1:00pm - 2:00pm   Lab 2, Spark SQL - Hands on Exercises   

• 2:00pm - 3:00pm Overview of Data Science & Machine Learning with Apache Spark 

• 3:00pm - 4:00pm Lab 3, Machine Learning with Spark - Hands on Exercises 

• 4:00pm - 4:30pm Wrap Up - Feedback from Attendees

More details about IDUG Australia 2016 and registration is available at: http://www.idug.org/p/cm/ld/fid=1051
column17: Apache SPARK Day @ IDUG Australia (Sept 13, 2016)
