THIS IS A WEB CONFERENCE ONLY.  TIME OF WEB CONFERENCE LOCALLY IS BASED ON LIVE-STREAM START - PACIFIC DAYLIGHT TIME. DETAILS TO CONNECT TO LIVE-STREAM ARE INDICATED BELOW. 

Apache Spark is an open source processing engine built around speed, ease of use, and analytics. If you have large amounts of data that requires low latency processing that a typical Map Reduce program cannot provide, Spark is the alternative.

Spark performs at speeds up to 100 times faster than Map Reduce for iterative algorithms or interactive data mining. Spark provides in-memory cluster computing for lightning fast speed and supports Java, Scala, and Python APIs for ease of development. Spark allows data scientists to build models quickly and supports iterative jobs on distributed datasets. This means more people can apply deep intelligence into applications to make everything smarter, including the Internet of Things (IoT), machine learning, web, mobile, social, business process and more. 

Do you believe in the value of Spark, in the speed, efficiency and flexibility of this in-memory compute engine? IBM does.  Emphatically.That's why we're committed to do everything we can to accelerate the adoption of Spark for enterprise analytics, where Spark promises seemingly unlimited value.

On June 15, 2015, IBM will host a Spark Community event in San Francisco, California: IBM | Spark - The Start of Something Big in Data and Design. There will be a live demo showcase, refreshments, and a Town Hall discussion featuring some of the most trail-blazing data scientists in today's Spark Community, including:

•  Edd Dumbill, VP Strategy, Silicon Valley Data Science
•  Mike Tamir, Chief Science Officer & VP of Data Science & Education at Galvanize
•   Fernando Perez, Staff Scientist at Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory & Founding Investigator of the Berkeley Institute for Data Science
•   Haoyuan Li, CEO and Founder of Tachyon Nexus
•   Shankar Venkataraman, Distinguished Engineer & CTO, IBM Analytics Platform at IBM
•   Paco Nathan, Director, Community Evangelism, Databricks

Spark Community members will also deliver 5-minute lightning talks to describe exciting projects they're working on.

We will provide a livestream presentation of what these Spark leaders have to say.

Live Streaming Link:

To get additional details about Spark you can sign up now for a reminder at:

http://www.ibm.com/analytics/us/en/technology/spark/

Scroll down to "Can't attend in Person"?  Sign up for a reminder and add it to your calendar.

http://bigdatauniversity.com/bdu-wp/bdu-course/spark-fundamentals/

http://www.ibm.com/analytics/us/en/technology/spark/

Happy Sparking.

column3:
THIS IS A GLOBAL ON-LINE HACKATHON THAT BEGINS MAY 23, 2016 AND NOW ENDS AUGUST 23, 2016.  SUBMISSIONS DUE AUGUST 23rd BY 5:00 PM EST. 

We’re extending the hackathon deadline to August 23 - that’s 20 additional days to build your Spark enterprise app. (View the revised competition calendar HERE.  We're giving you more time because....

We’re adding new enterprise data resources to the site and we want to give you a chance to incorporate these into your projects, if you so choose.  Our awesome data co-sponsors Yelp and Uncharted Software have generously shared some of their enterprise data sets for you to use during the hackathon.

Yelp’s data includes 2.2M reviews by 552K users for 77K businesses. The Uncharted data includes Bitcoin network transactions from processing the Bitcoin blockchain as of mid-2014 and Amazon product reviews from 1995 through 2003. For a fuller description and data access, visit our resources page.

Uncharted Software also has a couple cool Spark data visualization libraries you should check out: Salt and SparkPipe.

And, in case you’d like to weigh the effects of weather on business operations, we’re also offering access to the full suite of Weather Company APIs for the duration of the hackathon.

Finally, if you’re looking for a hosting solution for your Spark app, we’re now offering extended Bluemix trials for all hackathon participants. Using Bluemix services to build your project is totally optional, but might be a good way to get your app up and running — particularly with the IBM Analytics for Apache Spark service.

You can request your extended Bluemix trial code here.  For all hackathon participants, trials will extend through November 1, 2016. Now go forth and optimize for the enterprise!

---------------------

Build an Apache Spark application to address a real business problem or core concern related to customer care, marketing, risk management or operations. Join IBM and Devpost for a global hackathon using Apache Spark Makers Build.  There are $100,000 in cash prizes.  Submissions can be sent in up to August 23rd.

Participation Details: To participate in the global virtual hackathon, you can register here.  Please review all registration guidelines.

For the hack, you will apply Apache Spark's powerful analytics capabilities to enterprise and other relevant data so data scientists and software developers can build an analytics or mobile/web app that tackles a key business problem in marketing, customer case, operations or risk management.  The grand prize is $50,000, and the top three winners each get a meeting with the judge or
Spark community expert of their choice; the judging panel includes data experts from Tesla, Netflix, and Silicon Valley Data Science.

Go to apachespark.devpost.com for full details and registration.  Please review all registration rules.

Questions?

We're here to help. If you have any questions about the hackathon, post on the discussion forum or email support@devpost.com and we'll respond as soon as we can.

THE BIG DATA FOR SOCIAL GOOD CHALLENGE BEGINS NOVEMBER 10, 2014 AND CONTINUES TO MARCH 3, 2015. 

CALLING ALL DEVELOPERS .... JOIN THE BIG DATA FOR SOCIAL GOOD CHALLENGE

Big data exists in just about everything we use and do. It comes from phones, cars, roads, power lines, waterways, food crates, and innumerable other items you’d never think of as computers. This data speaks volumes about our collective behavior and society – so let’s use it to do something incredible! IBM invites developers and data enthusiasts to take a deep dive into real world civic issues using big data and the IBM Bluemix Analytics for Hadoop service. Analyze one of our curated datasets or bring your own (provided it meets these requirements)! Use Hadoop and your data to create a clickable and interactive data visualization to highlight insights that you’ve found.

Ready to get started? $40,000 in prizes will be awarded....

Register here:http://ibmhadoop.challengepost.com/

What to Create: Participants must create a working, clickable, and interactive data visualization utilizing the Analytics for Hadoop service on IBM Bluemix.

Data Requirements: Your data visualization must analyze one or more datasets included in the curated list of datasets on the Data page OR meet the data size, content, and licensing requirements described on the Data page. The total size of the Datasets analyzed must be between 500MB - 7GB in size.

Check out the requirements then go get your IBM Bluemix extended promo code and check out the datasets!

Hola!

El Jueves 22 de Octubre vamos a organizar un nuevo Meetup de Spark y BlueMix.


Tenemos la suerte de contar en Madrid con Chris Fregly que es un ingeniero del IBM Spark Technology Center en San Francisco. (Principle Data Solutions Engineer @ IBM Spark Technology Center https://www.linkedin.com/in/cfregly )

El Meetup tendrá la parte de Spark en Inglés.

Será por la tarde empezando a las 18:30, para que los que trabajáis vengáis.


Además hablaremos de un tema muy interesante IBM Bluemix: Que es una plataforma en la nube basada en estándares abiertos para crear, gestionar y ejecutar todo tipo de aplicaciones: web, móvil, Big Data, dispositivos inteligentes…


AGENDA:


18.30 - 19:00 Introducción a la plataforma Bluemix ,  @ManuAtIBM y @jmordax. (en español


19:00 - 20:00  Spark, @cfregly "How Spark beat Hadoop@100TB Sort: Optimize Shuffle+Network+Nett­y+CPU Cache aware". Deep Dive into How Spark Beat Hadoop @ 100TB Daytona GraySort Challenge; code-level Deep Dive into the optimizations that allowed Spark to win the Daytona GraySort Challenge. (en inglés)

20:00 - 20:30 IBM Open Data Platform y Ecosistema Hadop @luisrei Además de Spark, hay otros componentes de Hadoop que también están evolucionado. mencionaremos: Text Analytics, Big Sql y Big Sheets. (en español)


20:30 - 21:00 Spark as a Service @Bluemix. Una de las grandes novedades de este año es la posibilidad de usar el motor de analítica Spark como servicio desde la nube. Cool!!!  Apache Spark Starter . (en español)


Brainstorming

Pizza y cerves para comentar entre todos la jugada...

column3:
Hemos organizado un meet up de última hora, con Lightbend (antes conocidos como Typesafe)

Contaremos con Jamie Allen (Senior Director of Strategic Global Architecture, Lightbend) que nos hablará sobre el uso de Scala con proyectos Apache relevantes en el área del tiempo real.

Habrá pizzas y bebida como es habitual. No habrá laboratorio. Os esperamos!
--------------------------------------------------

* Bio: Senior Director of Strategic Global Architecture for Lightbend, responsible for the enablement of customers strategically adopting the Lightbend Reactive Platform. He is the author of Effective Akka (O’Reilly), and the co-author of the upcoming Reactive Design Patterns (Manning). Jamie is a computer languages enthusiast who enjoys writing performant code that most efficiently leverages the resources at hand.

* Talk abstract: There are more channels, data sources and clients for our systems today than ever before, and that number is only growing as more devices and people become connected. As a result, the way that we process data and events has had to evolve, specifically with respect to real-time analytics. This talk will explore how Scala has shaped this transformation, and how to leverage today and tomorrow's tooling to make sense of the world around us instantaneously. We will look at Apache projects such as Spark, Gearpump and Kafka, and discuss how they are best used with Scala.

THIS MEETUP AND LIVE STREAMING IS US PACIFIC STANDARD TIME (PST). PLEASE CONVERT TO YOUR TIME ZONE.

On June 6, 2016, leading minds in data and analytics from Tesla, Netflix, Silicon Valley Data Science, and IBM will come together to demonstrate how open data and analytics technologies such as R, Spark, Python and more are forming a vibrant ecosystem.  The community has a shared goal of working with all data to build unexpected insights and launch new business applications.

The Apache Spark Maker Community Event will bring together data scientists, data engineers, data developers, and data designers June 6th @ 6pm at Galvanize, San Francisco. Here’s the plan:   

- The Big Reveal – New sample Apache Spark apps and tools

- Use Cases – Monsanto will share how they are using R and Spark to optimize their supply chain

- Learning Session - Hear from experts working on Spark projects and building the Spark ecosystem of open data and analytics technologies

- Networking Opportunity – Food, drinks and data, explore a Hall of Innovation showcasing Spark demos

Join us. Learn more here: 

Apache Spark Maker Community Event 

We realize you may not be able to attend in person, however, we are live streaming the event.  Register for the live stream and we'll send you a calendar update and login link.

column3:
Join The Brussels Data Science Community, Spark Summit Europe attendees, and Spark ML and machine learning experts Nick Pentreath and Jean-Francois Puget for a talk on an Apache Spark–based, end-to-end machine learning system. A round of Spark and machine learning lightning talks will follow.

Many resources are available for building basic recommendation models using Spark. But how does a practitioner go from the basics to creating an end-to-end machine learning system, including deployment and management of models for real-time serving? In this session, we’ll demonstrate how to build such a system based on Spark ML and Elasticsearch. In particular, we’ll focus on how to go from data ingestion to model training to a real-time predictive system.

Agenda

18:30 – Welcome, food and drink

18:40 – Update on the preparation and workshops of the Data4Good Hackathon, and Philippe Van Impe, founder, European Data Innovation Hub and the Brussels Data Science Community

18:50 – Introduction: Berni Schiefer, IBM Fellow

19:00 – Creating an end-to-end Recommender System with Spark ML: Nick Pentreath, principal engineer at the IBM Spark Technology Center, Apache Spark PMC member and author of Machine Learning with Spark, and Jean-François Puget, distinguished engineer at IBM and chief architect for IBM Analytics Solutions.

19:45 – Lightning talks: 10 minute Spark and machine learning discussions, including new projects from Belgium. Details are coming soon. 

20:45 – Networking and refreshments

PARKING - at GRAND PLACE
Rue Marché aux Herbes 104, 1000 Brussels
Boulevard de l'Impératrice - Keizerinlaan Brussels

column3:
Os invito al evento anual de IBM, de acceso gratuito y que tendrá lugar en el Palacio Municipal de Congresos de Madrid.


En este enlace podrás inscribirte, seleccionando las sesiones que más se ajusten a tu perfil -> http://www-05.ibm.com/es/businessconnect/

<a href="http://www-05.ibm.com/es/businessconnect/"></a>


IBM Business Connect el encuentro de innovación y transformación digital en que se darán cita más de 2.000 líderes de negocio y tecnología de las principales compañías, instituciones públicas, medios e influenciadores de nuestro país.

El desarrollo digital y capacidades como cloud, analítica avanzada, movilidad, Internet de las Cosas y especialmente los sistemas cognitivos, han creado el contexto tecnológico más potente que jamás hayamos conocido, acelerando la innovación y transformando los modelos de negocio y la relación con los clientes. El evento comenzará con una sesión plenaria en la que exploraremos las infinitas posibilidades que ofrece la nueva era cognitiva.


Contaremos con la presencia de Gonzalo Gortázar, CEO de Caixabank, Jay Bellissimo, General Manager de IBM Cognitive Solutions y uno de los mayores expertos mundiales en sistemas cognitivos, y Matthew Candy, Vice President y líder en Europa de IBM Interactive Experience.


A continuación, habrá 4 sesiones paralelas en las que abordaremos los retos de la transformación empresarial desde la perspectiva de cuatro roles que están protagonizando el cambio en las organizaciones: CEOs y líderes de estrategia, CIOs y responsables de tecnología, CMOs y responsables de experiencia de cliente y Desarrolladores y científicos de datos.


Contaremos además con un área de exposición en la que mostraremos las soluciones más innovadoras a través de demostraciones y casos de uso de nuestros partners tecnológicos.


Espero que sea de vuestro interés y nos veamos allí!! yo estaré en el stand de Data Science junto con Nacho Alonso (Experto técnico de España para Data Science Experience).

Learning” - JUAN TOMÁS GARCÍA MOLINA, Data Solution Manager en Open Sistemas y Google Developer Expert for cloud.

Uno de los problemas con los que nos enfrentamos a diario es el exceso de
información y la diversidad de las fuentes. Juan Tomás nos enseñará una forma de encontrar y clasificar la información/conocimiento que te interesa y crear un grafo de conocimiento personalizado, que crece y se va alimentando automáticamente permitiendonos descubrir nuevos contenidos que nos interesan y organizándolo.

Este meet up tratará sobre SPARK, y lo haremos de la mano de una de nuestras Spark Committers que viene directamente desde IBM Spark Technology Center en San Francisco… No os lo podeís perder! #IBMSpark17

Para los que no podaís estar en persona, retransmitiremos aquí el meet up: https://www.youtube.com/c/BigDataCognitiveMeetup

• Introduccion – VICTORIA GÓMEZ, Líder de ventas de Big Data Sales en IBM Europa

• Intro to Machine Learning and PySpark- HOLDEN KARAU, Apache Spark committer at IBM’s Spark Technology center ( http://www.spark.tc/ ). She is specialized in PySpark and Machine Learning.

• Casos prácticos de uso de Spark - JUAN TOMÁS GARCÍA MOLINA, Data Solution Manager en OpenSistemas y Google Developer Expert for cloud

• Comparativas de bibliotecas de Machine Learning (H20, SystemML, MLlib) – FELIPE ORTEGA, Assistant Professor ETSIT- URJC. Co-founder, Data Science Lab. Academic Director Master in Data Science at URJC

• SORTEO DE LIBROS y firma por Holden - “Learning Spark” editado por O’Reilly http://shop.oreilly.com/product/0636920046967.do

Y para terminar Pizzas y Bebidas patrocinadas por OpenSistemas…... OS ESPERAMOS!!

¿Cómo participar en el SORTEO y ganar uno de los libros  “Learning Spark” de Holden que O’Reilly nos ha enviado? Debes hacer 3 cosas:


- Debes ser miembro registrado de nuestro meetup “Big Data developers in Madrid”

- Sigue @IBM_es y retwitea el siguiente tweet: https://twitter.com/IBM_ES/status/846309430367080448

- Twitea con el hashtag #IBMSpark17: cuantos más tweets sobre IBM y su compromiso con Spark y Big Data envíes más posibilidades tendrás de ganar uno de los libros que sortearemos!

Dear All,

Digital October is organizing a free event called Data Science week. It will take place from 24th to 30th of August in Moscow, at Bersenevskaya Nab. 6

In order to attend you have to register at the site:

http://digitaloctober.ru/ru/events/data_science_week_2015

On 28th, the whole day will be dedicated to Apache Spark.

Agenda for my presentation will be as following:

Apache Spark development vector 
                Brief overview of the new functionality recently added to Apache Spark.
                Version 1.4 - SparkR, new interface for job monitoring and visualization, ML pipelines
                Version 1.5  - Project Tungsteen, improvements in DataFrame API, imprpovements in Catalyst (SQL Optimizer), new Machine Learning algorithms, Spark Streaming. 


Whoever is interested in my presentations or in any of the other presentations planned for the week are welcome to register and attend. 

Дорогие участники!

Цифровой Октябрь организует бесплатное мероприятие под названием "Data Science Week", которое пройдет с 24го по 30е Августа с 18-00

Чтобы поучавствовать, нужно зарегистрироваться на сайте мероприятия:

http://digitaloctober.ru/ru/events/data_science_week_2015 

28го Августа весь вечер будет посвящен Apache Spark. 

Краткое содержание моего выступления 28го:

Apache Spark - направление развития.
Краткий обзор функционала и новых возможностей Apache Spark.
                Версия 1.4 - SparkR, новый интерфейс визуализации и мониторинга, ML pipelines
                Версия 1.5  - Project Tungsteen, улучшения в DataFrame API, улучшения в Catalyst (SQL Optimizer), новые алгоритмы машинного обучения, Spark Streaming. 


Все, кого может заинтересовать мое выступление, или выступления других спикеров, приглашены зарегистрироваться и посетить мероприятие.

Join The Brussels Data Science Community, Spark Summit Europe attendees, and Spark ML and machine learning experts Nick Pentreath and Jean-Francois Puget for a talk on an Apache Spark–based, end-to-end machine learning system. A round of Spark and machine learning lightning talks will follow.

Many resources are available for building basic recommendation models using Spark. But how does a practitioner go from the basics to creating an end-to-end machine learning system, including deployment and management of models for real-time serving? In this session, we’ll demonstrate how to build such a system based on Spark ML and Elasticsearch. In particular, we’ll focus on how to go from data ingestion to model training to a real-time predictive system.

Agenda

18:30 – Welcome, food and drink

18:40 – Update on the preparation and workshops of the Data4Good Hackathon, and Philippe Van Impe, founder, European Data Innovation Hub and the Brussels Data Science Community

18:50 – Introduction: Berni Schiefer, IBM Fellow

19:00 – Creating an end-to-end Recommender System with Spark ML: Nick Pentreath, principal engineer at the IBM Spark Technology Center, Apache Spark PMC member and author of Machine Learning with Spark, and Jean-François Puget, distinguished engineer at IBM and chief architect for IBM Analytics Solutions.

19:45 – Lightning talks: 10 minute Spark and machine learning discussions, including new projects from Belgium. Details are coming soon. 

20:45 – Networking and refreshments

PARKING - at GRAND PLACE
Rue Marché aux Herbes 104, 1000 Brussels
Boulevard de l'Impératrice - Keizerinlaan Brussels

WebCast @IBM IIC Ehningen: Introducing Cloudant - the Do-More NoSQL Data Layer

Note: This is a WebCast only since we want that everybody benefits from the opportunity that Chris is in Europe.

Christopher Bienko is WW expert on Data Management in the Cloud and everybody will have the chance to ask questions in this session.


Technical deep-dives will follow this session.

Cloudant is based on Apache CouchDB but enhanced in serveral ways.

Cloudant is an innovator in data management, providing a NoSQL, JSON database-as-a-service (DBaaS) that enables developers of fast-growing Web and mobile applications to focus on developing their applications without the need to manage database infrastructure or growth. In this one hour introduction to Cloundant, we'll examine how Cloudant accelerates and extends IBM’s Big Data & Analytics portfolio. The agenda includes a review of the NoSQL database landscape, as well as specific features, use cases, and Cloudant customer success stories. Come and equip yourself with an understanding of this disruptive new technology for the world of databases.

Big data exists in just about everything we use and do. It comes from phones, cars, roads, power lines, waterways, food crates, and innumerable other items you’d never think of as computers. Title: A leap forward for SQL on Hadoop

Abstract:

We will discuss the various SQL on Hadoop alternatives and explore why such
technologies have become an area of keen interest for many organizations.
We will discuss various alternatives such as Hive and Impala and their
pros/cons.  We will share customer use cases for Warehouse Modernization
and the role of SQL for Hadoop in this space, as well as discuss
performance characteristics of SQL on Hadoop when running common query
workloads. We will provide an intro to Big SQL and demo. Big SQL  delivers
some exciting capabilities including comprehensive SQL functionality that
leverages advanced SQL compiler/runtime all with low latency and high
performance.

Learn more about Big SQL here:
http://www.livestream.com/newchannel/popoutplayer?channel=ibmiod&clip=pla_e4b28ad8-f647-4a02-88ad-6679b78f7e8b&time=1481
. Check out the SQL on Hadoop white paper:
http://www-01.ibm.com/common/ssi/cgi-bin/ssialias?subtype=WH&infotype=SA&appname=SWGE_SW_SW_USEN&htmlfid=SWW14019USEN&attachment=SWW14019USEN.PDF

Speaker:

Claus Samuelsen, IBM

Claus Samuelsen has many years experience within data management, and has for more than 3 years had big data as his primary focus area.
Working with customers all over Europe devolping Hadoop based solutions in several industries from banking, insurance, healthcare to automotive and gaming.

--------------

Title: Apache Cassandra & Apache Spark for Time Series Data (45 minutes)

Presenter: Patrick McFadin

Bio: Patrick McFadin is regarded as one of the experts of Apache Cassandra and data modeling techniques. As the Chief Evangelist for Apache Cassandra and consultant for DataStax, he has helped build some of the largest deployments in the world. Previous to DataStax, he was Chief Architect at Hobsons, an education services company. There, he spoke often on Web Application design and performance.

Synopsis: Apache Cassandra has proven to be one of the best solutions for storing and retrieving time series data at high velocity and high volume. This talk will discuss how the storage model of Cassandra is ideal for time series use cases and go over examples of how to best build data models. We will also cover pairing Apache Spark with Apache Cassandra to create a real time data analytics platform. Attendees will leave this session knowing how to build their own real time data analytics platform, and will be shocked at how easy it is!

THIS IS A WEB CONFERENCE ONLY.  TIME OF WEB CONFERENCE LOCALLY IS BASED ON LIVE-STREAM START - PACIFIC DAYLIGHT TIME. DETAILS TO CONNECT TO LIVE-STREAM ARE INDICATED BELOW. 

Apache Spark is an open source processing engine built around speed, ease of use, and analytics. If you have large amounts of data that requires low latency processing that a typical Map Reduce program cannot provide, Spark is the alternative.

Spark performs at speeds up to 100 times faster than Map Reduce for iterative algorithms or interactive data mining. Spark provides in-memory cluster computing for lightning fast speed and supports Java, Scala, and Python APIs for ease of development. Spark allows data scientists to build models quickly and supports iterative jobs on distributed datasets. This means more people can apply deep intelligence into applications to make everything smarter, including the Internet of Things (IoT), machine learning, web, mobile, social, business process and more. 

Do you believe in the value of Spark, in the speed, efficiency and flexibility of this in-memory compute engine? IBM does.  Emphatically.That's why we're committed to do everything we can to accelerate the adoption of Spark for enterprise analytics, where Spark promises seemingly unlimited value.

On June 15, 2015, IBM will host a Spark Community event in San Francisco, California: IBM | Spark - The Start of Something Big in Data and Design. There will be a live demo showcase, refreshments, and a Town Hall discussion featuring some of the most trail-blazing data scientists in today's Spark Community, including:
  Edd Dumbill, VP Strategy, Silicon Valley Data Science
•  Mike Tamir, Chief Science Officer & VP of Data Science & Education at Galvanize
•   Fernando Perez, Staff Scientist at Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory & Founding Investigator of the Berkeley Institute for Data Science
•   Haoyuan Li, CEO and Founder of Tachyon Nexus
•   Shankar Venkataraman, Distinguished Engineer & CTO, IBM Analytics Platform at IBM
•   Paco Nathan, Director, Community Evangelism, Databricks

Spark Community members will also deliver 5-minute lightning talks to describe exciting projects they're working on.

We will provide a livestream presentation of what these Spark leaders have to say.

column3:
I'm very pleased have my Friend Robert from DataArtisans in Berlin to start the Munich-based Apache Flink Meetup group.

Please consider joining there as well:

http://www.meetup.com/Apache-Flink-Meetup-Munich/events/226534681/


For the initial event, we have two very interesting talks.

We're pleased to welcome Robert of data Artisans, an avid Flink developer, who will introduce you to Stream & Batch Processing with Apache Flink. The second talk will be held by Matthias J. Sax of Humboldt University Berlin, who will dive deeper into the bowels of processing windows on data streams with Flink. 

Preliminary Schedule

• 18.30 – Talk 1 (Robert): Stream & Batch Processing with Apache Flink

• 19.30 – Dinner Time & socialising

• 20.30 – Talk 2 (Matthias): Feeding a Squirrel in Time -- Windows in Apache Flink

As always, this Meetup is free for all attendees & Food and Beverages are provided by our host Inovex GmbH

Abstracts

Stream & Batch Processing with Apache Flink

Apache Flink is an open-source framework for distributed data analysis. Flink is one of the most active big data projects in the Apache Software Foundation and has more than 100 contributors. The core of Flink is a distributed stream processing engine that enables low-latency and high throughput data processing. Flink has high-level APIs for both stream and batch processing.
In the first part of this talk we will briefly look at the history of Flink and then present the APIs and different use cases. Here we will also see how it can be deployed in practice.
In the second part, we will look at the streaming execution engine that powers Flink. Here we will see what makes it tick and also what distinguishes it from other approaches, such as the mini-batch execution model. We will cover Flink's architecture and design decisions that result in Flink's unique set of features.

Feeding a Squirrel in Time -- Windows in Apache Flink 

In data stream processing, the dimension of time is a crucial aspect with regard to runtime effects as well as query semantics. There are two different time concepts: event-time also called occurrence time, ie, the time in which an event happens in the real world, and processing-time, ie, the time in which an events gets processed by the system. Both time dimensions deliver different semantics if used to specify windows on a data stream.
In this talk, we give an introduction to time-base data stream
processing and cover Flink's approach to handle windowing. Flink offers a broad range of (non-/)deterministic count-, time-, and custom-windows while offering a simple API to express those.

Please note that this event has also been posted here: http://www.meetup.com/inovex-munich/events/226206381/

We would like to thank our host Inovex GmbH for providing the location, food and drinks.
column17: Stream & Batch Processing with Apache Flink and Event-Time Windowing

Bio:

He started his carrier on Avionics real time simulation as a Research Fellow in India’s Defense organization. Further joining IBM , he has worked on various technologies involving java virtual machine, operating system , virtualization and cloud OS management.

He has co-authored books on virtualization and cloud system management. He loves to spend time with his family and play violin during his leisure time

2. Romeo Kienzler is a Chief Data Scientist at the IBM Watson IoT Division. In his role he is involved in international Data Mining and Data Science projects to ensure that clients get the maximum out of their data. He works as Associate Professor for Data Mining at a Swiss University and his current research focus is on Cloud Scale Data Mining using Open Source Technologies including R, ApacheSpark, SystemML, ApacheFlink and DeepLearning4J. He also contributes to various open source projects.

BerlinTOA LiveStream: DeepLearning and Advanced Machine Learning on IoT

Since the 150 available seats on Berlin seem to be booked out (http://www.eventbrite.com/e/deeplearning-and-advanced-machine-learning-on-iot-tickets-26145758668) we decided to stream the talk, so if you are interested feel free to join via live stream:

http://www.youtube.com/c/RomeoKienzler/live

Abstract:
Currently DeepLearning - large neural networks with advanced topologies - are taking over the machine learning ecosystem. In the case of times series they currently are superseding Hidden Markov models and other traditional algorithms. In this talk we will show how Deep Neural Networks can be used for anomaly detection on high dimensional network monitoring data. Do it yourself and read accelerometer data from your mobile device and stream this data to via MQTT to the Watson IoT Platform. Learn how to classify this data into different movement patterns (standing/sitting, walking, running, dancing).

THIS IS A GLOBAL ON-LINE HACKATHON THAT BEGINS MAY 23, 2016 AND NOW ENDS AUGUST 23, 2016.  SUBMISSIONS DUE AUGUST 23rd BY 5:00 PM EST. 

We’re extending the hackathon deadline to August 23 - that’s 20 additional days to build your Spark enterprise app. (View the revised competition calendar HERE.  We're giving you more time because....

We’re adding new enterprise data resources to the site and we want to give you a chance to incorporate these into your projects, if you so choose.  Our awesome data co-sponsors Yelp and Uncharted Software have generously shared some of their enterprise data sets for you to use during the hackathon.

Yelp’s data includes 2.2M reviews by 552K users for 77K businesses. The Uncharted data includes Bitcoin network transactions from processing the Bitcoin blockchain as of mid-2014 and Amazon product reviews from 1995 through 2003. For a fuller description and data access, visit our resources page.

Uncharted Software also has a couple cool Spark data visualization libraries you should check out: Salt and SparkPipe.

And, in case you’d like to weigh the effects of weather on business operations, we’re also offering access to the full suite of Weather Company APIs for the duration of the hackathon.

Finally, if you’re looking for a hosting solution for your Spark app, we’re now offering extended Bluemix trials for all hackathon participants. Using Bluemix services to build your project is totally optional, but might be a good way to get your app up and running — particularly with the IBM Analytics for Apache Spark service.

You can request your extended Bluemix trial code here.  For all hackathon participants, trials will extend through November 1, 2016. Now go forth and optimize for the enterprise!

---------------------

Build an Apache Spark application to address a real business problem or core concern related to customer care, marketing, risk management or operations. Join IBM and Devpost for a global hackathon using Apache Spark Makers Build.  There are $100,000 in cash prizes.  Submissions can be sent in up to August 23rd.

Participation Details: To participate in the global virtual hackathon, you can register here.  Please review all registration guidelines.

For the hack, you will apply Apache Spark's powerful analytics capabilities to enterprise and other relevant data so data scientists and software developers can build an analytics or mobile/web app that tackles a key business problem in marketing, customer case, operations or risk management.  The grand prize is $50,000, and the top three winners each get a meeting with the judge or
Spark community expert of their choice; the judging panel includes data experts from Tesla, Netflix, and Silicon Valley Data Science.

Go to apachespark.devpost.com for full details and registration.  Please review all registration rules.

Questions?

We're here to help. If you have any questions about the hackathon, post on the discussion forum or email support@devpost.com and we'll respond as soon as we can.

column3:
Webcast MipTec Basel: Massive parallel GPU accelerated DeepLearning in the cloud

http://www.youtube.com/c/RomeoKienzler/live

DeepLearning (DL) is currently taking off in various AI (Artificial Intelligence) domains like Image Recognition, NLP (Natural Language Processing) and Speech Recognition. But it also already entered the Life Science domain. Recently researchers from the University of Toronto implemented a DL Network able to predict Alternative Splicing (AS) patterns in individual tissues and differences in splicing patterns across tissues using a model inferred from mouse RNA-Seq data whereas Atomwise, a Silicon Valley based startup evaluates 8.2 million compounds on a IBM Blue Gene/Q supercomputer. GPUs are the key accelerator on DL - that´s why "In Silico Medicine" - a startup founded in Baltimore is closely partnering with NVIDIA. DL is at the early stages of development but in this talk we want to motivate machine learning experts to apply these algorithms on their problems and actively contributing to this emerging topic in AI research by providing a Open Source based framework for running massive parallel DL computations on GPU clusters in the Cloud by running DeepLearning4J, ND4J and jcuBLAS on top of ApacheSpark. First, we will introduce the overall architecture, followed by a live demonstration of the system and we end with a call for action to use and contribute to the framework.

http://www.youtube.com/c/RomeoKienzler/live
column17: Webcast MipTec Basel: Massive parallel GPU accelerated DeepLearning in the cloud

Join The Brussels Data Science Community, Spark Summit Europe attendees, and Spark ML and machine learning experts Nick Pentreath and Jean-Francois Puget for a talk on an Apache Spark–based, end-to-end machine learning system. A round of Spark and machine learning lightning talks will follow.

Many resources are available for building basic recommendation models using Spark. But how does a practitioner go from the basics to creating an end-to-end machine learning system, including deployment and management of models for real-time serving? In this session, we’ll demonstrate how to build such a system based on Spark ML and Elasticsearch. In particular, we’ll focus on how to go from data ingestion to model training to a real-time predictive system.

Agenda

18:30 – Welcome, food and drink

18:40 – Update on the preparation and workshops of the Data4Good Hackathon, and Philippe Van Impe, founder, European Data Innovation Hub and the Brussels Data Science Community

18:50 – Introduction: Berni Schiefer, IBM Fellow

19:00 – Creating an end-to-end Recommender System with Spark ML: Nick Pentreath, principal engineer at the IBM Spark Technology Center, Apache Spark PMC member and author of Machine Learning with Spark, and Jean-François Puget, distinguished engineer at IBM and chief architect for IBM Analytics Solutions.

19:45 – Lightning talks: 10 minute Spark and machine learning discussions, including new projects from Belgium. Details are coming soon. 

20:45 – Networking and refreshments

PARKING - at GRAND PLACE
Rue Marché aux Herbes 104, 1000 Brussels
Boulevard de l'Impératrice - Keizerinlaan Brussels

Description All you need to know about AI & chatbots

Our friends from IBM and Microsoft are going to give a deep dive into AI & ML on examples of IBM Watson Cognitive Solutions and Microsoft Bot Framework with Cognitive Services. We hear about artificial intelligence a lot in the news - but what does it mean? At our event we are going to explain what AI actually is and look into application of Machine Learning algorithms, and how they are used in the realm of Chatbots.

AGENDA:

"IBM Watson Cognitive Solutions" (with demo), by Nadia Karch, IBM Watson"How to build intelligent bots with Microsoft Bot Framework", by Daniel Heinze, Microsoft Bot FrameworkNetworking with Silicon Drinkabout & The Entrepreneurial Group SPEAKERS:

1. Nadia Karch, IBM Watson.

She will talk about: Watson is a cognitive technology that can think like a human. With Watson, you can analyze and interpret all of your data, including unstructured text, images, audio and video. With Watson, you can create chat bots that can engage in dialog. We will be looking at demos, & an introduction to Watson conversation service for building Watson virtual agents.

Bio: Nadia has been working with IBM for the last 6 years as Application Architect for their procurement solution. She has recently started her companionship with Watson, and she's very excited to explore the cognitive world, and what we will be able to achieve together in the future.

2. Daniel Heinze, Microsoft Bot Framework.

He will talk about: The Microsoft Bot Framework enables everyone to build intelligent bots into various channels: Facebook, Skype, Slack, etc.). Daniel showcases current scenarios and introduces the topic Bot Development.

Bio: Daniel is a passionate Software Developer for 10 years. His most proficient area is Data Science and because of that he handles the topics Machine Learning, Cognitive Services and Bots at Microsoft.

column3:
DON'T FORGET TO RSVP TO THIS MEETUP!!!


With the evolution of Data Science workloads at scale, compute and storage architectures are also evolving to deliver new levels of processing power that continue to push the boundaries of what’s possible with data.  Custom silicon technologies like GPUs built originally for graphics rendering or FPGAs for digital signal processing are making their way from research and scientific computing clusters to the commercial data center, where the Apache Big Data (Apache Hadoop, Apache Spark, Apache Hive, ...) community is already adapting existing frameworks to take advantage of breakthrough speed-ups for computing and analyzing as well as moving and storing data.  See how these technologies are pushing advancements in today’s killer app - machine and deep learning - and how you can get started now in the Apache ecosystem.


Come meet other developers, data engineers and data scientists and hang out with IBM and Hortonworks engineers to get for a taste of these new tools (and beer & bites!), plus cool giveaways!


Agenda


**NEW TOPIC** •   Big Data Big Learning: Machine & Learning & Deep Learning with Hadoop


• Build FAST Deep Learning Apps with Docker on OpenPOWER and GPUs - Indrajit Poddar, STSM, Quantum Computing and POWER Cloud Initiatives, IBM

• Crail: A High-Performance I/O Architecture for the Apache Data Processing Ecosystem - Bernard Metzler, Technical Leader High Performance I/O, IBM Research Zurich

• Accelerated Hadoop Erasure Coding with OpenPOWER CAPI and the CAPI SNAP Framework - Joerg-Stephan Vogt, FPGA Accelerator Development, IBM

• Intro to Watson Machine Learning - Khadija Souissi, Certified IT Specialist, IBM

Join us on April 4th!   See you there!

WANT TO ATTEND DATAWORKS SUMMIT?  GET YOUR DISCOUNT TICKET HERE.

DISCOUNT TICKET TO DATAWORKS SUMMIT (Formerly Hadoop Summit).  


Held in Munich - April 4th to 6th. 

Get 20% off using discount code MSPO20 here:

https://dataworkssummit.com/munich-2017/attend/

column3:
R is a powerful Open Source programming language and software environment that enables deep statistical analysis of data, and graphical representation of the results.  Key features include data exploration, statistical analysis, modeling, machine learning, simulations, and visualization of the results. 


But, R's full potential is limited by process memory utilization and its inability to take advantage of parallel platforms, such as HADOOP, diminishing its ability to analyze very large data sets. Using R on Hadoop breaks all this limits. These capabilities enable data scientists to focus on the statistical analysis of large data sets, without being concerned with the underlying infrastructure. 


This session will provide an overview of R, comparison of Hadoop distributives with R-ability and live demo of the capabilities of R on Hadoop.

CALLING ALL DEVELOPERS .... JOIN THE BIG DATA FOR SOCIAL GOOD CHALLENGE

Big data exists in just about everything we use and do. It comes from phones, cars, roads, power lines, waterways, food crates, and innumerable other items you’d never think of as computers. This data speaks volumes about our collective behavior and society – so let’s use it to do something incredible! IBM invites developers and data enthusiasts to take a deep dive into real world civic issues using big data and the IBM Bluemix Analytics for Hadoop service. Analyze one of our curated datasets or bring your own (provided it meets these requirements)! Use Hadoop and your data to create a clickable and interactive data visualization to highlight insights that you’ve found.

Ready to get started? $40,000 in prizes will be awarded....

Register here:http://ibmhadoop.challengepost.com/

What to Create: Participants must create a working, clickable, and interactive data visualization utilizing the Analytics for Hadoop service on IBM Bluemix.

Data Requirements: Your data visualization must analyze one or more datasets included in the curated list of datasets on the Data page OR meet the data size, content, and licensing requirements described on the Data page. The total size of the Datasets analyzed must be between 500MB - 7GB in size.

Check out the requirements then go get your IBM Bluemix extended promo code and check out the datasets!

English Version:

We are planning 3 lectures 

1) Technical introduction to Spark. News from Spark Summit (June 15 San-Francisco). IBM and Spark (briefly). Vsevolod Grabelnikov (IBM)

2) Data science using Big Data. Pragmatic approach. Pavel Mesentsev and  Dmitry Babaev (Tinkoff Bank) 

3) Online learning - Apache Spark alternatives (Vowpal Wabbit). Alexander Krot.

Русская версия:

Коллеги, планируются следующие доклады :


1) Введение в Spark. Новости со Spark Summit (проходит 15 Июня в Сан-Франциско) и очень коротко о стратегии IBM по интеграции своих приложений со Spark. Докладчик: Всеволод Грабельников (IBM)

2) Data science на больших данных. Прагматический подход. Докладчики: Павел Мезенцев и  Дмитрий Бабаев (Тинькофф Банк)


3) Онлайн обучение - альтернатива Apache Spark. 

В докладе будет рассмотрен подход к обучению линейных функций в задачах Large Scale Machine Learning, когда обучающая выборка поступает на вход потоком. В качестве инструмента будет рассматриваться Vowpal Wabbit. Докладчик: Александр Крот (http://mlclass.ru/, Вымпелком)


N.B. В здании пропускная система, т.е. необходимо подавать список посетителей. Большая просьба прислать организатору (Всеволод Грабельников) свои ФИО не позднее чем за 1 день до мероприятия.

Полезные ссылки:

Курс по основам Spark 
http://bigdatauniversity.com/bdu-wp/bdu-course/spark-fundamentals/ 

Сайт IBM посвященный Spark и анализу данных с его помощью

http://www.ibm.com/analytics/us/en/technology/spark/


Страница проекта в Apache

https://spark.apache.org/

Dear All,

Digital October is organizing a free event called Data Science week. It will take place from 24th to 30th of August in Moscow, at Bersenevskaya Nab. 6

In order to attend you have to register at the site:

http://digitaloctober.ru/ru/events/data_science_week_2015

On 26th, the whole day will be dedicated to Data Science tools. I will present on 26th about IBM Data Science tools and on 28th about Apache Spark. 

On 26th, my presentation agenda will be as following:

     Blue Data Science ( Data Scientist toolkit from  IBM)
        Data Scientist work demands simple tools that allow to focus on the goal and not on the infrastructure. In this presentation we will show how to do data analysis end-to-end , starting from getting and cleaning data, to exploration, model building, scoring and evaluation. We will do it using IBM tools and R - open source language.

      We will show different architectural sketches:
                - cloud solution using Watson Analytics, dashDB, BlueMix, SPSS Modeller;
                - on-premises infrastructure - IBM Open Data Platform, BigInsights for Hadoop, IBM PureData for Analytics & Fluid Query, SPSS Modeller & Analytical Server. 


Whoever is interested in my presentations or in any of the other presentations planned for the week are welcome to register and attend. 

Дорогие участники!

Цифровой Октябрь организует бесплатное мероприятие под названием "Data Science Week", которое пройдет с 24го 

Чтобы поучавствовать, нужно зарегистрироваться на сайте мероприятия:

http://digitaloctober.ru/ru/events/data_science_week_2015


26го Августа весь день будет посвящен инструментам для анализа данных. Я буду выступать 26го на тему "IBM Data Science tools" и 28го про Apache Spark

26го краткое содержание моего выступления будет следующим :

   Blue Data Science (Работа Data Scientist с инструментарием IBM)
        Работа исследователя данных требует наличия простых и понятных инструментов, которые позволяют сконцентрироваться на конечной цели, а не на инфраструктуре.
        В этой презентации мы покажем, как пройти всю цепочку анализа данных - от очистки данных до построения и скоринга модели при помощи инструментария IBM и открытых языков моделирования - R.
        Мы рассмотрим несколько вариантов архитектуры
                - облачное решение с использованием продуктов Watson Analytics, dashDB, BlueMix, SPSS Modeller;
                - инфраструктура в Вашем датацентре - IBM Open Data Platform, BigInsights for Hadoop, IBM PureData for Analytics & Fluid Query, SPSS Modeller & Analytical Server.

Все, кого может заинтересовать мое выступление, или выступления других спикеров, приглашены зарегистрироваться и посетить мероприятие.

column3:
Всем привет!


Добро пожаловать на первый в 2016 году митап в нашей группе Big Data Developers in Moscow!

В этот раз мы хотим поговорить про потоковую аналитику: инструменты, методы, подходы, практики и задачи. Митап будет посвящён потоковым вычислениям и созданию приложений для анализа данных в режиме реального времени. На своих ноутбуках вы сможете попробовать такие инструменты, как Spark Streaming и IBM InfoSphere Streams и решить несколько простых задач. Мы также продемонстрируем вам несколько примеров применения потоковой аналитики. 


Аджента: 


 - Обзор Spark Streaming (Андрей Выходцев, IBM)

- Обзор IBM InfoSphere Streams (Андрей Орлов, IBM)

- Пример использования InfoSphere Streams для задач потоковой аналитики (Всеволод Грабельников, IBM)

- Apache Storm в промышленном использовании в телекоме. Двухлетний опыт промышленного использования. (Антон Задорожный, oneFactor)


Приглашаем Вас к 18:30 на регистрацию и общение. Программа начнётся в 19:00. Митап бесплатный, количество мест ограничено. 


===== 


Hi all,


Welcome to first Big Data Developers in Moscow meetup in 2016!

We would like to talk about streaming analytics: tools, methods, practises and tasks. This meetup will focus on Stream Computing and creating a Real-time Analytics Application. Bring your laptop, because you’ll have an opportunity to get hands-on with Spark Streaming and InfoSphere Streams and apply this exciting new technology yourself! We’ll also be showing an additional deep dive demo of how to build a real-time analytics application.


Agenda (will be updated in case)

- Overview of Spark Streaming (Andrey Vykhodtsev, IBM)

- Overview of IBM InfoSphere Streams (Andrey Orlov, IBM)

- InfoSphere Streams  for analytical tasks Demo (Vsevolod Grabelnikov, IBM)

- Apache Storm in Telecom. Enterprise use-cases based on 2-year experience. (Anton Zadorozhnyi, oneFactor)


Doors open at 18:30 for registration and networking, while the program starts at 19:00. This Meetup is FREE, but limits of attendees.
column17: Stream Computing: Developing a Real-time Analytics

IBM values our community of clients and business partners. Each year, we support and build our community by working closely with IBM advocates and helping them to become 

IBM Champions

IBM Champions are a select group of external advocates made up of clients, business partners and independent consultants who make exceptional contributions to the technical community by speaking at conferences, running or actively participating in user groups, evangelizing relevant technical topics via social media, and helping our clients make the most of IBM technology. 

We are looking for clients and business partners to join the program and are looking for applications in the areas of data science, data engineering, application development, and business analytics.

Nominations are due by Monday, November 28, 2016

The Champion program is open to candidates worldwide, and candidates may self-nominate or be nominated by someone else. IBM employees are not eligible for the program.  Some benefits of the IBM Champion program: 
- IBM Champions advocate IBM offerings in the community with competence and credibility (content, blogs, presentations, customer references, analyst/press, videos/podcasts, etc.)
- IBM Champions share knowledge with and provide support to the IBM user community (books, articles, blogs, forums, presentations, education, beta programs and customer advisory councils etc.)
- IBM Champions support IBM as brand ambassadors who build awareness, share product knowledge, and provide product feedback as users and beta testers

Read this  blog post  for full IBM Champion program criteria, guidelines and the <a>nomination form</a>.

To learn more about the IBM Champion program from current Champions and Worldwide IBM Champion coordinator Libby Ingrassia, listen to this webcast. Be sure to share the blog and webcast with clients and colleagues who would make great IBM Champions.

Hi


Look forward to meet you in the first physical of Big Data Developers Lisbon Meetup  planned for June 16th at 07:00 PM.


After the initial welcoming messages we will dedicate this event to the Apache Spark project. This engine for large scale data processing will be covered from the basics to a significant depth. The agenda we are setting up is:

• Why Apache Spark is important

Join The Brussels Data Science Community, Spark Summit Europe attendees, and Spark ML and machine learning experts Nick Pentreath and Jean-Francois Puget for a talk on an Apache Spark–based, end-to-end machine learning system. A round of Spark and machine learning lightning talks will follow.

Many resources are available for building basic recommendation models using Spark. But how does a practitioner go from the basics to creating an end-to-end machine learning system, including deployment and management of models for real-time serving? In this session, we’ll demonstrate how to build such a system based on Spark ML and Elasticsearch. In particular, we’ll focus on how to go from data ingestion to model training to a real-time predictive system.

Agenda

18:30 – Welcome, food and drink

18:40 – Update on the preparation and workshops of the Data4Good Hackathon, and Philippe Van Impe, founder, European Data Innovation Hub and the Brussels Data Science Community

18:50 – Introduction: Berni Schiefer, IBM Fellow

19:00 – Creating an end-to-end Recommender System with Spark ML: Nick Pentreath, principal engineer at the IBM Spark Technology Center, Apache Spark PMC member and author of Machine Learning with Spark, and Jean-François Puget, distinguished engineer at IBM and chief architect for IBM Analytics Solutions.

19:45 – Lightning talks: 10 minute Spark and machine learning discussions, including new projects from Belgium. Details are coming soon. 

20:45 – Networking and refreshments

PARKING - at GRAND PLACE
Rue Marché aux Herbes 104, 1000 Brussels
Boulevard de l'Impératrice - Keizerinlaan Brussels

Christopher Bienko is WW expert on Data Management in the Cloud and everybody will have the chance to ask questions in this session.


Technical deep-dives will follow this session.

Cloudant is based on Apache CouchDB but enhanced in serveral ways.

Cloudant is an innovator in data management, providing a NoSQL, JSON database-as-a-service (DBaaS) that enables developers of fast-growing Web and mobile applications to focus on developing their applications without the need to manage database infrastructure or growth. In this one hour introduction to Cloundant, we'll examine how Cloudant accelerates and extends IBM’s Big Data & Analytics portfolio. The agenda includes a review of the NoSQL database landscape, as well as specific features, use cases, and Cloudant customer success stories. Come and equip yourself with an understanding of this disruptive new technology for the world of databases.

In this meetup you are invited to have some pasta with us and hear something about the latest developments in the SQL on Hadoop, R on Hadoop and Analytics on Realtime Streams - and of course, how this all applies to cloud computing.


We keep this rather informal and in case somebody want to present something please let me know and I can update the agenda.

I'll also promise that this is not a marketing event, I'm a tekki but I'll explain some concept using IBM products. As these are all based on open standards the concepts also hold on open source and competition products.

This is a draft agenda:

1. SQL on Hadoop

Different types of SQL to MapReduce compilers and also SQL Engines bringing their own Execution Environment. This talk concludes with a IBM BigSQL Ansi 2003/DB2 complient SQL engine demo.

2. R on Hadoop

Summary on R on Hadoop projects. Basic reference architecture for pushing R code down to the Hadoop engine. Demo of IBM BigR and IBM SystemML

3. Stream Computing Overview and Demo. Learn the basic concepts about Stream Computing (e.g. working on sliding windows of different types, working with different operaations on Data Streams: Sink, Source, Aggregate, Join, Punctuate, Throttle, ..). Demo of IBM InfoSphere Streams.

4. PaaS and DBaaS: Learn how to apply the methods learned in a  Platform as a Service Cloud. Cloudfoundry and IBM Bluemix Demo

column3:
Title: A leap forward for SQL on Hadoop

Abstract:

We will discuss the various SQL on Hadoop alternatives and explore why such
technologies have become an area of keen interest for many organizations.
We will discuss various alternatives such as Hive and Impala and their
pros/cons.  We will share customer use cases for Warehouse Modernization
and the role of SQL for Hadoop in this space, as well as discuss
performance characteristics of SQL on Hadoop when running common query
workloads. We will provide an intro to Big SQL and demo. Big SQL  delivers
some exciting capabilities including comprehensive SQL functionality that
leverages advanced SQL compiler/runtime all with low latency and high
performance.

Learn more about Big SQL here:
http://www.livestream.com/newchannel/popoutplayer?channel=ibmiod&clip=pla_e4b28ad8-f647-4a02-88ad-6679b78f7e8b&time=1481
. Check out the SQL on Hadoop white paper:
http://www-01.ibm.com/common/ssi/cgi-bin/ssialias?subtype=WH&infotype=SA&appname=SWGE_SW_SW_USEN&htmlfid=SWW14019USEN&attachment=SWW14019USEN.PDF

Speaker:

Claus Samuelsen, IBM

Claus Samuelsen has many years experience within data management, and has for more than 3 years had big data as his primary focus area.
Working with customers all over Europe devolping Hadoop based solutions in several industries from banking, insurance, healthcare to automotive and gaming.


.

--------

Title: Apache Cassandra & Apache Spark for Time Series Data (45 minutes)

Presenter: Patrick McFadin

Bio: Patrick McFadin is regarded as one of the experts of Apache Cassandra and data modeling techniques. As the Chief Evangelist for Apache Cassandra and consultant for DataStax, he has helped build some of the largest deployments in the world. Previous to DataStax, he was Chief Architect at Hobsons, an education services company. There, he spoke often on Web Application design and performance.

Synopsis: Apache Cassandra has proven to be one of the best solutions for storing and retrieving time series data at high velocity and high volume. This talk will discuss how the storage model of Cassandra is ideal for time series use cases and go over examples of how to best build data models. We will also cover pairing Apache Spark with Apache Cassandra to create a real time data analytics platform. Attendees will leave this session knowing how to build their own real time data analytics platform, and will be shocked at how easy it is!

------------

Title: Application Development with NoSQL in Platform Clouds

Presenter: Rene Meyer, IBM Berlin, Client Technical Professional

column3:
THIS IS A WEB CONFERENCE ONLY.  TIME OF WEB CONFERENCE LOCALLY IS BASED ON LIVE-STREAM START - PACIFIC DAYLIGHT TIME. DETAILS TO CONNECT TO LIVE-STREAM ARE INDICATED BELOW. 

Apache Spark is an open source processing engine built around speed, ease of use, and analytics. If you have large amounts of data that requires low latency processing that a typical Map Reduce program cannot provide, Spark is the alternative.

Spark performs at speeds up to 100 times faster than Map Reduce for iterative algorithms or interactive data mining. Spark provides in-memory cluster computing for lightning fast speed and supports Java, Scala, and Python APIs for ease of development. Spark allows data scientists to build models quickly and supports iterative jobs on distributed datasets. This means more people can apply deep intelligence into applications to make everything smarter, including the Internet of Things (IoT), machine learning, web, mobile, social, business process and more. 

Do you believe in the value of Spark, in the speed, efficiency and flexibility of this in-memory compute engine? IBM does.  Emphatically.That's why we're committed to do everything we can to accelerate the adoption of Spark for enterprise analytics, where Spark promises seemingly unlimited value.

On June 15, 2015, IBM will host a Spark Community event in San Francisco, California: IBM | Spark - The Start of Something Big in Data and Design. There will be a live demo showcase, refreshments, and a Town Hall discussion featuring some of the most trail-blazing data scientists in today's Spark Community, including:

•  Edd Dumbill, VP Strategy, Silicon Valley Data Science
•  Mike Tamir, Chief Science Officer & VP of Data Science & Education at Galvanize
•   Fernando Perez, Staff Scientist at Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory & Founding Investigator of the Berkeley Institute for Data Science
•   Haoyuan Li, CEO and Founder of Tachyon Nexus
•   Shankar Venkataraman, Distinguished Engineer & CTO, IBM Analytics Platform at IBM
•   Paco Nathan, Director, Community Evangelism, Databricks

Spark Community members will also deliver 5-minute lightning talks to describe exciting projects they're working on.

We will provide a livestream presentation of what these Spark leaders have to say.

Live Streaming Link:

To get additional details about Spark you can sign up now for a reminder at:

http://www.ibm.com/analytics/us/en/technology/spark/

Scroll down to "Can't attend in Person"?  Sign up for a reminder and add it to your calendar.

Happy Sparking.

Register here: bit.ly/1EZA0Wh

IMPORTANT! Make sure you also sign-up on the SoftLayer registration page: bit.ly/1EZA0Wh

Registering on the meetup event alone is not enough to guarantee yourself a place.

SoftLayer and Cloudant have co-created a full-day 'Big Data Academy' workshop which they are touring around Europe. The course will focus on using SoftLayer and Cloudant's DBaaS to deploy clusters and solve some big data challenges. General concepts related to NoSQL and distributed datastores (including replication, sharding and performance concerns) will also be covered, making it an excellent introduction for anyone interested in getting up-to-speed in these areas.

It's a BYOD event where the only requirement is that you have Docker installed and it will be taught in English.

Finally, it is recommended that you are at least familiar with the following concepts before joining the course. I don't think that will be much of a problem for most of you. :-)

- Hardware used with cloud computing
- Load balancing
- Internet and Web-hosting fundamentals
- Cloud computing (basics)
- HTTP commands (GET, POST, PUT, …)
- Representational State Transfer (ReST) API call principles.
- Elementary Javascript and Object concepts
- Command-line skills using Mac or Linux

column3:
Agenda:    


6:00pm - 6:30pm -  Arrive and socialize


6:30pm - 7:00pm -   Discussion 1:  Building a Reactive RESTful API with Akka HTTP and Slick


7:00pm - 7:30pm -  Discussion 2: Cloud Scale Machine Learning with ApacheSpark, MLLIB, Cloudfoundry and OpenStack Swift  - Romeo Kienzler - Chief Data Scientist - IBM Cloud Transformation Lab Zurich


7:30pm - 8:00pm -  Discussion 3: The Typesafe Reactive Platform and Apache Spark: Experiences, Challenges and Roadmaps - Stavros Kontopoulos, Typesafe

Discussion 1

Title:  Building a Reactive RESTful API with Akka HTTP and Slick

Abstract:


Zalando’s engineering team is currently rebuilding our “shop”—the unit that includes our 15 country-specific, customer-facing websites—to transform it from a monolith into a microservices architecture. As part of this work, we have developed open-source tools in a variety of languages. One of this tools, Innkeeper, is a simple, RESTful route management API built on top of reactive technologies like Akka HTTP and Slick. It will help our fleet of router instances to keep their routes in sync.


In this presentation, I'll discuss Innkeeper’s architecture and how — by choosing a reactive stack of technologies — we can stream database records back to the browser. I’ll talk about how (and why) we secured our API using OAuth, and give insights on how we use Docker and the STUPS tools to auto-scale this API on top of AWS. Finally, I’ll describe how we designed a set of unit and integration tests to make sure that our application works correctly, and how we set up our continuous integration environment.


About the speaker:  Dan Persa has been a software engineer at Zalando since 2013 and is a member of the Fashion Store team, which is responsible for Zalando’s core ecommerce business. He loves Java and Scala and more recently has been exploring Go and Node.js. He’s a big fan of clean code and software craftsmanship. In addition to coding, he enjoys mentoring new developers, organizing coder dojos and reading groups and giving tech talks. In his free time he likes to take photos and dance salsa.

Discussion 2


Title: Cloud Scale Machine Learning with ApacheSpark, MLLIB, Cloudfoundry and OpenStack Swift


Speaker: Romeo Kienzler - Chief Data Scientist - IBM Cloud Transformation Lab Zurich


Abstract: Clouds provide very cost effective access to computing power and storage. Especially on workloads with high variation on computational and storage resource requirements. Resilient data processing engines like Apache Spark,  a parallel machine learning library on top like MLLIB and elastic storage services like OpenStack Swift are a perfect fit to build a Resilient data processing framework. And this is exactly what IBM has done on the IBM Platform as a Service Cloud called Bluemix. In this session I'll give a very short introduction into all these technologies, open standards and frameworks in order to prepare you for a end - to -end demonstration of a large DNA sequence analysis.


About the speaker: Romeo Kienzler holds a Master Degree in Information Systems with specialisation in Applied Statistics and Bioinformatics from the Swiss Federal Institute of Technology. He works for IBM Zurich as a chief data scientist and architect. His current research focus is on large-scale machine learning on resilient cloud infrastructures based on Apache Spark and Apache Flink on top of Docker Swarm.Romeo Kienzler is a Member of the IBM Academy of Technology, the IBM Technical Expert Council and the IBM BigData BlackBelts team.

Discussion 3


Title: The Typesafe Reactive Platform and Apache Spark: Experiences, Challenges and Roadmaps


Speaker:  Stavros Kontopoulos, Typesafe


Abstract:  In this presentation Stavros Kontopoulos will discuss the role Apache Spark plays for the Typesafe Reactive Platform. He will discuss the Spark team's contribution to the open source project, cover added features like backpressure and dynamic allocation, and describe challenges the team has faced while developing infrastructure for integrated testing. He will also share upcoming roadmap plans, such as:


kerberos security, already there for hadoop a must for the enterprise world.


Closely examine Tachyon technology.


More closely integrate Spark with Typesafe Reactive Platform and our commercial product ConductR


About the speaker: Stavros Kontopoulos recently joined the Apache spark team at Typesafe. Prior to Typesafe, Stavros worked in telecoms for several years developing network management products. Immediately before Typesafe he worked as a big-data engineer in the digital marketing sector  for a start-up (Pollfish Inc). Stavros has extensive hands-on experience with web technologies. When not coding he is doing research pursuing a Phd degree with areas of interest being: sublinear algorithms, big data estimators, massive data indexing structures, social network analysis and data structures.

http://www.youtube.com/c/RomeoKienzler/live

Agenda: 2:30-3:00 PM - Swatcloud Market place for IoT, Big Data and Cloud - Siliconvalley4u
3:00-3:30 PM - Welcome Note, Introduction to IBM Bluemix and IBM Watson IoT Platform (romeo)
3:30-4:00 PM - Time Series Analysis on ApacheSpark (romeo)
4:00-4:30 PM - OpenWhisk, an Open Source Cloud based event programming service (Rajesh)
4:30-5:00 PM - Hands-on Exercise, send Accelerometer data from your Smartphone to the Cloud and Analyse movement patterns with ApacheSpark (romeo)

Bio:

1. Rajesh K Jeyapaul is a Cloud Solution Architect from IBM EcoSystem & Developer (ECoD) organization , focusing on enabling partners and developers on IBM cloud solution especially on Bluemix , IoT , Mobility and Big Data.

He started his carrier on Avionics real time simulation as a Research Fellow in India’s Defense organization. Further joining IBM , he has worked on various technologies involving java virtual machine, operating system , virtualization and cloud OS management.

He has co-authored books on virtualization and cloud system management. He loves to spend time with his family and play violin during his leisure time

2. Romeo Kienzler is a Chief Data Scientist at the IBM Watson IoT Division. In his role he is involved in international Data Mining and Data Science projects to ensure that clients get the maximum out of their data. He works as Associate Professor for Data Mining at a Swiss University and his current research focus is on Cloud Scale Data Mining using Open Source Technologies including R, ApacheSpark, SystemML, ApacheFlink and DeepLearning4J. He also contributes to various open source projects.

column3:
BerlinTOA LiveStream: DeepLearning and Advanced Machine Learning on IoT

Since the 150 available seats on Berlin seem to be booked out (http://www.eventbrite.com/e/deeplearning-and-advanced-machine-learning-on-iot-tickets-26145758668) we decided to stream the talk, so if you are interested feel free to join via live stream:

http://www.youtube.com/c/RomeoKienzler/live

Abstract:
Currently DeepLearning - large neural networks with advanced topologies - are taking over the machine learning ecosystem. In the case of times series they currently are superseding Hidden Markov models and other traditional algorithms. In this talk we will show how Deep Neural Networks can be used for anomaly detection on high dimensional network monitoring data. Do it yourself and read accelerometer data from your mobile device and stream this data to via MQTT to the Watson IoT Platform. Learn how to classify this data into different movement patterns (standing/sitting, walking, running, dancing).
column17: BerlinTOA LiveStream: DeepLearning and Advanced Machine Learning on IoT

column3:
THIS IS A GLOBAL ON-LINE HACKATHON THAT BEGINS MAY 23, 2016 AND NOW ENDS AUGUST 23, 2016.  SUBMISSIONS DUE AUGUST 23rd BY 5:00 PM EST. 

We’re extending the hackathon deadline to August 23 - that’s 20 additional days to build your Spark enterprise app. (View the revised competition calendar HERE.  We're giving you more time because....

We’re adding new enterprise data resources to the site and we want to give you a chance to incorporate these into your projects, if you so choose.  Our awesome data co-sponsors Yelp and Uncharted Software have generously shared some of their enterprise data sets for you to use during the hackathon.

Yelp’s data includes 2.2M reviews by 552K users for 77K businesses. The Uncharted data includes Bitcoin network transactions from processing the Bitcoin blockchain as of mid-2014 and Amazon product reviews from 1995 through 2003. For a fuller description and data access, visit our resources page.

Uncharted Software also has a couple cool Spark data visualization libraries you should check out: Salt and SparkPipe.

And, in case you’d like to weigh the effects of weather on business operations, we’re also offering access to the full suite of Weather Company APIs for the duration of the hackathon.

Finally, if you’re looking for a hosting solution for your Spark app, we’re now offering extended Bluemix trials for all hackathon participants. Using Bluemix services to build your project is totally optional, but might be a good way to get your app up and running — particularly with the IBM Analytics for Apache Spark service.

You can request your extended Bluemix trial code here.  For all hackathon participants, trials will extend through November 1, 2016. Now go forth and optimize for the enterprise!

---------------------

Build an Apache Spark application to address a real business problem or core concern related to customer care, marketing, risk management or operations. Join IBM and Devpost for a global hackathon using Apache Spark Makers Build.  There are $100,000 in cash prizes.  Submissions can be sent in up to August 23rd.

Participation Details: To participate in the global virtual hackathon, you can register here.  Please review all registration guidelines.

For the hack, you will apply Apache Spark's powerful analytics capabilities to enterprise and other relevant data so data scientists and software developers can build an analytics or mobile/web app that tackles a key business problem in marketing, customer case, operations or risk management.  The grand prize is $50,000, and the top three winners each get a meeting with the judge or
Spark community expert of their choice; the judging panel includes data experts from Tesla, Netflix, and Silicon Valley Data Science.

Go to apachespark.devpost.com for full details and registration.  Please review all registration rules.

Questions?

We're here to help. If you have any questions about the hackathon, post on the discussion forum or email support@devpost.com and we'll respond as soon as we can.

column3:
Webcast MipTec Basel: Massive parallel GPU accelerated DeepLearning in the cloud

http://www.youtube.com/c/RomeoKienzler/live

DeepLearning (DL) is currently taking off in various AI (Artificial Intelligence) domains like Image Recognition, NLP (Natural Language Processing) and Speech Recognition. But it also already entered the Life Science domain. Recently researchers from the University of Toronto implemented a DL Network able to predict Alternative Splicing (AS) patterns in individual tissues and differences in splicing patterns across tissues using a model inferred from mouse RNA-Seq data whereas Atomwise, a Silicon Valley based startup evaluates 8.2 million compounds on a IBM Blue Gene/Q supercomputer. GPUs are the key accelerator on DL - that´s why "In Silico Medicine" - a startup founded in Baltimore is closely partnering with NVIDIA. DL is at the early stages of development but in this talk we want to motivate machine learning experts to apply these algorithms on their problems and actively contributing to this emerging topic in AI research by providing a Open Source based framework for running massive parallel DL computations on GPU clusters in the Cloud by running DeepLearning4J, ND4J and jcuBLAS on top of ApacheSpark. First, we will introduce the overall architecture, followed by a live demonstration of the system and we end with a call for action to use and contribute to the framework.

http://www.youtube.com/c/RomeoKienzler/live
column17: Webcast MipTec Basel: Massive parallel GPU accelerated DeepLearning in the cloud

Join The Brussels Data Science Community, Spark Summit Europe attendees, and Spark ML and machine learning experts Nick Pentreath and Jean-Francois Puget for a talk on an Apache Spark–based, end-to-end machine learning system. A round of Spark and machine learning lightning talks will follow.

Many resources are available for building basic recommendation models using Spark. But how does a practitioner go from the basics to creating an end-to-end machine learning system, including deployment and management of models for real-time serving? In this session, we’ll demonstrate how to build such a system based on Spark ML and Elasticsearch. In particular, we’ll focus on how to go from data ingestion to model training to a real-time predictive system.

Agenda

18:30 – Welcome, food and drink

18:40 – Update on the preparation and workshops of the Data4Good Hackathon, and Philippe Van Impe, founder, European Data Innovation Hub and the Brussels Data Science Community

18:50 – Introduction: Berni Schiefer, IBM Fellow

19:00 – Creating an end-to-end Recommender System with Spark ML: Nick Pentreath, principal engineer at the IBM Spark Technology Center, Apache Spark PMC member and author of Machine Learning with Spark, and Jean-François Puget, distinguished engineer at IBM and chief architect for IBM Analytics Solutions.

19:45 – Lightning talks: 10 minute Spark and machine learning discussions, including new projects from Belgium. Details are coming soon. 

20:45 – Networking and refreshments

PARKING - at GRAND PLACE
Rue Marché aux Herbes 104, 1000 Brussels
Boulevard de l'Impératrice - Keizerinlaan Brussels

The demand for machine learning is booming! 

Calling all IT executives, data scientists, Chief Data Officers, data architects and other data geeks.  Join us on February 15th from 2:00-5:30 pm ET via livestream  (replay available starting February 16th) , and discover how machine learning is fundamentally changing the way we work and live.  Hear about cognitive applications that anticipate behavior and learn from data without being explicitly programmed.

You'll learn about the latest breakthrough developments on machine learning as well as Spark, data and analytics. Mike Gualtieri, Vice President and Principal Analyst, Forrester, will present his view on how to best leverage technologies such as big data, predictive analytics, Hadoop/Spark, machine learning, data science, and AI.  Rob Thomas, General Manager, IBM Analytics will host an agenda which will include guest speakers and cover the following topics:

•  Machine Learning Overview

•  Top Trends in Machine Learning & Cognitive Applications

•  Cognitive Analytics and Machine Learning for the Enterprise

•  Live Product Demonstration & Client Roundtable on Machine Learning

•  Data Innovation with Hybrid Transaction/Analytical Processing

•  Spark & Machine Learning for Enterprise Systems

For additional details and to REGISTER, please visit MACHINE LEARNING.

Register NOW and we'll send you a reminder!
