Join us to hear about real world Hadoop usage patterns from NC State and IBM.

While much of the big data activity in the market up to now has been experimenting and learning about big data technologies, IBM has been focused on also helping organizations understand what problems big data can address.   There are 5 key and evolving big data use cases that are emerging.    John Choi will focus on the Hadoop usage pattern in these uses cases and will provide an updated view giving the quickly evolving Hadoop lanscape.   

Dr. Kowolenko has been leveraging hadoop to analyze unstructured patent data to improve its ability to find a suitor for its patents.   He will show case how companies our getting value from big data.

Our speakers:


John Choi - is Director of Big Data Product Management at IBM Software Group where he is responsible for product direction and strategy for the Big Data software portfolio. Prior to this role, he has held various product/portfolio management and strategy responsibilities in IBM including Information Management and WebSphere with a focusing on portfolio strategy and emerging technologies. John received his BA and MBA from Yale University.


Dr. Michael Kowolenko, Ph.D - is an Industry Fellow in the Center of Innovation Management Studies and Assistant Teaching Professor in the Departments of Accounting and Management at North Carolina State University Poole College of Management.  His research and teaching activities focus on models of integrating data analytics in the area of critical thinking and decision-making.  Dr. Kowolenko has been awarded multiple grants from IBM for his work in developing decision models enabled by Big Data.  In addition, he has consulted with and instructed multiple companies in the use of analytics in business decision making.

Join us and participate in an exclusive Big Data Developer Day hosted by the IBM Big Data team.


Open source Apache Hadoop is a great framework for distributed processing of large data sets. But there’s a difference between "playing" with big data versus solving real problems. The reality is that Hadoop alone might not be enough. Experience IBM’s enterprise-class Hadoop product, InfoSphere BigInsights, which enhances open source Hadoop with required enterprise capabilities including: analytics, visualization, security, standard SQL, enterprise HBase, developer/admin tools, learn about the role of Big Data in Motion, Big Data Exploration and more. The morning session will include interactive Big Data use case discussions, an overview of what is big data, live demonstrations of key Big Data components (Big Data at Rest, Big Data in Motion).

In the afternoon, get hands-on with Big Data using InfoSphere BigInsights Quick Start Edition and InfoSphere Streams Quick Start Edition with guidance from development experts. This is a unique opportunity to develop skills and learn about exciting technologies and techniques that you can immediately take back to your organization.

This event is FREE. Breakfast, Lunch and snacks will be provided.

It augments open source Hadoop with enterprise capabilities such as: performance optimization, development tooling, analytic accelerators, visualization, security etc.

CALLING ALL DEVELOPERS .... JOIN THE BIG DATA FOR SOCIAL GOOD CHALLENGE

Big data exists in just about everything we use and do. It comes from phones, cars, roads, power lines, waterways, food crates, and innumerable other items you’d never think of as computers. This data speaks volumes about our collective behavior and society – so let’s use it to do something incredible! IBM invites developers and data enthusiasts to take a deep dive into real world civic issues using big data and the IBM Bluemix Analytics for Hadoop service. Analyze one of our curated datasets or bring your own (provided it meets these requirements)! THIS IS A WEB CONFERENCE ONLY.  TIME OF WEB CONFERENCE LOCALLY IS BASED ON LIVE-STREAM START - PACIFIC DAYLIGHT TIME. DETAILS TO CONNECT TO LIVE-STREAM ARE INDICATED BELOW. 

Apache Spark is an open source processing engine built around speed, ease of use, and analytics. If you have large amounts of data that requires low latency processing that a typical Map Reduce program cannot provide, Spark is the alternative.

Spark performs at speeds up to 100 times faster than Map Reduce for iterative algorithms or interactive data mining. Spark provides in-memory cluster computing for lightning fast speed and supports Java, Scala, and Python APIs for ease of development. Spark allows data scientists to build models quickly and supports iterative jobs on distributed datasets. This means more people can apply deep intelligence into applications to make everything smarter, including the Internet of Things (IoT), machine learning, web, mobile, social, business process and more. 

Do you believe in the value of Spark, in the speed, efficiency and flexibility of this in-memory compute engine? IBM does.  Emphatically.That's why we're committed to do everything we can to accelerate the adoption of Spark for enterprise analytics, where Spark promises seemingly unlimited value.

On June 15, 2015, IBM will host a Spark Community event in San Francisco, California: IBM | Spark - The Start of Something Big in Data and Design. There will be a live demo showcase, refreshments, and a Town Hall discussion featuring some of the most trail-blazing data scientists in today's Spark Community, including:

•  Edd Dumbill, VP Strategy, Silicon Valley Data Science
•  Mike Tamir, Chief Science Officer & VP of Data Science & Education at Galvanize
•   Fernando Perez, Staff Scientist at Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory & Founding Investigator of the Berkeley Institute for Data Science
•   Haoyuan Li, CEO and Founder of Tachyon Nexus
•   Shankar Venkataraman, Distinguished Engineer & CTO, IBM Analytics Platform at IBM
•   Paco Nathan, Director, Community Evangelism, Databricks

Spark Community members will also deliver 5-minute lightning talks to describe exciting projects they're working on.

We will provide a livestream presentation of what these Spark leaders have to say.

Live Streaming Link:

To get additional details about Spark you can sign up now for a reminder at:

http://www.ibm.com/analytics/us/en/technology/spark/

Happy Sparking.

column17: Apache Spark Maker Community Event

column3:
Apache Spark is an open source big data processing framework built around speed, ease of use, and sophisticated analytics. First developed in 2009, Spark provides several advantages over other big data and MapReduce technologies. With Spark, Hadoop clusters can run up to 100 times faster in memory, and 10 times faster when running on disk. With the ability to write applications in Java, Scala or even Python, Spark is a flexible and powerful paradigm.

With IBM's "Open for Data" cloud computing initiative, current and prospective users can provision an instance of Spark in the cloud in a matter of minutes without up-front infrastructure investment. The power of the cloud empowers users to scale up massively based on business needs. De-provisioning resources when those needs change is equally as agile, giving our users the best value for performance.


Please join us on Tuesday, June 28, 2016 at 12:00 noon as we discuss Spark both deployed as a service and on premise. After an introduction to Spark, we'll talk about how to decide if your project is well suited for processing in the cloud. Finally we'll perform a brief demonstration. Food and beverages will be provided. Seats are limited, so sign up today!

Presenter: Andrew Levine

A Detailed Look at IBM's Data Science Experience


IBM Data Science Experience (DSX) is a new integrated environment built for data scientists and data engineers to ingest and analyze data, build models, and create valuable insights.


Based on open source tools, such as Python, R, Scala, and Spark,  DSX allows users to collaborate on projects within their teams and the broader data science community.

Streaming analytics and Internet Of Things ( IOT) are gaining momentum in the data and analytics industry. Apache Spark established itself as a leader in fast data processing with its ease of use. With its single execution engine and unified programming model for batch and streaming workloads, it stands out from other distributed stream processing engines. 

Join this webinar to go over basics and internals of the Streaming module of Apache Spark along with code samples. This topic is intended for audiences with some familiarity or working experience with Apache Spark core.​

Webinar is 3:00 pm EST.  Please adjust to your time zone:  http://bit.ly/2iHw6yy

- Architecture and Execution Model

Presenter Bio: 

Suresh Matlapudi is an Open Source Analytics Solution Engineer with IBM. He is a hands-on Engineer with deep experience in distributed data processing, Big Data, Data Warehousing and Hybrid Information Architectures. His current work involves supporting sales teams with pre-sales and technical specifications for Open Source Analytics tools, specifically Hadoop/Spark and execution of several outreach programs to support Open Source adoption by Analytics teams. 

Before joining IBM he was involved in building some of the large-scale data processing systems at companies like eHarmony, Deem, American Express, Knights Bridge Solutions.

Spark is recognized as a great analytics engine. One of its benefits is its inclusion of machine learning algorithms that can group, predict, classify and even recommend based on the analysis of a corpus of data. Once the model is created, it can be applied to new data. In some situations, there is a need to score the model while the data is streaming to decide what to do with the new data.

In this latest Data Science Central Webinar event, you will learn how to process the data to arrive at a model and how the resulting model can be used to score streaming data using IBM Streams.

Hive is a runtime Hadoop® support structure that allows anyone who is already fluent with SQL (which is commonplace for relational database developers) to leverage the Hadoop platform right out of the gate.  Hive allows SQL developers to write Hive Query Language (HQL) statements that are similar to  standard SQL statements.  HQL statements are broken down by the Hive service into MapReduce jobs and executed across a Hadoop cluster.


IBM® Big SQL is a data warehouse system for Hadoop that you use to summarize, query, and analyze data.  Big SQL provides SQL access to data that is stored in InfoSphere® BigInsights™ by using JDBC or ODBC connections.  Big SQL provides broad SQL support that is typical of commercial databases. You can issue JDBC queries or ODBC queries to access data that is stored in InfoSphere BigInsights, in the same way that you access databases from your enterprise applications.


You can use Big SQL to issue queries of any size, including concurrent queries. Big SQL provides support for large ad-hoc queries by using MapReduce parallelism and point queries, which are low-latency queries that return information quickly to reduce response time and provide improved access to data.  

HBase is a column-oriented database management system that runs on top of HDFS. It is well suited for sparse data sets, which are common in many big data use cases. Unlike relational database systems, HBase does not support a structured query language like SQL; in fact, HBase isn’t a relational data store at all.  HBase applications are typically written in Java much like a MapReduce application or in other languages by using Apache Thrift.  However, HBase can be queried with SQL when combined with Hive and or Big SQL!

Apache Accumulo, like HBase, derives from Google's BigTable technology.  While the two technologies are similar in architecture, Accumulo excels in security right down to the cell level.  Attendees will receive an introduction to Apache Accumulo and hear about IBM's Accumulo research project.

Join us from 11:00am - 6:00pm on February the 4th to learn about Big SQL, Hive and HBase. Register at: http://ibm.co/19APszk

Attendees will learn how these three technologies complement each other and experience hands-on 

lab exercises to enhance your understanding.  Attendees will leverage the BigInsights Quick Start Edition for all lab exercises and be able to continue using the Hadoop based technology after the Meetup. You must register at: http://ibm.co/19APszk in order to guarantee a seat at this Big Data Developer Day event.

Join IBM and Jeskell Systems LLC on Tuesday, July 29th at 6:30 pm to learn about, “Text-Analytics and Visualization using IBM Big Data Technologies"

Have you ever wondered what your customers are saying about you in Social Media, and the impact it might have on your day to day operations? How about enhancing Public Safety by empowering first responders with near-real time information in the context of fire, floods and other natural disasters.

As enterprises seek to gain operational efficiencies and competitive advantage through greater use of analytics, much of the new information they need to analyze is found in text documents, increasingly, in a wide variety of social media sites and portals.

During this meet-up, we will demonstrate two major Hadoop components:

•  Text Analytics in Hadoop powered by Annotator Query Language (AQL).  AQL is a powerful declarative, rule-based language for the extraction of information from text documents. 

• Spreadsheet for Hadoop powered by BigSheets.   BigSheets is a unique visualization and analysis tool designed to quickly build and publish charts and graphs for Big Data Applications.

We will have several demos.  The demos will show you how you can store and analyze large volumes of current & historical social media and reference data. You'll see how raw datasets can be ingested and analyzed in real time. This talk and demo will provide an introduction to Text-Analytics and BigSheets, and how it is used within the IBM Big Data platform.

This Meetup is FREE.  Food and Beverages will also be provided.

Apache Spark is an open source processing engine built around speed, ease of use, and analytics. If you have large amounts of data that requires low latency processing that a typical Map Reduce program cannot provide, Spark is the alternative.

Spark performs at speeds up to 100 times faster than Map Reduce for iterative algorithms or interactive data mining. Spark provides in-memory cluster computing for lightning fast speed and supports Java, Scala, and Python APIs for ease of development. Spark allows data scientists to build models quickly and supports iterative jobs on distributed datasets. This means more people can apply deep intelligence into applications to make everything smarter, including the Internet of Things (IoT), machine learning, web, mobile, social, business process and more. 

Do you believe in the value of Spark, in the speed, efficiency and flexibility of this in-memory compute engine? IBM does.  Emphatically.That's why we're committed to do everything we can to accelerate the adoption of Spark for enterprise analytics, where Spark promises seemingly unlimited value.

On June 15, 2015, IBM will host a Spark Community event in San Francisco, California: IBM | Spark - The Start of Something Big in Data and Design. There will be a live demo showcase, refreshments, and a Town Hall discussion featuring some of the most trail-blazing data scientists in today's Spark Community, including:
  Edd Dumbill, VP Strategy, Silicon Valley Data Science
•  Mike Tamir, Chief Science Officer & VP of Data Science & Education at Galvanize
•   Fernando Perez, Staff Scientist at Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory & Founding Investigator of the Berkeley Institute for Data Science
•   Haoyuan Li, CEO and Founder of Tachyon Nexus
•   Shankar Venkataraman, Distinguished Engineer & CTO, IBM Analytics Platform at IBM
•   Paco Nathan, Director, Community Evangelism, Databricks

Historically, choosing and implementing a database technology has been a highly complex, and often painstaking, endeavor. You have to determine what data to capture and store, build your data models, and pick a database technology that will allow you to quickly gain insights from the data you collected. Then you are tasked with building the physical system to support your project.

With IBM's 'Open for Data' cloud computing initiative you can gain instant access to critical business insights without the hefty up-front infrastructure investment. With rapid cloud provisioning you can choose the database technology best suited for your needs and analyze/visualize your data in minutes, empowering you with true business agility. If your business needs change you can quickly move your data to the data store best suited for your needs.

Please join us at the IBM TEC in McLean, Virginia, on Wednesday, April 20, 2016 at 6 pm as we discuss the types of data stores available on the IBM cloud today, and how to choose the best data store for each of your projects. We will demonstrate how to provision and load data onto JSON-based and SQL-based analytic data stores, and how to query that data to gain immediate insights. Space is limited, so sign up today. Pizza and beverages will be served!
column17: Which Cloud Data Store Should I Choose for my Project? Meetup in McLean TEC

column3:
The rise of NoSQL databases has changed the way we think about storing data. For years, on-premise relational databases have been the standard method of data storage across the IT industry. Some applications, however, have benefited greatly by making the shift to a NoSQL data store. Rising to prominence in the mid-2000's, NoSQL gained a solid traction with the boom in mobile technology. Today NoSQL databases are a critical element of countless traditional, mobile, and Internet of Things applications.

With IBM's "Open for Data" cloud computing initiative, current and prospective users can provision a NoSQL database in a matter of minutes without a hefty up-front infrastructure investment. The power of the cloud empowers users to scale up massively based on business needs. De-provisioning resources when those needs change is equally as agile, giving our users the best value for performance.

Please join us on Wednesday, May 4, 2016 at 12:00 noon as we discuss the types of JSON databases that IBM offers in the cloud today, and how to decide if your project is suited to break the relational paradigm. We will demonstrate how to provision a NoSQL database instance and how to query that data. Food and beverages will be provided. Seats are limited, so sign up today!

PLEASE NOTE: This event has limited number of seating. Please do not RSVP if you're not planning to attend.

column17: IBM is Hiring... looking for innovative Open Source (Big Data) Candidates

column3:
with Andrew J. Levine
Technical Sales Specialist - Cloud Data Services

Apache Spark is an open source big data processing framework built around speed, ease of use, and sophisticated analytics. First developed in 2009, Spark provides several advantages over other big data and MapReduce technologies. With Spark, Hadoop clusters can run up to 100 times faster in memory, and 10 times faster when running on disk. With the ability to write applications in Java, Scala or even Python, Spark is a flexible and power paradigm.

With IBM's "Open for Data" cloud computing initiative, current and prospective users can provision an instance of Spark in the cloud in a matter of minutes without up-front infrastructure investment. The power of the cloud empowers users to scale up massively based on business needs. De-provisioning resources when those needs change is equally as agile, giving our users the best value for performance.

Please join us on Wednesday, June 22, 2016 at 12:00 noon as we discuss Spark both deployed as a service and on premise. After an introduction to Spark, we'll talk about how to decide if your project is well suited for processing in the cloud. Finally we'll perform a brief demonstration. Food and beverages will be provided. Seats are limited, so sign up today!
column17: Introduction to Spark In-memory Computing

column3:
THIS IS A GLOBAL ON-LINE HACKATHON THAT BEGINS MAY 23, 2016 AND NOW ENDS AUGUST 23, 2016.  SUBMISSIONS DUE AUGUST 23rd BY 5:00 PM EST. 

We’re extending the hackathon deadline to August 23 - that’s 20 additional days to build your Spark enterprise app. (View the revised competition calendar HERE.  We're giving you more time because....

We’re adding new enterprise data resources to the site and we want to give you a chance to incorporate these into your projects, if you so choose.  Our awesome data co-sponsors Yelp and Uncharted Software have generously shared some of their enterprise data sets for you to use during the hackathon.

Yelp’s data includes 2.2M reviews by 552K users for 77K businesses. The Uncharted data includes Bitcoin network transactions from processing the Bitcoin blockchain as of mid-2014 and Amazon product reviews from 1995 through 2003. For a fuller description and data access, visit our resources page.

Uncharted Software also has a couple cool Spark data visualization libraries you should check out: Salt and SparkPipe.

And, in case you’d like to weigh the effects of weather on business operations, we’re also offering access to the full suite of Weather Company APIs for the duration of the hackathon.

Finally, if you’re looking for a hosting solution for your Spark app, we’re now offering extended Bluemix trials for all hackathon participants. Using Bluemix services to build your project is totally optional, but might be a good way to get your app up and running — particularly with the IBM Analytics for Apache Spark service.

You can request your extended Bluemix trial code here.  For all hackathon participants, trials will extend through November 1, 2016. Now go forth and optimize for the enterprise!

---------------------

Build an Apache Spark application to address a real business problem or core concern related to customer care, marketing, risk management or operations. Join IBM and Devpost for a global hackathon using Apache Spark Makers Build.  There are $100,000 in cash prizes.  Submissions can be sent in up to August 23rd.

Participation Details: To participate in the global virtual hackathon, you can register here.  Please review all registration guidelines.

For the hack, you will apply Apache Spark's powerful analytics capabilities to enterprise and other relevant data so data scientists and software developers can build an analytics or mobile/web app that tackles a key business problem in marketing, customer case, operations or risk management.  The grand prize is $50,000, and the top three winners each get a meeting with the judge or
Spark community expert of their choice; the judging panel includes data experts from Tesla, Netflix, and Silicon Valley Data Science.

Go to apachespark.devpost.com for full details and registration.  Please review all registration rules.

Questions?

We're here to help. If you have any questions about the hackathon, post on the discussion forum or email support@devpost.com and we'll respond as soon as we can.

column3:
IBM values our community of clients and business partners. Each year, we support and build our community by working closely with IBM advocates and helping them to become 

IBM Champions

IBM Champions are a select group of external advocates made up of clients, business partners and independent consultants who make exceptional contributions to the technical community by speaking at conferences, running or actively participating in user groups, evangelizing relevant technical topics via social media, and helping our clients make the most of IBM technology. 

We are looking for clients and business partners to join the program and are looking for applications in the areas of data science, data engineering, application development, and business analytics.

Nominations are due by Monday, November 28, 2016

The Champion program is open to candidates worldwide, and candidates may self-nominate or be nominated by someone else. IBM employees are not eligible for the program.  Some benefits of the IBM Champion program: 
- IBM Champions advocate IBM offerings in the community with competence and credibility (content, blogs, presentations, customer references, analyst/press, videos/podcasts, etc.)
- IBM Champions share knowledge with and provide support to the IBM user community (books, articles, blogs, forums, presentations, education, beta programs and customer advisory councils etc.)
- IBM Champions support IBM as brand ambassadors who build awareness, share product knowledge, and provide product feedback as users and beta testers

Read this  blog post  for full IBM Champion program criteria, guidelines and the <a>nomination form</a>.

To learn more about the IBM Champion program from current Champions and Worldwide IBM Champion coordinator Libby Ingrassia, listen to this webcast. Be sure to share the blog and webcast with clients and colleagues who would make great IBM Champions.
column17: IBM Champions - Call for Nominations

column3:
RSVP: http://bit.ly/2gOcufe

This webinar will cover an overview of Watson Data Platform capabilities and how to empower users across the organization to make the most out of their data. What if you can shorten the time it takes to create value out of your existing organizational data ? 

What if you can provision a common analytic engine with managed services that will enable you to embrace multiple cloud platforms ? IBM Watson Data Platform is the first cloud-based data and analytics platform to support cognitive businesses. It enables access, collaboration and paths to insights by connecting all users through trusted access to a variety of data, discovering new possibilities and opportunities with built-in intelligence, automation and machine learning and accelerating outcomes with rapid deployment of new data models and fast embedding of insights into processes, applications and services. 

Let us show you how Watson Data Platform can be the milestone of your organization analytics strategy and empower your organization into the new Cognitive analytics era.

Speaker Bio:
Gerardo Rodríguez Díaz – is an avid traveler, technologist enthusiast and Big data and Analytics cloud solution specialist focused on communications and computer systems integrations industries across North America. GRD areas of specialization are IT, Marketing and Business Intelligence having worked across European, North and South American markets.
column17: Making Data Simple in the Cognitive Era

column3:
The demand for machine learning is booming! 

Calling all IT executives, data scientists, Chief Data Officers, data architects and other data geeks.  Join us on February 15th from 2:00-5:30 pm ET via livestream  (replay available starting February 16th) , and discover how machine learning is fundamentally changing the way we work and live.  Hear about cognitive applications that anticipate behavior and learn from data without being explicitly programmed.

You'll learn about the latest breakthrough developments on machine learning as well as Spark, data and analytics. Mike Gualtieri, Vice President and Principal Analyst, Forrester, will present his view on how to best leverage technologies such as big data, predictive analytics, Hadoop/Spark, machine learning, data science, and AI.  Rob Thomas, General Manager, IBM Analytics will host an agenda which will include guest speakers and cover the following topics:

•  Machine Learning Overview

•  Top Trends in Machine Learning & Cognitive Applications

•  Cognitive Analytics and Machine Learning for the Enterprise

•  Live Product Demonstration & Client Roundtable on Machine Learning

•  Data Innovation with Hybrid Transaction/Analytical Processing

•  Spark & Machine Learning for Enterprise Systems

For additional details and to REGISTER, please visit MACHINE LEARNING.

Register NOW and we'll send you a reminder!

THE BIG DATA FOR SOCIAL GOOD CHALLENGE BEGINS NOVEMBER 10, 2014 AND CONTINUES TO MARCH 3, 2015. 

CALLING ALL DEVELOPERS .... JOIN THE BIG DATA FOR SOCIAL GOOD CHALLENGE

Big data exists in just about everything we use and do. It comes from phones, cars, roads, power lines, waterways, food crates, and innumerable other items you’d never think of as computers. This data speaks volumes about our collective behavior and society – so let’s use it to do something incredible! IBM invites developers and data enthusiasts to take a deep dive into real world civic issues using big data and the IBM Bluemix Analytics for Hadoop service. Analyze one of our curated datasets or bring your own (provided it meets these requirements)! Use Hadoop and your data to create a clickable and interactive data visualization to highlight insights that you’ve found.

Ready to get started? $40,000 in prizes will be awarded....

Register here:http://ibmhadoop.challengepost.com/<a href="http://ibmhadoop.challengepost.com/"></a>

What to Create: Participants must create a working, clickable, and interactive data visualization utilizing the Analytics for Hadoop service<a href="http://www.ibm.com/developerworks/library/ba-analytics-for-hadoop1/index.html"></a> on IBM Bluemix.

Data Requirements: Your data visualization must analyze one or more datasets included in the curated list of datasets on the Data page OR meet the data size, content, and licensing requirements described on the Data page. The total size of the Datasets analyzed must be between 500MB - 7GB in size.

Check out the requirements then go get your IBM Bluemix extended promo code and check out the datasets!
column17: Big Data for Social Good Challenge (See Details for Start/End)
column33: Big Data for Social Good Challenge

column3:
- Français:

Nous sommes ravis d'annoncer le lancement de la communauté "Big Data Developer" à Montréal. Nous espérons vous rencontrer tous pour notre évènement inaugural à Montréal. Ce groupe s'addresse aux développeurs, statisticiens et à tous les enthousiastes et les praticiens du Big Data. Nos meetups offrent une opportunité d`apprendre les dernières nouveautés dans le domaine des technologies Big Data et, pour certaines sessions d`avoir une expérience pratique sur les solutions Big Data et les outils associés. Pour la premier évènement qui va démarrer cette communauté, la session va être consacrée aux concepts clés de Hadoop (HDFS, MapReduce, YARN, Spark...), ainsi qu'une revue rapide du riche écosystème des projets Apache Open Source autour de Hadoop (HBase, Hive, Pig, Sqoop, Flume...). Cette session d`introduction sera suivie d'une session plus courte consacrée à l`exploitation du langage R sur Hadoop avec BigR, un composant de la distribution Hadoop d'IBM BigInsights. Cette première session sur Hadoop est très accessible s'addresse principalement à une audience familière avec la problématique de l'analyse de données en entreprise,
d'intelligence d'affaires et des sciences de données et qui souhaite raffermir leurs connaissances de base sur Hadoop au délà des "buzz words", et sera particulièrement bénéfique à ceux qui font leur premier saut sur Hadoop.

- English:

We are thrilled to announce the launch of the Big Data Developer Meetup community in Montreal! We hope to see everyone out to the inaugural event in Montreal.
This group is geared towards developers, data scientists and ALL Big Data enthusiasts and practitioners. Our meetups provide an opportunity to learn about the latest in Big Data technologies and get hands on experience on Big Data solution and tools. This being the first session to kick of the community, this session will focus to key concepts of Hadoop (HDFS, MapReduce, YARN, Spark...), as well as a quick overview of the rich ecosystem of Hadoop Apache Open Source projects around Hadoop (HBase, Hive, Pig, Sqoop, Flume...). This introductory session will be followed by a shorter session on using the langage R on Hadoop with BigR, a component of IBM Hadoop distribution BigInsights.

This first session on Hadoop is very accessible and is targeted primarily to an audience familiar with the problematic of enterprise analytics, business intelligence, and data science, who want to enrich their Hadoop knowledge beyond buzz words. The session will be particularly beneficial to those doing their first dive into Hadoop.
column17: Big Data Developers Montreal Kick-off

column3:
- Français:


Après la vue d'ensemble sur Hadoop précédente, nous planifions une session dédiée à Apache Spark. Spark, qui est une plate-forme de traitement distribué de données, brille par sa performance, sa facilité d'utilisation, ainsi qu'un ensemble d'outils de plus haut niveau pour faciliter son usage. Grâce à son intégration sur Hadoop, Apache Spark s'impose de facto comme une alternative attractive par rapport à Map Reduce.

Cette présentation sera dédiée à Spark, avec une revue de son architecture, ses composants, son fonctionnement ainsi que son intégration sur Hadoop. Une démonstration sera faite en fin de session à partir d`un Lab. Nous essayerons dans la mesure du possible de partager les instructions du Lab à l`avance pour ceux qui souhaitent le faire durant la session.

Cette session est de niveau introductive sur Spark. Elle sera bénéfique à l`ensemble des participants qui ont assisté à la première session de ce Meetup sur Hadoop, et aussi ceux familiers avec Hadoop, ou en général familiers avec la problématique de traitement de données massives  à des fins analytiques (R, bases de données MPP).

Le matériel sera en Anglais. La présentation sera faite en Français. L`interaction avec le présentateur et les discussions peuvent être faites en Anglais ou Français selon votre préférence.


- English:

After the initial Hadoop overview, we are planning a session on Apache Spark. Spark, as an engine for large scale data processing, is shining by its speed, its ease of use, and a set of higher level tools to facilitate its use. With its integration on Hadoop, Apache Spark is seen as the de facto alternative to Map Reduce.

This presentation will focus on Spark, with a review of its architecture, its components, its operation, as well as its integration on Hadoop. A demo will be done at the end of the session based on a Lab. We will try our best to share the instructions for the Lab in advance for those who are willing to do it during the session.

This session is of an introductory level on Spark. It will be beneficial to the audience who attended the first session on Hadoop, as well as those familiar with Hadoop, or generally familiar with the problematic of big data processing for analytics purpose (R, MPP databases).

The material will be in English. The presentation will be in French. Interaction with the speaker, and discussions can be held in either English or French according to your preference.
column17: Apache Spark

column3:
THIS IS A WEB CONFERENCE ONLY.  TIME OF WEB CONFERENCE LOCALLY IS BASED ON LIVE-STREAM START - PACIFIC DAYLIGHT TIME. DETAILS TO CONNECT TO LIVE-STREAM ARE INDICATED BELOW. 

Apache Spark is an open source processing engine built around speed, ease of use, and analytics. If you have large amounts of data that requires low latency processing that a typical Map Reduce program cannot provide, Spark is the alternative.

Spark performs at speeds up to 100 times faster than Map Reduce for iterative algorithms or interactive data mining. Spark provides in-memory cluster computing for lightning fast speed and supports Java, Scala, and Python APIs for ease of development. Spark allows data scientists to build models quickly and supports iterative jobs on distributed datasets. This means more people can apply deep intelligence into applications to make everything smarter, including the Internet of Things (IoT), machine learning, web, mobile, social, business process and more. 

Do you believe in the value of Spark, in the speed, efficiency and flexibility of this in-memory compute engine? IBM does.  Emphatically.That's why we're committed to do everything we can to accelerate the adoption of Spark for enterprise analytics, where Spark promises seemingly unlimited value.

On June 15, 2015, IBM will host a Spark Community event in San Francisco, California: IBM | Spark - The Start of Something Big in Data and Design. There will be a live demo showcase, refreshments, and a Town Hall discussion featuring some of the most trail-blazing data scientists in today's Spark Community, including:
  Edd Dumbill, VP Strategy, Silicon Valley Data Science
•  Mike Tamir, Chief Science Officer & VP of Data Science & Education at Galvanize
•   Fernando Perez, Staff Scientist at Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory & Founding Investigator of the Berkeley Institute for Data Science
•   Haoyuan Li, CEO and Founder of Tachyon Nexus
•   Shankar Venkataraman, Distinguished Engineer & CTO, IBM Analytics Platform at IBM
•   Paco Nathan, Director, Community Evangelism, Databricks

Spark Community members will also deliver 5-minute lightning talks to describe exciting projects they're working on.

We will provide a livestream presentation of what these Spark leaders have to say.

Live Streaming Link:

To get additional details about Spark you can sign up now for a reminder at:

http://www.ibm.com/analytics/us/en/technology/spark/

Scroll down to "Can't attend in Person"?  Sign up for a reminder and add it to your calendar.

Additional information on Spark:

Link to Spark Fundamentals Course in Big Data University

http://bigdatauniversity.com/bdu-wp/bdu-course/spark-fundamentals/

Link to Spark Technology Information

http://www.ibm.com/analytics/us/en/technology/spark/

Happy Sparking.
column17: IBM | Spark - The start of something big in data & design (Web Conference Only)

column3:
- Français:

Pour le premier évènement de cet automne, ce Meetup sera consacré aux concepts clés de Hadoop (HDFS, MapReduce, YARN, Spark...), ainsi qu`une revue rapide de l`écosystème riche des projets Apache Open Source autour de Hadoop (Pig, HBase, Flume...).

Cette session introductive sur Hadoop sera suivie d`une autre session consacrée au sujet de SQL sur Hadoop. Un premier volet sera un survol de Hive, projet Apache Open source top-level, qui offre une interface SQL pour des requêtes de type data warehouse sur Hadoop. Ce survol sera suivi d`une discussion sur BigSQL, qui est le moteur SQL sur Hadoop d`IBM, faisant partie de IBM BigInsights, la distribution Hadoop d`IBM.

Cette session sur Hadoop très accessible s`addresse principalement à une audience familière avec la problématique de l`analyse de données en entreprise, d'intelligence d'affaires et des sciences de données et qui souhaite raffermir leurs connaissances de base sur Hadoop au délà des "buzz words", et sera particulièrement bénéfique à ceux qui font leur premier saut sur Hadoop, et ceux qui souhaitent en savoir plus sur l`utilisation de SQL sur Hadoop.

Le matériel sera en Anglais. La session sera conduite en Français. Les discussions et questions peuvent être faites en Français ou Anglais selon votre préférence.

Nous espérons vous voir nombreux lors de cette session du 5 Novembre !


- English:

For the first event of the fall, this Meetup will focus on key concepts of Hadoop (HDFS, MapReduce, YARN, Spark...), as well as a quick overview of the rich ecosystem of Hadoop Apache Open Source projects around Hadoop (Pig, HBase, Flume...).

This introductory session will be followed by another session on the topic of SQL on Hadoop. In the first part, an overview of Hive, Apache

Open Source top ket project, which offers a SQL interface for data warehouse workloads on Hadoop. This overview will be followed by a discussion on BigSQL, which is IBM's SQL on Hadoop engine, offered with IBM BigInsights, IBM`s Hadoop distribution.

This session on Hadoop is very accessible and is targeted primarily to an audience familiar with the problematic of enterprise analytics, business intelligence, and data science, who want to enrich their Hadoop knowledge beyond buzz words. The session will be particularly beneficial to those doing their first dive into Hadoop, and those who want to find out more about how to use SQL on Hadoop.

The material will be in English. The session will be done in French. Discussions and Question/Answers can be held either in French or English according to your preference.

Hoping to see you all on November 5th!

Agenda:

- 17:45-18:00: Networking & Pizza

- 18:00-19:00: Hadoop 101: Open source Hadoop Overview

- 19h00-20:00: SQL on Hadoop: Apache Hive & IBM BigSQL

IBM InfoSphere Streams V3.2 (referred to as Streams) delivers a highly scalable, agile software infrastructure to perform in-motion analytics on a wide variety of relational and non-relational data types that enter the enterprise at unprecedented volumes and speed, and from thousands of real-time sources. Streams V3.2 includes new features and functions designed to instantly analyze and fuse massive volumes of data and integrates with existing infrastructures. It delivers new capabilities to improve usability, support enterprise readiness, and streamline enterprise integration.

WHAT:

The following new features and functions, which will be covered during the Streams Developer Conference:

Usability:
• Remote Development with Streams Studio for Windows and Linux
• User Defined Parallelism
• Java Streams development simplification

Enterprise readiness:
• Operational Decision Management adapter for business rules
• Access to application data using Representational State Transfer (REST)

Enterprise integration:
• MQTT adapters
• Hadoop Big SQL support
• HP Vertica Analytic Database support

Who should attend:

The event assumes you are familiar with Streams. If you are not, please either try the Big Data University Streams course or review some of the Streams videos on YouTube.

WHEN:

Webcast on Thursday November 14, 2013 from 10:00AM to 6:00PM U.S. Eastern Standard Time.

WHERE:

The webcast will be recorded and posted to Big Data University (BDU) at the following Big Data University course ID.

NOTE: There will be no physical location for this meetup and it will all be online.

To get more info, download presentations, get detailed agenda and to register for the event check out the BDU Streams Developers Virtual Conference landing page.

The detailed agenda will be posted at the BDU class/event page after Oct 31.

Please join us on the live LotusLive meeting webcast. The conference ID is 2058889. Audio in listen only mode will be available on the webcast.

We look forward to sharing details about these new capabilities.

column3:
Participe en un exclusivo Big Data Developer Day, organizado por el equipo de Big Data de IBM. El proyecto open source de Apache Hadoop es un excelente framework para proceso distribuído de grandes volúmenes de datos. Pero hay una diferencia entre "jugar" con big data y resolver problemas de verdad. La realidad es que sólo  Hadoop puede que no sea suficiente. Experimente Hadoop de clase empresarial con el producto de IBM, InfoSphere BigInsights, que mejora la versión de open source de Hadoop con capacidades empresariales incluyendo: analíticos, visualización, seguridad, SQL estándar, HBase, herramientas de desarrollo/administración. Aprenda del conceptos como "Big Data in Motion", "Big Data Exploration" y más. La sesión de la mañana incluirá discusiones de casos de uso de Big Data, una vista general de lo que es Big Data, demostraciones en vivo de los componentes clave para manejar datos en movimiento y datos en reposo.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=B27SpLOOhWw&list=PL7FnN5oi7Ez_p0XyFGI_XDF6C8Hj4R6-k&index=18

En la sesión de la tarde, use el producto IBM InfoSphere BigInsights Quick Start Edition con la guía de expertos en desarrollo. Es un una oportunidad única para desarrollar habilidades y aprender de nuevas y excitantes tecnologías y técnicas que puede usar inmediatamente en su empresa.


Este evento es completamente GRATIS. La comida es por cuenta propia de los participantes. Para los asistentes que utilicen transporte particular, pueden usar el estacionamiento del ITAM (el costo es por cuenta del participante).


Agenda


09:00 - 09:30  Registro


09:30 - 10:00  Bienvenida y conferencia de apertura

10:00 - 10:45  Big Data para datos en reposo (Hadoop) y demo

10:45 - 11:00  Receso

11:00 - 11:45 Big Data para datos en movimiento y demo

11:45 - 12:15  Tutorial 1: Conocer el ambiente de IBM InfoSphere BigInsights


12.15 - 13:00 Tutorial 2: Importando datos para el análisis


13:00 - 14:00  Comida

14:00 - 14:45 Tutorial 3: Analizando bigdata con BigSheets


14:45 - 15:30 Tutorial 4: Desarrollando tu primer aplicación BigData


15:30 - 16:15  Tutorial 5: BigSQL


16:15 - 17:00 Tutorial 6: Text Analytics


17:00 - 17:30  Cierre del evento

Los laboratorios se harán con la máquina virtual (VM) de BigInsights Quick Start Edition. Haga click en la liga para ver el video de como preparar la VM de BigInsights. Para aprender más antes del evento vaya a Big Data University:

Liga para bajar la VM:

http://www-01.ibm.com/software/data/infosphere/biginsights/quick-start/

Liga del video de preparación de VM:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=imIVJjUhrVo

Big Data University

http://bigdatauniversity.com


Los lugares son limitados, así que reserve a tiempo.


El registro es requerido. Reserve haciendo click en el boton de YES RSVP de este Meetup.


¡Gracias y esperamos verlo pronto!

IBM te invita a participar en el developerWorks day, foro en el cual descubrirás y aprenderás sobre las últimas tendencias de la Nube que beneficiarán tu desarrollo profesional.

El cómputo en la Nube basa su potencial en ahorrar costos de inversión en infraestructura, tiempo en el desarrollo e implementación de aplicaciones.

Av. Ejército Nacional No. 613 Mezzanine

- Aprender la primera plataforma de gestión de datos para aprovechar la disponibilidad, elasticidad y alcance de la Nube para crear una red de distribución global de datos.

column3:
Discutiremos las diferentes alternativas de SQL en Hadoop y exploraremos por qué esas tecnologías se han convertido en un área de alta relevancia para muchas organizaciones. Se abordarán las alternativas (Drill, Impala, Hive, Hadapt, Tajo, Shark, HAWQ, Presto, Phoenix y BigSQL) y sus pros y contras. Compartiremos casos de clientes para Modernización de Warehouse y el rol de SQL para Hadoop en esta área, así como las características de desempeño de SQL en Hadoop cuando se corren queries de cargas de trabajo comunes.


También escucharemos del equipo de IBM cuáles son los retos técnicos cuando se desarrollan soluciones de SQL en Hadoop, cómo se resolvieron esos retos y cuáles son el siguiente conjunto de situaciones a enfrentar en la evolución de SQL en Hadoop. Se proveerá una introducción a Big SQL y una demo. IBM Big SQL entrega muchas capacidades muy interesantes incluyendo funcionalidad completa de SQL que toma ventaja del compilador/runtime avanzado de SQL con baja latencia y alto desempeño.

Aprenda más de Big SQL aquí. Lea el nuevo white paper de SQL en Hadoop.

Pruebe Big SQL por Usted mismo, ya sea en la nube o en una VM.

CALLING ALL DEVELOPERS .... JOIN THE BIG DATA FOR SOCIAL GOOD CHALLENGE

Big data exists in just about everything we use and do. It comes from phones, cars, roads, power lines, waterways, food crates, and innumerable other items you’d never think of as computers. This data speaks volumes about our collective behavior and society – so let’s use it to do something incredible! IBM invites developers and data enthusiasts to take a deep dive into real world civic issues using big data and the IBM Bluemix Analytics for Hadoop service. Analyze one of our curated datasets or bring your own (provided it meets these requirements)! Use Hadoop and your data to create a clickable and interactive data visualization to highlight insights that you’ve found.

Ready to get started? $40,000 in prizes will be awarded....

Register here:http://ibmhadoop.challengepost.com/

What to Create: Participants must create a working, clickable, and interactive data visualization utilizing the Analytics for Hadoop service on IBM Bluemix.

Data Requirements: Your data visualization must analyze one or more datasets included in the curated list of datasets on the Data page OR meet the data size, content, and licensing requirements described on the Data page. The total size of the Datasets analyzed must be between 500MB - 7GB in size.

Check out the requirements then go get your IBM Bluemix extended promo code and check out the datasets!

THIS IS A WEB CONFERENCE ONLY.  TIME OF WEB CONFERENCE LOCALLY IS BASED ON LIVE-STREAM START - PACIFIC DAYLIGHT TIME. DETAILS TO CONNECT TO LIVE-STREAM ARE INDICATED BELOW. 

Apache Spark is an open source processing engine built around speed, ease of use, and analytics. If you have large amounts of data that requires low latency processing that a typical Map Reduce program cannot provide, Spark is the alternative.

Spark performs at speeds up to 100 times faster than Map Reduce for iterative algorithms or interactive data mining. Spark provides in-memory cluster computing for lightning fast speed and supports Java, Scala, and Python APIs for ease of development. Spark allows data scientists to build models quickly and supports iterative jobs on distributed datasets. This means more people can apply deep intelligence into applications to make everything smarter, including the Internet of Things (IoT), machine learning, web, mobile, social, business process and more. 

Do you believe in the value of Spark, in the speed, efficiency and flexibility of this in-memory compute engine? IBM does.  Emphatically.That's why we're committed to do everything we can to accelerate the adoption of Spark for enterprise analytics, where Spark promises seemingly unlimited value.

On June 15, 2015, IBM will host a Spark Community event in San Francisco, California: IBM | Spark - The Start of Something Big in Data and Design. There will be a live demo showcase, refreshments, and a Town Hall discussion featuring some of the most trail-blazing data scientists in today's Spark Community, including:

•  Edd Dumbill, VP Strategy, Silicon Valley Data Science
•  Mike Tamir, Chief Science Officer & VP of Data Science & Education at Galvanize
•   Fernando Perez, Staff Scientist at Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory & Founding Investigator of the Berkeley Institute for Data Science
•   Haoyuan Li, CEO and Founder of Tachyon Nexus
•   Shankar Venkataraman, Distinguished Engineer & CTO, IBM Analytics Platform at IBM
•   Paco Nathan, Director, Community Evangelism, Databricks

Spark Community members will also deliver 5-minute lightning talks to describe exciting projects they're working on.

We will provide a livestream presentation of what these Spark leaders have to say.

Live Streaming Link:

To get additional details about Spark you can sign up now for a reminder at:

http://www.ibm.com/analytics/us/en/technology/spark/

Scroll down to "Can't attend in Person"?  Sign up for a reminder and add it to your calendar.

Additional information on Spark:

Link to Spark Fundamentals Course in Big Data University

http://bigdatauniversity.com/bdu-wp/bdu-course/spark-fundamentals/

Link to Spark Technology Information

http://www.ibm.com/analytics/us/en/technology/spark/

Happy Sparking.

On June 6, 2016, leading minds in data and analytics from Tesla, Netflix, Silicon Valley Data Science, and IBM will come together to demonstrate how open data and analytics technologies such as R, Spark, Python and more are forming a vibrant ecosystem.  The community has a shared goal of working with all data to build unexpected insights and launch new business applications.

The Apache Spark Maker Community Event will bring together data scientists, data engineers, data developers, and data designers June 6th @ 6pm at Galvanize, San Francisco. Here’s the plan:   

- The Big Reveal – New sample Apache Spark apps and tools

- Use Cases – Monsanto will share how they are using R and Spark to optimize their supply chain

- Learning Session - Hear from experts working on Spark projects and building the Spark ecosystem of open data and analytics technologies

- Networking Opportunity – Food, drinks and data, explore a Hall of Innovation showcasing Spark demos

Join us. Learn more here: 

Apache Spark Maker Community Event 

We realize you may not be able to attend in person, however, we are live streaming the event.  Register for the live stream and we'll send you a calendar update and login link.

THIS IS A GLOBAL ON-LINE HACKATHON THAT BEGINS MAY 23, 2016 AND NOW ENDS AUGUST 23, 2016.  SUBMISSIONS DUE AUGUST 23rd BY 5:00 PM EST. 

We’re extending the hackathon deadline to August 23 - that’s 20 additional days to build your Spark enterprise app. (View the revised competition calendar HERE.  We're giving you more time because....

We’re adding new enterprise data resources to the site and we want to give you a chance to incorporate these into your projects, if you so choose.  Our awesome data co-sponsors Yelp and Uncharted Software have generously shared some of their enterprise data sets for you to use during the hackathon.

Yelp’s data includes 2.2M reviews by 552K users for 77K businesses. The Uncharted data includes Bitcoin network transactions from processing the Bitcoin blockchain as of mid-2014 and Amazon product reviews from 1995 through 2003. For a fuller description and data access, visit our resources page.

Uncharted Software also has a couple cool Spark data visualization libraries you should check out: Salt and SparkPipe.

And, in case you’d like to weigh the effects of weather on business operations, we’re also offering access to the full suite of Weather Company APIs for the duration of the hackathon.

Finally, if you’re looking for a hosting solution for your Spark app, we’re now offering extended Bluemix trials for all hackathon participants. Using Bluemix services to build your project is totally optional, but might be a good way to get your app up and running — particularly with the IBM Analytics for Apache Spark service.

You can request your extended Bluemix trial code here.  For all hackathon participants, trials will extend through November 1, 2016. Now go forth and optimize for the enterprise!

---------------------

Build an Apache Spark application to address a real business problem or core concern related to customer care, marketing, risk management or operations. Join IBM and Devpost for a global hackathon using Apache Spark Makers Build.  There are $100,000 in cash prizes.  Submissions can be sent in up to August 23rd.

Participation Details: To participate in the global virtual hackathon, you can register here.  Please review all registration guidelines.

For the hack, you will apply Apache Spark's powerful analytics capabilities to enterprise and other relevant data so data scientists and software developers can build an analytics or mobile/web app that tackles a key business problem in marketing, customer case, operations or risk management.  The grand prize is $50,000, and the top three winners each get a meeting with the judge or
Spark community expert of their choice; the judging panel includes data experts from Tesla, Netflix, and Silicon Valley Data Science.

Go to apachespark.devpost.com for full details and registration.  Please review all registration rules.

Questions?

We're here to help. If you have any questions about the hackathon, post on the discussion forum or email support@devpost.com and we'll respond as soon as we can.

The demand for machine learning is booming! 

Calling all IT executives, data scientists, Chief Data Officers, data architects and other data geeks.  Join us on February 15th from 2:00-5:30 pm ET via livestream  (replay available starting February 16th) , and discover how machine learning is fundamentally changing the way we work and live.  Hear about cognitive applications that anticipate behavior and learn from data without being explicitly programmed.

You'll learn about the latest breakthrough developments on machine learning as well as Spark, data and analytics. Mike Gualtieri, Vice President and Principal Analyst, Forrester, will present his view on how to best leverage technologies such as big data, predictive analytics, Hadoop/Spark, machine learning, data science, and AI.  Rob Thomas, General Manager, IBM Analytics will host an agenda which will include guest speakers and cover the following topics:

•  Machine Learning Overview

•  Top Trends in Machine Learning & Cognitive Applications

•  Cognitive Analytics and Machine Learning for the Enterprise

•  Live Product Demonstration & Client Roundtable on Machine Learning

Imagine What You Could Do with Enterprise NoSQL

Data can be an enabler — or an inhibitor – depending on the tools you have to manage and manipulate it. As new data types flood organizations, the pressure is on to take all this any structured data and find value in it.
Learn how organizations of all sizes, across all industries, are using the power of Enterprise NoSQL to create an agile database platform that allows them to quickly turn data into actionable information to make better decisions, create new products, comply with laws or provide access to their citizens and customers. Hear from industry experts from MarkLogic, Reed Construction, Avalon Consulting and Smarlogic. To register, go to http://info.marklogic.com/2013-BDN-Tour-Atlanta.html

UPDATE: Visitor parking is on the 4th floor of the parking garage which leads to the 1st level of Building A (on the left when coming from the parking garage).  See you on the 17th!!


DON'T MISS THIS GREAT OPPORTUNITY.  RSVP HERE ON THIS MEETUP.  MEETING WILL BE FIRST FLOOR OF THE IBM BUILDING ON BARFIELD. 


Big data exploration addresses the challenge faced by every large organization: business information is spread across multiple systems and silos and people need access to that data to meet their job requirements and make important decisions. Big Data Exploration enables you to explore and mine big data to find, visualize, and understand all your data to improve decision making. By creating a unified view of information across all data sources - both inside and outside of your organization - you gain enhanced value and new insights.


Ask yourself:

• Are you struggling to manage and extract value from the growing volume and variety of data and need to unify information across federated sources?


• Are you unable to relate “raw” data collected from system logs, sensors, or click streams with customer and line-of-business data managed in your enterprise systems?

• Do you risk exposing unsecure personal information and/or privileged data due to lack of information awareness?

If you answered yes to any of the above questions, the big data exploration use case is the best starting point for your big data journey.   Join us to learn more about this use case via a technical presentation and demo.

Open source Apache Hadoop is a great framework for distributed processing of large data sets. But there’s a difference between "playing" with big data versus solving real problems. The reality is that Hadoop alone might not be enough. Experience IBM’s enterprise-class Hadoop product, InfoSphere BigInsights, which enhances open source Hadoop with required enterprise capabilities including: analytics, visualization, security, standard SQL, enterprise HBase, developer/admin tools, Big Data Exploration and more. The morning session will include interactive Big Data use case discussions, an overview of what is big data, live demonstrations of key Big Data and Analytic components.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=B27SpLOOhWw


In the afternoon, get hands-on with Big Data using InfoSphere BigInsights Quick Start Edition, with guidance from development experts. This is a unique opportunity to develop skills and learn about exciting technologies and techniques that you can immediately take back to your organization.


This event is FREE. Breakfast, Lunch and snacks will be provided.

Agenda (subject to change)

column17: Big Data & Analytics Developer Day

column3:
CALLING ALL DEVELOPERS .... JOIN THE BIG DATA FOR SOCIAL GOOD CHALLENGE

Big data exists in just about everything we use and do. It comes from phones, cars, roads, power lines, waterways, food crates, and innumerable other items you’d never think of as computers. This data speaks volumes about our collective behavior and society – so let’s use it to do something incredible! IBM invites developers and data enthusiasts to take a deep dive into real world civic issues using big data and the IBM Bluemix Analytics for Hadoop service. Analyze one of our curated datasets or bring your own (provided it meets these requirements)! Use Hadoop and your data to create a clickable and interactive data visualization to highlight insights that you’ve found.

Ready to get started? $40,000 in prizes will be awarded....

Register here:http://ibmhadoop.challengepost.com/

What to Create: Participants must create a working, clickable, and interactive data visualization utilizing the Analytics for Hadoop service on IBM Bluemix.

Data Requirements: Your data visualization must analyze one or more datasets included in the curated list of datasets on the Data page OR meet the data size, content, and licensing requirements described on the Data page. The total size of the Datasets analyzed must be between 500MB - 7GB in size.

Check out the requirements then go get your IBM Bluemix extended promo code and check out the datasets!

column3:
REGISTRATION WILL CLOSE TODAY.  HAVE YOU REGISTERED FOR THE EVENT?  IN ORDER TO RECEIVE CONFIRMATION AND SOFTWARE DOWNLOAD INSTRUCTIONS, PLEASE REGISTER AT THIS LINK:

http://ibm.co/1ECCgIy

Join us on April 21st for an exciting Big Data & Analytics Developer Day.  Learn about new features and functions for both InfoSphere BigInsights and InfoSphere Streams.  Our keynote will be delivered by Paul Zikopoulos, Vice President, Worldwide Big Data.  Paul will walk through the exciting new features in the recently announced Big Data portfolio.  In the afternoon, you will also be able to get hands-on lab experience with the technology, guided by our technical experts.


To confirm your seat at this event, you must register here: 

http://ibm.co/1ECCgIy

InfoSphere Insights

:  A growing number of organizations today recognize Apache Hadoop as a powerful technology for collecting and economically storing a very large set of highly variable data.  There is a need to quickly find relevant information as well as making it easy for IT to manage and deploy for everyone to use.  With the new release of BigInsights , it provides a broad data science toolset to query, visualize, and explore data and conduct distributed machine learning at scale.


InfoSphere Streams: With smart phones and fully instrumented cars, the amount of data we can collect from moving objects is growing at staggering rates.  With Big Data volume comes Big Data challenges.  The opportunity for applying all of this data in real-time to problems with transportation, congestion management, emergency response, microweather prediction, supply chain management and so on, is tremendous.  With the new features and functions of IBM InfoSphere Streams, clients will be enabled to perform analytics on fast moving data at scale.  InfoSphere Streams helps organizations achieve solid business outcomes, including increased business agility, higher application resiliency and more efficient IT operations, spanning IT administrators and developers.


There will be a collection of hands-on labs offered in the afternoon, based on BigInsights and Streams.  Seating is limited so you must confirm that you want a seat in the lab.  There will be a limited number of machines available with images pre-loaded, however, you may want to bring your own laptop in order to take the technology home with you.  Download instructions will be included in your confirmation email. 


Agenda (subject to change)


9:00 am to 9:30 am - Breakfast, Registration and Introductions


9:30 am to 11:00 am - Welcome and Keynote - Big Data Overview


11:00 am to 12:00 pm  - Adding Value to your Organization - Big Data Use Case

  * BigInsights Quick Start Edition - limited machines will be provided


  * Analytics/Streams - limited machines will be provided


5:00 PM - Close Thank You for Attending

To confirm your seat, please register here:


http://ibm.co/1ECCgIy
<a href="http://ibm.co/1ECCgly"></a>

Be sure to indicate if you plan on attending the hands-on labs in the afternoon.

We look forward to seeing you there.

In order to reserve your spot, register here: https://future-of-analytics-atlanta.eventbrite.com


Information has become one of the world’s most valuable natural resources.  We’re swimming in data, but it can be challenging to capitalize on it. 

Now is the time to harness your data in game-changing ways.  If your company is exploring new approaches to innovate with systems of insight and customer engagement to improve operational decision making and generate new revenue streams, then The Future of Analytics in Action is a must-attend event.

Come hear how a comprehensive set of integrated cloud data services covering content, database, and analytics capabilities is creating new opportunities to transform industries, including financial services, insurance, automotive, healthcare, food services, media and entertainment, and more. 

Attendees will:
- hear real-world client examples of companies leveraging Bluemix, Cloud Data Services, and Watson Analytics to disrupt their industries;
- see demonstrations of how IBM’s cloud-based services deliver a rich developer experience and a fast on-ramp to bring offerings to market in as little as 90 days.
- network with peers to understand how companies are deploying these new technologies in cost-efficient ways to create competitive advantage

column17: The Future of Analytics in Action

column3:
THIS IS A WEB CONFERENCE ONLY.  TIME OF WEB CONFERENCE LOCALLY IS BASED ON LIVE-STREAM START - PACIFIC DAYLIGHT TIME. DETAILS TO CONNECT TO LIVE-STREAM ARE INDICATED BELOW. 

Apache Spark is an open source processing engine built around speed, ease of use, and analytics. If you have large amounts of data that requires low latency processing that a typical Map Reduce program cannot provide, Spark is the alternative.

Spark performs at speeds up to 100 times faster than Map Reduce for iterative algorithms or interactive data mining. Spark provides in-memory cluster computing for lightning fast speed and supports Java, Scala, and Python APIs for ease of development. Spark allows data scientists to build models quickly and supports iterative jobs on distributed datasets. This means more people can apply deep intelligence into applications to make everything smarter, including the Internet of Things (IoT), machine learning, web, mobile, social, business process and more. 

Do you believe in the value of Spark, in the speed, efficiency and flexibility of this in-memory compute engine? IBM does.  Emphatically.That's why we're committed to do everything we can to accelerate the adoption of Spark for enterprise analytics, where Spark promises seemingly unlimited value.

On June 15, 2015, IBM will host a Spark Community event in San Francisco, California: IBM | Spark - The Start of Something Big in Data and Design. There will be a live demo showcase, refreshments, and a Town Hall discussion featuring some of the most trail-blazing data scientists in today's Spark Community, including:

•  Edd Dumbill, VP Strategy, Silicon Valley Data Science
•  Mike Tamir, Chief Science Officer & VP of Data Science & Education at Galvanize
•   Fernando Perez, Staff Scientist at Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory & Founding Investigator of the Berkeley Institute for Data Science
•   Haoyuan Li, CEO and Founder of Tachyon Nexus
•   Shankar Venkataraman, Distinguished Engineer & CTO, IBM Analytics Platform at IBM
•   Paco Nathan, Director, Community Evangelism, Databricks

Spark Community members will also deliver 5-minute lightning talks to describe exciting projects they're working on.

We will provide a livestream presentation of what these Spark leaders have to say.

Live Streaming Link:

To get additional details about Spark you can sign up now for a reminder at:

http://www.ibm.com/analytics/us/en/technology/spark/

Scroll down to "Can't attend in Person"?  Sign up for a reminder and add it to your calendar.

Additional information on Spark:

Link to Spark Fundamentals Course in Big Data University

http://bigdatauniversity.com/bdu-wp/bdu-course/spark-fundamentals/

Link to Spark Technology Information

http://www.ibm.com/analytics/us/en/technology/spark/

Happy Sparking.

column3:
On June 6, 2016, leading minds in data and analytics from Tesla, Netflix, Silicon Valley Data Science, and IBM will come together to demonstrate how open data and analytics technologies such as R, Spark, Python and more are forming a vibrant ecosystem.  The community has a shared goal of working with all data to build unexpected insights and launch new business applications.

The Apache Spark Maker Community Event will bring together data scientists, data engineers, data developers, and data designers June 6th @ 6pm at Galvanize, San Francisco. Here’s the plan:   

- The Big Reveal – New sample Apache Spark apps and tools

- Use Cases – Monsanto will share how they are using R and Spark to optimize their supply chain

- Learning Session - Hear from experts working on Spark projects and building the Spark ecosystem of open data and analytics technologies

- Networking Opportunity – Food, drinks and data, explore a Hall of Innovation showcasing Spark demos

Join us. Learn more here:  Apache Spark Maker Community Event 

Registration begins at 5:30 PM and the discussion starts at 6:30 PM; food and drinks will be served. You must register for this event. 

To get your ticket, and attend in person, click HERE. 

Can't attend in person? We'll be live streaming this event on a computer screen near you! Register for the  live stream and we'll send you a calendar update and login link.
column17: Apache Spark Maker Community Event

column3:
THIS IS A GLOBAL ON-LINE HACKATHON THAT BEGINS MAY 23, 2016 AND NOW ENDS AUGUST 23, 2016.  SUBMISSIONS DUE AUGUST 23rd BY 5:00 PM EST. 

We’re extending the hackathon deadline to August 23 - that’s 20 additional days to build your Spark enterprise app. (View the revised competition calendar HERE.  We're giving you more time because....

We’re adding new enterprise data resources to the site and we want to give you a chance to incorporate these into your projects, if you so choose.  Our awesome data co-sponsors Yelp and Uncharted Software have generously shared some of their enterprise data sets for you to use during the hackathon.

Yelp’s data includes 2.2M reviews by 552K users for 77K businesses. The Uncharted data includes Bitcoin network transactions from processing the Bitcoin blockchain as of mid-2014 and Amazon product reviews from 1995 through 2003. For a fuller description and data access, visit our resources page.

Uncharted Software also has a couple cool Spark data visualization libraries you should check out: Salt and SparkPipe.

And, in case you’d like to weigh the effects of weather on business operations, we’re also offering access to the full suite of Weather Company APIs for the duration of the hackathon.

Finally, if you’re looking for a hosting solution for your Spark app, we’re now offering extended Bluemix trials for all hackathon participants. Using Bluemix services to build your project is totally optional, but might be a good way to get your app up and running — particularly with the IBM Analytics for Apache Spark service.

You can request your extended Bluemix trial code here. 

For all hackathon participants, trials will extend through November 1, 2016.

Now go forth and optimize for the enterprise!

---------------------

Build an Apache Spark application to address a real business problem or core concern related to customer care, marketing, risk management or operations. Join IBM and Devpost for a global hackathon using Apache Spark Makers Build.  There are $100,000 in cash prizes.  Submissions can be sent in up to August 23rd.

Participation Details: To participate in the global virtual hackathon, you can register here.  Please review all registration guidelines.

For the hack, you will apply Apache Spark's powerful analytics capabilities to enterprise and other relevant data so data scientists and software developers can build an analytics or mobile/web app that tackles a key business problem in marketing, customer case, operations or risk management.  The grand prize is $50,000, and the top three winners each get a meeting with the judge or
Spark community expert of their choice; the judging panel includes data experts from Tesla, Netflix, and Silicon Valley Data Science.

Go to apachespark.devpost.com for full details and registration.  Please review all registration rules.

Questions?

We're here to help. If you have any questions about the hackathon, post on the discussion forum or email support@devpost.com and we'll respond as soon as we can.

IBM is offering a free hands-on lab for clients and practitioners on Apache Spark. This is a full day of education on Spark with hands on exercises instructed in person by Spark experts. The course will provide a detail overview of Apache Spark with real world hands on examples of data wrangling and machine learning. The exercises will be done in Jupyter notebooks with publicly available datasets. Participants will use IBM’s fully managed free Cloud platform available for educational purposes.

IN ORDER TO PROVIDE NAMES TO SECURITY AND TO CONFIRM YOUR SEAT, PLEASE REGISTER HERE:        http://bit.ly/2gG9il3


Who should attend:
Anyone interested in learning more about Apache Spark.

Prerequisite:
A working knowledge of Coding (Preferred Python and/or Scala), understand distributed computing, Spark and SQL.

What to expect:
Expect to spend a full day of lecture and hands on exercises attacking real-world data challenges using Apache Spark. In 8 hours you will learn the basic essentials of Apache Spark and why it's important to your organization. This workshop will focus on data wrangling and machine learning.


Full Day Agenda:


8:30am      Breakfast, Registration, Socialize


9:00am      Kickoff, Apache Spark Overview


10:00am     Lab 1, Hello Spark - Hand on exercise


11:00 am     Apache Spark SQL Overview


12:00 pm     Lunch

2:00 pm       Overview of Data Science & Machine Learning w/ Apache Spark


3:00 pm       Lab 3, Machine Learning w/ Spark – Hands on exercises


4:00 pm       Wrap up – Feedback from attendee

Reminder:  Please register HERE to confirm your seat.
column17: Hands-on Intro to Apache Spark for Data Engineers, Data Scientist and Developers

column3:
RSVP: http://bit.ly/2gOcufe

This webinar will cover an overview of Watson Data Platform capabilities and how to empower users across the organization to make the most out of their data. What if you can shorten the time it takes to create value out of your existing organizational data ? 

What if you can provision a common analytic engine with managed services that will enable you to embrace multiple cloud platforms ? IBM Watson Data Platform is the first cloud-based data and analytics platform to support cognitive businesses. It enables access, collaboration and paths to insights by connecting all users through trusted access to a variety of data, discovering new possibilities and opportunities with built-in intelligence, automation and machine learning and accelerating outcomes with rapid deployment of new data models and fast embedding of insights into processes, applications and services. 

Let us show you how Watson Data Platform can be the milestone of your organization analytics strategy and empower your organization into the new Cognitive analytics era.

Speaker Bio:
Gerardo Rodríguez Díaz – is an avid traveler, technologist enthusiast and Big data and Analytics cloud solution specialist focused on communications and computer systems integrations industries across North America. GRD areas of specialization are IT, Marketing and Business Intelligence having worked across European, North and South American markets.
column17: Making Data Simple in the Cognitive Era

column3:
The demand for machine learning is booming! 

Calling all IT executives, data scientists, Chief Data Officers, data architects and other data geeks.  Join us on February 15th from 2:00-5:30 pm ET via livestream  (replay available starting February 16th) , and discover how machine learning is fundamentally changing the way we work and live.  Hear about cognitive applications that anticipate behavior and learn from data without being explicitly programmed.

You'll learn about the latest breakthrough developments on machine learning as well as Spark, data and analytics. Mike Gualtieri, Vice President and Principal Analyst, Forrester, will present his view on how to best leverage technologies such as big data, predictive analytics, Hadoop/Spark, machine learning, data science, and AI.  Rob Thomas, General Manager, IBM Analytics will host an agenda which will include guest speakers and cover the following topics:

•  Machine Learning Overview

•  Top Trends in Machine Learning & Cognitive Applications

•  Cognitive Analytics and Machine Learning for the Enterprise

•  Live Product Demonstration & Client Roundtable on Machine Learning

•  Data Innovation with Hybrid Transaction/Analytical Processing

•  Spark & Machine Learning for Enterprise Systems

For additional details and to REGISTER, please visit MACHINE LEARNING.

Register NOW and we'll send you a reminder!

Using Bluemix services to build your project is totally optional, but might be a good way to get your app up and running — particularly with the IBM Analytics for Apache Spark service.

You can request your extended Bluemix trial code here.  For all hackathon participants, trials will extend through November 1, 2016. Now go forth and optimize for the enterprise!

---------------------

Spark community expert of their choice; the judging panel includes data experts from Tesla, Netflix, and Silicon Valley Data Science.

This webinar will cover an overview of Watson Data Platform capabilities and how to empower users across the organization to make the most out of their data. What if you can shorten the time it takes to create value out of your existing organizational data ? 

What if you can provision a common analytic engine with managed services that will enable you to embrace multiple cloud platforms ? IBM Watson Data Platform is the first cloud-based data and analytics platform to support cognitive businesses. It enables access, collaboration and paths to insights by connecting all users through trusted access to a variety of data, discovering new possibilities and opportunities with built-in intelligence, automation and machine learning and accelerating outcomes with rapid deployment of new data models and fast embedding of insights into processes, applications and services. 

Let us show you how Watson Data Platform can be the milestone of your organization analytics strategy and empower your organization into the new Cognitive analytics era.
