Join us and participate in an exclusive Big Data Developer Day hosted by the IBM Big Data team.   Open source Apache Hadoop is a great framework for distributed processing of large data sets. But there’s a difference between "playing" with big data versus solving real problems. The reality is that Hadoop alone might not be enough. Experience IBM’s enterprise-class Hadoop product, InfoSphere BigInsights, which enhances open source Hadoop with required enterprise capabilities including: analytics, visualization, security, standard SQL, enterprise HBase, developer/admin tools, learn about the role of Big Data in Motion, Big Data Exploration and more. The morning session will include interactive Big Data use case discussions, an overview of what is big data, live demonstrations of key Big Data components (Big Data at Rest, Big Data in Motion).

CALLING ALL DEVELOPERS .... JOIN THE BIG DATA FOR SOCIAL GOOD CHALLENGE

Big data exists in just about everything we use and do. It comes from phones, cars, roads, power lines, waterways, food crates, and innumerable other items you’d never think of as computers. This data speaks volumes about our collective behavior and society – so let’s use it to do something incredible! IBM invites developers and data enthusiasts to take a deep dive into real world civic issues using big data and the IBM Bluemix Analytics for Hadoop service. Analyze one of our curated datasets or bring your own (provided it meets these requirements)! Use Hadoop and your data to create a clickable and interactive data visualization to highlight insights that you’ve found.

Ready to get started? $40,000 in prizes will be awarded....

Register here:http://ibmhadoop.challengepost.com/

What to Create: Participants must create a working, clickable, and interactive data visualization utilizing the Analytics for Hadoop service on IBM Bluemix.

Data Requirements: Your data visualization must analyze one or more datasets included in the curated list of datasets on the Data page OR meet the data size, content, and licensing requirements described on the Data page. The total size of the Datasets analyzed must be between 500MB - 7GB in size.

Check out the requirements then go get your IBM Bluemix extended promo code and check out the datasets!

THIS IS A WEB CONFERENCE ONLY.  TIME OF WEB CONFERENCE LOCALLY IS BASED ON LIVE-STREAM START - PACIFIC DAYLIGHT TIME. DETAILS TO CONNECT TO LIVE-STREAM ARE INDICATED BELOW. 

Apache Spark is an open source processing engine built around speed, ease of use, and analytics. If you have large amounts of data that requires low latency processing that a typical Map Reduce program cannot provide, Spark is the alternative.

Spark performs at speeds up to 100 times faster than Map Reduce for iterative algorithms or interactive data mining. Spark provides in-memory cluster computing for lightning fast speed and supports Java, Scala, and Python APIs for ease of development. Spark allows data scientists to build models quickly and supports iterative jobs on distributed datasets. This means more people can apply deep intelligence into applications to make everything smarter, including the Internet of Things (IoT), machine learning, web, mobile, social, business process and more. 

Do you believe in the value of Spark, in the speed, efficiency and flexibility of this in-memory compute engine? IBM does.  Emphatically.That's why we're committed to do everything we can to accelerate the adoption of Spark for enterprise analytics, where Spark promises seemingly unlimited value.

On June 15, 2015, IBM will host a Spark Community event in San Francisco, California: IBM | Spark - The Start of Something Big in Data and Design. There will be a live demo showcase, refreshments, and a Town Hall discussion featuring some of the most trail-blazing data scientists in today's Spark Community, including:

•  Edd Dumbill, VP Strategy, Silicon Valley Data Science
•  Mike Tamir, Chief Science Officer & VP of Data Science & Education at Galvanize
•   Fernando Perez, Staff Scientist at Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory & Founding Investigator of the Berkeley Institute for Data Science
•   Haoyuan Li, CEO and Founder of Tachyon Nexus
•   Shankar Venkataraman, Distinguished Engineer & CTO, IBM Analytics Platform at IBM
•   Paco Nathan, Director, Community Evangelism, Databricks

Spark Community members will also deliver 5-minute lightning talks to describe exciting projects they're working on.

We will provide a livestream presentation of what these Spark leaders have to say.

Live Streaming Link:

To get additional details about Spark you can sign up now for a reminder at:

http://www.ibm.com/analytics/us/en/technology/spark/

Scroll down to "Can't attend in Person"?  Sign up for a reminder and add it to your calendar.

http://bigdatauniversity.com/bdu-wp/bdu-course/spark-fundamentals/

http://www.ibm.com/analytics/us/en/technology/spark/

Happy Sparking.

You may want to attend this meetup in Glendale.  Please see above for place and time.  Additional information can be found at: http://www.meetup.com/LA-Open-Data/events/223365549/

Join us to discuss recent Spark development trends, and go over some use cases of using Spark for analytics and machine learning.On June 15–17, I attended the 2015 Spark Summit and was excited to observe some new developments. The Spark Summit in last year had only about 500 attendees, for this year, the summit had more than 2000 attendees with many good use cases presented. More info about this summit is available at https://spark-summit.org/2015/ .

The Chief Information Officer from the Central Intelligence Agency, Doug Wolfe, also spoke at the Spark summit, about open data and about adopting big data technologies in government. It seems Spark could be very useful to process all the open data available, and I was told some venture capital funds have been created specially for the open data and public sector analytics, with the $100 Million SineWave Venture Fund as one example.

And as announced at the Spark summit, IBM made a huge commitment to Spark, with a Spark Technology Center to be established in San Francisco that IBM will put thousands of data scientists and researchers into Spark development and has already made the IBM machine learning package, SystemML, open source to be integrated into Spark. For more, you may visit  http://www.ibm.com/analytics/us/en/technology/spark/.

So, let us meet on July 8th evening to discuss:

1) Spark development trends

2) Spark analytics use cases

3) Spark and open data

4) Spark and machine learning tools

As before, Starbucks coffee and cookies will be provided. The meeting will start at 7pm sharp, and we will have Q&A sessions and networking time following the talk / presentation.

Parking along the Brand Blvd costs about $1 per hour, and you may find free parking in nearby small streets.

THIS IS A GLOBAL ON-LINE HACKATHON THAT BEGINS MAY 23, 2016 AND NOW ENDS AUGUST 23, 2016.  SUBMISSIONS DUE AUGUST 23rd BY 5:00 PM EST. 

We’re extending the hackathon deadline to August 23 - that’s 20 additional days to build your Spark enterprise app. (View the revised competition calendar HERE.  We're giving you more time because....

We’re adding new enterprise data resources to the site and we want to give you a chance to incorporate these into your projects, if you so choose.  Our awesome data co-sponsors Yelp and Uncharted Software have generously shared some of their enterprise data sets for you to use during the hackathon.

Yelp’s data includes 2.2M reviews by 552K users for 77K businesses. The Uncharted data includes Bitcoin network transactions from processing the Bitcoin blockchain as of mid-2014 and Amazon product reviews from 1995 through 2003. For a fuller description and data access, visit our resources page.

Uncharted Software also has a couple cool Spark data visualization libraries you should check out: Salt and SparkPipe.

And, in case you’d like to weigh the effects of weather on business operations, we’re also offering access to the full suite of Weather Company APIs for the duration of the hackathon.

Finally, if you’re looking for a hosting solution for your Spark app, we’re now offering extended Bluemix trials for all hackathon participants. Using Bluemix services to build your project is totally optional, but might be a good way to get your app up and running — particularly with the IBM Analytics for Apache Spark service.

You can request your extended Bluemix trial code here. For all hackathon participants, trials will extend through November 1, 2016.

Now go forth and optimize for the enterprise!

This webinar will cover an overview of Watson Data Platform capabilities and how to empower users across the organization to make the most out of their data. What if you can shorten the time it takes to create value out of your existing organizational data ? 

What if you can provision a common analytic engine with managed services that will enable you to embrace multiple cloud platforms ? IBM Watson Data Platform is the first cloud-based data and analytics platform to support cognitive businesses. It enables access, collaboration and paths to insights by connecting all users through trusted access to a variety of data, discovering new possibilities and opportunities with built-in intelligence, automation and machine learning and accelerating outcomes with rapid deployment of new data models and fast embedding of insights into processes, applications and services. 

Let us show you how Watson Data Platform can be the milestone of your organization analytics strategy and empower your organization into the new Cognitive analytics era.

Speaker Bio:
Gerardo Rodríguez Díaz – is an avid traveler, technologist enthusiast and Big data and Analytics cloud solution specialist focused on communications and computer systems integrations industries across North America. GRD areas of specialization are IT, Marketing and Business Intelligence having worked across European, North and South American markets.

The demand for machine learning is booming! 

Calling all IT executives, data scientists, Chief Data Officers, data architects and other data geeks.  Join us on February 15th from 2:00-5:30 pm ET via livestream  (replay available starting February 16th) , and discover how machine learning is fundamentally changing the way we work and live.  Hear about cognitive applications that anticipate behavior and learn from data without being explicitly programmed.

You'll learn about the latest breakthrough developments on machine learning as well as Spark, data and analytics. Mike Gualtieri, Vice President and Principal Analyst, Forrester, will present his view on how to best leverage technologies such as big data, predictive analytics, Hadoop/Spark, machine learning, data science, and AI.  Rob Thomas, General Manager, IBM Analytics will host an agenda which will include guest speakers and cover the following topics:

•  Machine Learning Overview

•  Top Trends in Machine Learning & Cognitive Applications

•  Cognitive Analytics and Machine Learning for the Enterprise

•  Live Product Demonstration & Client Roundtable on Machine Learning

•  Data Innovation with Hybrid Transaction/Analytical Processing

•  Spark & Machine Learning for Enterprise Systems

For additional details and to REGISTER, please visit MACHINE LEARNING.

Register NOW and we'll send you a reminder!

Join us for our FIRST Big Data Developer event in Calgary! Lunch will be served at the Welcome Reception to kick off the event!


Open source Apache Hadoop is a great framework for distributed processing of large data sets. At this event, you'll learn Hadoop fundamentals and how IBM makes open souce Hadoop enterprise ready while making it easier to get real work done! 

There is no charge for this event, but RSVP is required (space is limited). This session is limited to 35 seats. Drinks and Snacks will be served!

If you can, bring your laptops! We'll be passing out virtual machine images to get you start with your own sandbox. 

Agenda (subject to change):

• Welcome Reception & Lunch, food & drinks will be served (60 mins)
• "Big Data" Perspectives (30 mins)
• Introduction to Hadoop and BigInsights (75 mins)
• Introduction to R on Hadoop (Big R) (15 mins)
• Data Warehouse Modernization in a Big Data World (60 mins)
• Optional: Getting started with your own hadoop sandbox environment

Please RSVP now to confirm your seat.

CALLING ALL DEVELOPERS .... JOIN THE BIG DATA FOR SOCIAL GOOD CHALLENGE

Big data exists in just about everything we use and do. It comes from phones, cars, roads, power lines, waterways, food crates, and innumerable other items you’d never think of as computers. This data speaks volumes about our collective behavior and society – so let’s use it to do something incredible! IBM invites developers and data enthusiasts to take a deep dive into real world civic issues using big data and the IBM Bluemix Analytics for Hadoop service. Analyze one of our curated datasets or bring your own (provided it meets these requirements)! Use Hadoop and your data to create a clickable and interactive data visualization to highlight insights that you’ve found.

Ready to get started? $40,000 in prizes will be awarded....

Register here:http://ibmhadoop.challengepost.com/

What to Create: Participants must create a working, clickable, and interactive data visualization utilizing the Analytics for Hadoop service on IBM Bluemix.

Data Requirements: Your data visualization must analyze one or more datasets included in the curated list of datasets on the Data page OR meet the data size, content, and licensing requirements described on the Data page. The total size of the Datasets analyzed must be between 500MB - 7GB in size.

Check out the requirements then go get your IBM Bluemix extended promo code and check out the datasets!

column3:
THIS IS A WEB CONFERENCE ONLY.  TIME OF WEB CONFERENCE LOCALLY IS BASED ON LIVE-STREAM START - PACIFIC DAYLIGHT TIME. DETAILS TO CONNECT TO LIVE-STREAM ARE INDICATED BELOW. 

Apache Spark is an open source processing engine built around speed, ease of use, and analytics. If you have large amounts of data that requires low latency processing that a typical Map Reduce program cannot provide, Spark is the alternative.

Spark performs at speeds up to 100 times faster than Map Reduce for iterative algorithms or interactive data mining. Spark provides in-memory cluster computing for lightning fast speed and supports Java, Scala, and Python APIs for ease of development. Spark allows data scientists to build models quickly and supports iterative jobs on distributed datasets. This means more people can apply deep intelligence into applications to make everything smarter, including the Internet of Things (IoT), machine learning, web, mobile, social, business process and more. 

Do you believe in the value of Spark, in the speed, efficiency and flexibility of this in-memory compute engine? IBM does.  Emphatically.That's why we're committed to do everything we can to accelerate the adoption of Spark for enterprise analytics, where Spark promises seemingly unlimited value.

On June 15, 2015, IBM will host a Spark Community event in San Francisco, California: IBM | Spark - The Start of Something Big in Data and Design. There will be a live demo showcase, refreshments, and a Town Hall discussion featuring some of the most trail-blazing data scientists in today's Spark Community, including:
  Edd Dumbill, VP Strategy, Silicon Valley Data Science
•  Mike Tamir, Chief Science Officer & VP of Data Science & Education at Galvanize
•   Fernando Perez, Staff Scientist at Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory & Founding Investigator of the Berkeley Institute for Data Science
•   Haoyuan Li, CEO and Founder of Tachyon Nexus
•   Shankar Venkataraman, Distinguished Engineer & CTO, IBM Analytics Platform at IBM
•   Paco Nathan, Director, Community Evangelism, Databricks

Spark Community members will also deliver 5-minute lightning talks to describe exciting projects they're working on.

We will provide a livestream presentation of what these Spark leaders have to say.

Live Streaming Link:

To get additional details about Spark you can sign up now for a reminder at:

http://www.ibm.com/analytics/us/en/technology/spark/

Scroll down to "Can't attend in Person"?  Sign up for a reminder and add it to your calendar.

Additional information on Spark:

Link to Spark Fundamentals Course in Big Data University

http://bigdatauniversity.com/bdu-wp/bdu-course/spark-fundamentals/

Link to Spark Technology Information

http://www.ibm.com/analytics/us/en/technology/spark/

Happy Sparking.

A Lot has changed since our last meetup - with the Open Data Platform, IBM's big investments in Spark, and open-source announcement of System ML (from IBM Research)

Let's re-connect.

Each time we do a meetup, we start with this Big Data and Hadoop Introductory session because we're getting new people all the time and we want a "standard way" to get them up to speed. This will be a 1 hour session and content will be similar each time.

If you're just getting started with Big Data, this session is for you.

column3: This is the second topic of the evening - the second topic is usually a deeper dive. You may have wondered about all the Hives and Pigs in Hadoop. In this session, we'll introduce Hive and other topics like serdes, partitioning, storage format, and other things related to SQL on Hadoop.

column3:
Session 1: 6:15-7:15pm

Each time we do a meetup, we start with this Big Data and Hadoop Introductory session because we're getting new people all the time and we want a "standard way" to get them up to speed. 

This will be a 1 hour session and content will be the same every time. 

Immediately following these intro sessions, we'll dive deeper into a topic related to Big Data and Hadoop.

If you're just getting started with Big Data, this session is for you.

Session 2: 7:15-8:30

The widespread adoption of Hadoop has created an ecosystem of supportive software to help query, move and analyze data. First, we'll take a closer look at Apache Spark - one of the most exciting and fastest growing open source projects in big data. Afterward, we'll tackle the common challenge of querying data on Hadoop by comparing the latest and greatest SQL technologies. Each has a sweet spot and we'll try to do a broad coverage of the leading technologies.
column17: Apache Hadoop & Spark - Just the basics

column3:
9:00 AM – Noon (tutorials start at 9:30am sharp -- arrive early to sign up for the your preferred available tutorial)

Each tutorial has limited seating -- you'll get to choose from these sessions -- space permitting.

• Big Data At Rest - Prepare students to handle large volumes of data at rest using IBM InfoSphere BigInsights to manage the information produced with NoSQL options, including Hadoop with enterprise-grade features including visualization & exploration, advanced analytics, and security & administration. Learn more about IBM InfoSphere BigInsights


• Speed of Thought Analytics - Come learn how the new IBM DB2 with BLU Acceleration speeds analytics and reporting by orders of magnitude using dynamic in-memory columnar technologies. Learn more about IBM DB2 with BLU Acceleration


• Business Intelligence - Prepare your marketing and business students with skills to help an enterprise turn information into insight and make better business decisions. This session will introduce the personal analytics solution, IBM Cognos Insight, to develop visualizations and perform scenario modeling. Learn more about IBM Cognos Insight


• Predictive Analytics - Teach students to discover hidden relationships in structured data stored in databases, mainframe data systems, or flat files - and predict the outcome of future events and interactions using IBM SPSS Modeler. Learn more about IBM SPSS Modeler

column3:
THIS IS A WEB CONFERENCE ONLY - TIME INDICATED IS LOCAL START TIME. SEE BELOW FOR DETAILS.

IBM InfoSphere Streams V3.2 (referred to as Streams) delivers a highly scalable, agile software infrastructure to perform in-motion analytics on a wide variety of relational and non-relational data types that enter the enterprise at unprecedented volumes and speed, and from thousands of real-time sources. Streams V3.2 includes new features and functions designed to instantly analyze and fuse massive volumes of data and integrates with existing infrastructures. It delivers new capabilities to improve usability, support enterprise readiness, and streamline enterprise integration.

WHAT:

The following new features and functions, which will be covered during the Streams Developer Conference:

Usability:
• Remote Development with Streams Studio for Windows and Linux
• User Defined Parallelism
• Java Streams development simplification

Enterprise readiness:
• Operational Decision Management adapter for business rules
• Access to application data using Representational State Transfer (REST)

Enterprise integration:
• MQTT adapters
• Hadoop Big SQL support
• HP Vertica Analytic Database support

Who should attend:

The event assumes you are familiar with Streams. If you are not, please either try the Big Data University Streams course or review some of the Streams videos on YouTube.

WHEN:

Webcast on Thursday November 14, 2013 from 10:00AM to 6:00PM U.S. Eastern Standard Time.

WHERE:

The webcast will be recorded and posted to Big Data University (BDU) at the following Big Data University course ID.

NOTE: There will be no physical location for this meetup and it will all be online.

To get more info, download presentations, get detailed agenda and to register for the event check out the BDU Streams Developers Virtual Conference landing page.

The detailed agenda will be posted at the BDU class/event page after Oct 31.

Please join us on the live LotusLive meeting webcast. The conference ID is 2058889. Audio in listen only mode will be available on the webcast.

To ask questions during Q&A periods, please use the following conference information:

USA Toll-Free: 1-888-426-6840

USA Caller Paid: 1-215-861-6239

For Other Countries call in numbers use this link.

Participant Code: 7821035

We look forward to sharing details about these new capabilities.

dev@Pulse is a FREE two day festival of coding, camaraderie, demos, food, music, and awards.   dev@Pulse is a first-of-its-kind event with a curated group of developers, startups, open source experts, and industry leaders .   

The agenda will explore how the best and brightest minds are shredding the world of mobile, game design, AI, open tech, front-end development, analytics, Cloud and more.   Don't miss out on lighting talks with renowned dev space gurus, hands-on labs with cutting-edge wearables (like Oculus Rift) and Rasberry Pi, code jams, and live DJ's to keep.the.coding.going.  

You can find the full agenda here:

http://ibm.com/software/tivoli/pulse/devatpulse/agenda.html

You can register for the event here:

https://www-950.ibm.com/events/wwe/Pulse/Pulse2014reg.nsf/devreg


Registration to this event also includes access to General Sessions (including day 3 with Breaking Bad's Vince Gilligan and Anna Gunn!) and to Pulse Palooza, featuring Elvis Costello and Fall Out Boy.

Hands on Lab

Come to the Ling Ling Lounge on Level 3 and get hands on experience with the latest exciting tools and technologies from IBM. Experts in these technologies will be serving as mentors to guide you through the Labs and answer your questions. 

Please see the list below for what you can expect at dev@Pulse, along with pre-requisite steps to prepare. Check back regularly for updates as more Labs will be added to this schedule. 

Preparing for the Labs 
• Please bring your own laptops or tablets to participate in the Hands on Labs. These will not be provided at the show. 
• For the Internet of Things Lab a limited number of Raspberry PIs will be available.
• For Labs involving BlueMix please register now for your BlueMix ID here before the event to allow for processing: http://ng.bluemix.net

We've also slated the founders of Kickstarter, Girls Who Code, and OpenStack to discuss advances that are transforming life, business and the global economy.

Spaces are filling quickly in these last two weeks. So reach out to your clients today and invite them to dev@Pulse. Do not let your developers miss the chance to witness amazing brainpower at dev@Pulse!

We hope to see you at this exciting event!

3rd Floor Room: Sienna C  


PLEASE NOTE TO CHANGE IN TIME FOR THIS SESSION


R is a popular programming language and environment for data science. This Meetup introduces Big R, the end-to-end integration of R into Hadoop using  IBM BigInsights (aka IBM's hadoop distribution). Big R allows R users to seamlessly access and manipulate data in HDFS using R's familiar programming syntax and paradigm. In this Meetup, you'll learn how to perform tasks such as data exploration, transformation, statistical analysis, modeling, and visualization at scale without resorting to map/reduce constructs or unfamiliar scripting languages. For machine learning tasks such as regression, classification, or clustering over extremely large data sets, this Meetup will also demonstrate an upcoming technology in Big R to run scalable machine learning algorithms.   We will also show a demo of connecting and running R jobs on Hadoop and provide you pointers on how to get started.
column10: Big Data Developers in Las Vegas
column17: Data Science using Big R for in-Hadoop Analytics

column3:
3rd Floor Room: Sienna C


Big SQL opened Hadoop data to SQL access, relational database optimizations and runtime performance. The next version of Big SQL represents a quantum leap in SQL support and performance, by applying decades of IBM research in optimization and query runtime technology toward the efficient execution of SQL on Hadoop. 

In this presentation, you learn about the architecture of this next generation Big SQL offering and key performance aspects. You also learn how it enables traditional warehouse style applications to run on Hadoop data and clusters.

How fast is your SQL on Hadoop?  Check out this paper on SQL on Hadoop Benchmarking

Get started with the fasted SQL on Hadoop.

column17: Big SQL 3.0: SQL on Hadoop without Compromise

Room: Sienna C

PLEASE NOTE THE CHANGE IN TIME FOR THIS SESSION


Hadoop and Cloud is an almost perfect marriage. Hadoop is a distributed computing framework that leverages a cluster built on commodity hardware. The Cloud simplifies provisioning of machines and software. Getting started with Hadoop on the Cloud makes it simple to provision your environment quickly and actually get started using Hadoop. IBM Bluemix has democratized Hadoop for the masses! 

This session will provide a brief introduction to what Hadoop is, how does cloud work and will then focus on how to get started.

Want to get started now?  Try these tutorials:

Analytics for Hadoop Service

HDFS IoT Recipe

Not familiar with Hadoop, check out this getting started Hadoop videos.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RQr0qd8gxW8

Learn more about Bluemix https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OD1NP-Yk2BI

Join Cloudant for a casual drinkup!  Chat data, play with the Oculus Rift and the Muse, demo Cloudant's DBaaS, geek out with our experts, have a beer on us, and pick up a t-shirt.  (Fair warning: Due to venue policy, this event is 21+.  Apologies to you younger devs!)

__________________________________________

Our pals at Cloudant are managing (free!) registrations over at https://devafterdark.eventbrite.com.  There's a cap on attendance, so please be sure to RSVP there to get your ticket.  

__________________________________________

5:30pm: Grab a drink, mingle, and play

6:00pm: Game Show Challenge
Join our own Derek Schoettle to test your wits in a data dev trivia challenge.  Over course of the game, you'll see stats from our latest survey on adoption of NoSQL and open source technology.  

6:45pm: Geek Out & Play
Get hands-on with the latest applications of Cloudant's DBaaS or just pull up a bean bag and chat with your fellow data devs.  Grab a beer and a snack while you: 

Play

• Take the Iron Man Challenge on the Oculus Rift

• Race cars with your brainwaves using the Muse headband

• Demo a wearable sensor app 

• Shoot some pool or play giant chess

Geek Out

• Take a hands-on mini-lab (laptops provided) and get started with your own Cloudant DBaaS account

• Chat with an expert about your latest challenges in IoT, geospatial, APIs, queries, and more

• See Cloudant Query in action

• Demo our latest offering, Cloudant Local, which runs on-premises to complement Cloudant DBaaS on mobile devices, in Web browsers, and across the cloud

• Seal a deal with a Cloudant sales rep

8:00pm: Depart with t-shirt in hand!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=khDaXdjJmpg

Attending IBM Insight?  Cloudant's Dev After Dark gathering is open to everyone (21+), but if you happen to be registered for the Insight conference, there's tons more developer-focused content for you in the same space throughout the week. Check out all the awesome programming!

CALLING ALL DEVELOPERS .... JOIN THE BIG DATA FOR SOCIAL GOOD CHALLENGE

Big data exists in just about everything we use and do. It comes from phones, cars, roads, power lines, waterways, food crates, and innumerable other items you’d never think of as computers. This data speaks volumes about our collective behavior and society – so let’s use it to do something incredible! IBM invites developers and data enthusiasts to take a deep dive into real world civic issues using big data and the IBM Bluemix Analytics for Hadoop service. Analyze one of our curated datasets or bring your own (provided it meets these requirements)! Use Hadoop and your data to create a clickable and interactive data visualization to highlight insights that you’ve found.

Ready to get started? $40,000 in prizes will be awarded....

Register here:http://ibmhadoop.challengepost.com/

What to Create: Participants must create a working, clickable, and interactive data visualization utilizing the Analytics for Hadoop service on IBM Bluemix.

Data Requirements: Your data visualization must analyze one or more datasets included in the curated list of datasets on the Data page OR meet the data size, content, and licensing requirements described on the Data page. The total size of the Datasets analyzed must be between 500MB - 7GB in size.

Check out the requirements then go get your IBM Bluemix extended promo code and check out the datasets!

THIS IS A WEB CONFERENCE ONLY.  TIME OF WEB CONFERENCE LOCALLY IS BASED ON LIVE-STREAM START - PACIFIC DAYLIGHT TIME. DETAILS TO CONNECT TO LIVE-STREAM ARE INDICATED BELOW. 

Apache Spark is an open source processing engine built around speed, ease of use, and analytics. If you have large amounts of data that requires low latency processing that a typical Map Reduce program cannot provide, Spark is the alternative.

Spark performs at speeds up to 100 times faster than Map Reduce for iterative algorithms or interactive data mining. Spark provides in-memory cluster computing for lightning fast speed and supports Java, Scala, and Python APIs for ease of development. Spark allows data scientists to build models quickly and supports iterative jobs on distributed datasets. This means more people can apply deep intelligence into applications to make everything smarter, including the Internet of Things (IoT), machine learning, web, mobile, social, business process and more. 

Do you believe in the value of Spark, in the speed, efficiency and flexibility of this in-memory compute engine? IBM does.  Emphatically.That's why we're committed to do everything we can to accelerate the adoption of Spark for enterprise analytics, where Spark promises seemingly unlimited value.

On June 15, 2015, IBM will host a Spark Community event in San Francisco, California: IBM | Spark - The Start of Something Big in Data and Design. There will be a live demo showcase, refreshments, and a Town Hall discussion featuring some of the most trail-blazing data scientists in today's Spark Community, including:
  Edd Dumbill, VP Strategy, Silicon Valley Data Science
•  Mike Tamir, Chief Science Officer & VP of Data Science & Education at Galvanize
•   Fernando Perez, Staff Scientist at Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory & Founding Investigator of the Berkeley Institute for Data Science
•   Haoyuan Li, CEO and Founder of Tachyon Nexus
•   Shankar Venkataraman, Distinguished Engineer & CTO, IBM Analytics Platform at IBM
•   Paco Nathan, Director, Community Evangelism, Databricks

Spark Community members will also deliver 5-minute lightning talks to describe exciting projects they're working on.

We will provide a livestream presentation of what these Spark leaders have to say.

Live Streaming Link:

To get additional details about Spark you can sign up now for a reminder at:

http://www.ibm.com/analytics/us/en/technology/spark/

Scroll down to "Can't attend in Person"?  Sign up for a reminder and add it to your calendar.

http://bigdatauniversity.com/bdu-wp/bdu-course/spark-fundamentals/

Link to Spark Technology Information

http://www.ibm.com/analytics/us/en/technology/spark/

Happy Sparking.

THIS IS A GLOBAL ON-LINE HACKATHON THAT BEGINS MAY 23, 2016 AND NOW ENDS AUGUST 23, 2016.  SUBMISSIONS DUE AUGUST 23rd BY 5:00 PM EST. 

We’re extending the hackathon deadline to August 23 - that’s 20 additional days to build your Spark enterprise app. (View the revised competition calendar HERE.  We're giving you more time because....

We’re adding new enterprise data resources to the site and we want to give you a chance to incorporate these into your projects, if you so choose.  Our awesome data co-sponsors Yelp and Uncharted Software have generously shared some of their enterprise data sets for you to use during the hackathon.

Yelp’s data includes 2.2M reviews by 552K users for 77K businesses. The Uncharted data includes Bitcoin network transactions from processing the Bitcoin blockchain as of mid-2014 and Amazon product reviews from 1995 through 2003. For a fuller description and data access, visit our resources page.

Uncharted Software also has a couple cool Spark data visualization libraries you should check out: Salt and SparkPipe.

And, in case you’d like to weigh the effects of weather on business operations, we’re also offering access to the full suite of Weather Company APIs for the duration of the hackathon.

Finally, if you’re looking for a hosting solution for your Spark app, we’re now offering extended Bluemix trials for all hackathon participants. Using Bluemix services to build your project is totally optional, but might be a good way to get your app up and running — particularly with the IBM Analytics for Apache Spark service.

You can request your extended Bluemix trial code here.  For all hackathon participants, trials will extend through November 1, 2016. Now go forth and optimize for the enterprise!

---------------------

Build an Apache Spark application to address a real business problem or core concern related to customer care, marketing, risk management or operations. Join IBM and Devpost for a global hackathon using Apache Spark Makers Build.  There are $100,000 in cash prizes.  Submissions can be sent in up to August 23rd.

Participation Details: To participate in the global virtual hackathon, you can register here.  Please review all registration guidelines.

For the hack, you will apply Apache Spark's powerful analytics capabilities to enterprise and other relevant data so data scientists and software developers can build an analytics or mobile/web app that tackles a key business problem in marketing, customer case, operations or risk management.  The grand prize is $50,000, and the top three winners each get a meeting with the judge or
Spark community expert of their choice; the judging panel includes data experts from Tesla, Netflix, and Silicon Valley Data Science.

Go to apachespark.devpost.com for full details and registration.  Please review all registration rules.

Questions?

We're here to help. If you have any questions about the hackathon, post on the discussion forum or email support@devpost.com and we'll respond as soon as we can.

This webinar will cover an overview of Watson Data Platform capabilities and how to empower users across the organization to make the most out of their data. What if you can shorten the time it takes to create value out of your existing organizational data ? 

What if you can provision a common analytic engine with managed services that will enable you to embrace multiple cloud platforms ? IBM Watson Data Platform is the first cloud-based data and analytics platform to support cognitive businesses. It enables access, collaboration and paths to insights by connecting all users through trusted access to a variety of data, discovering new possibilities and opportunities with built-in intelligence, automation and machine learning and accelerating outcomes with rapid deployment of new data models and fast embedding of insights into processes, applications and services. 

Let us show you how Watson Data Platform can be the milestone of your organization analytics strategy and empower your organization into the new Cognitive analytics era.

Speaker Bio:
Gerardo Rodríguez Díaz – is an avid traveler, technologist enthusiast and Big data and Analytics cloud solution specialist focused on communications and computer systems integrations industries across North America. GRD areas of specialization are IT, Marketing and Business Intelligence having worked across European, North and South American markets.

column3:
Todays topic: On the Cognitive Computing Transformation, how DeepLearning and Artificial Intelligence transform IoT

Location: RedFlint 300 S 4th Street Suite 180 Las Vegas, Nevada 89101

How DeepLearning LSTM based Anomaly Detectors outperform all state-of-the-art anomaly detection algorithms - a working example (Romeo)

DeepLearning frameworks are popping up at very high frequency but only a few of them are suitable to run on clusters, use GPUs and supporting topologies beyond Feed-Forward at the same time. Learn which frameworks are capable of doing this on ApacheSpark. In this talk we will introduce an example to create an anomaly detector for IoT sensor data with a LSTM auto encoder neural network.

Bio: Romeo Kienzler works as Chief Data Scientist in the IBM Watson IoT World Wide team helping clients to apply advanced machine learning at scale on their IoT sensor data. His current research focus is on scalable machine learning on Apache Spark. He is contributor to various open source projects and works as associate professor for data mining at a swiss university. Romeo Kienzler is a member of the IBM Technical Expert Council and the IBM Academy of Technology - IBM’s leading brain trusts.

column3:
In our inaugural meetup, we'll learn about a brand new project started out of Twitter that has become their de facto standard. We'll provide food, drinks, and record for viewing later if you register for the event we'll email you think link after.

Abstract
Storm has long served as the main platform for real-time analytics at Twitter. However, as the scale of data being processed in real- time at Twitter has increased, along with an increase in the diversity and the number of use cases, many limitations of Storm have become apparent. We need a system that scales better, has better debug-ability, has better performance, and is easier to manage – all while working in a shared cluster infrastructure. We considered various alternatives to meet these needs, and in the end concluded that we needed to build a new real-time stream data processing system. This talk will present the design and implementation of the new system, called Heron. Heron is now the de facto stream data processing engine inside Twitter, and we share our experiences from running Heron in production.

Bio

Karthik is the engineering manager and technical lead for Real Time Analytics at Twitter. He has two decades of experience working in parallel databases, big data infrastructure and networking. He cofounded Locomatix, a company that specializes in real time streaming processing on Hadoop and Cassandra using SQL that was acquired by Twitter. Before Locomatix, he had a brief stint with Greenplum where he worked on parallel query scheduling. Greenplum was eventually acquired by EMC for more than $300M. Prior to Greenplum, Karthik was at Juniper Networks where he designed and delivered platforms, protocols, databases and high availability solutions for network routers that are widely deployed in the Internet. Before joining Juniper at University of Wisconsin, he worked extensively in parallel database systems, query processing, scale out technologies, storage engine and online analytical systems. Several of these research were spun as a company later acquired by Teradata.

He is the author of several publications, patents and one of the best selling book "Network Routing: Algorithms, Protocols and Architectures." He has a Ph.D. in Computer Science from UW Madison with a focus on databases.
column17: Twitter Heron: Stream Processing at Scale

column3:
Join us on Thursday, September 24th, for an exciting talk with Dean Wampler, Ph.D., Architect for Big Data Products & Services, at Typesafe.  After more than a year on the drawing board, Reactive Streams has released V1.0 of their API for several different platforms, including Java.  This work was done in collaboration with engineers from Typesafe, Netflix, Red Hat, Twitter, Pivotal, Oracle, and others to define a standard for passing streams of data in an asynchronous and non-blocking fashion while ensuring that a fast producer does not overwhelm a slow consumer.  This is a common need for Reactive systems when handling large or live data sets while controlling resource consumption.  

Dean will take us through the mechanisms employed by Reactive Streams, discuss the applicability to a variety of problems encountered in day-to-day work on JVM, and give an overview of the ecosystem that is emerging around this young standard, including the updated Spark Streaming scheduled for release in Spark 1.5.

Dr. Wampler specializes in scalable, distributed, "Big Data" application devellopment using Spark, Mesos, Hadoop, Scala and other tools.  He is a co-organizer and frequent speaker at conferences worldwide, the co-organizer of several Chicago-area Meetup Groups, and a contributor to several open source projects.  He is the author of "Programming Scala, 2nd Edition" and "Functional Programming for Java Developers", as well as the co-author of "Programming Hive".  All of these are from O'Reilly.  Dean can be found on twitter @deanwampler.

THIS IS A GLOBAL ON-LINE HACKATHON THAT BEGINS MAY 23, 2016 AND NOW ENDS AUGUST 23, 2016.  SUBMISSIONS DUE AUGUST 23rd BY 5:00 PM EST. 

We’re extending the hackathon deadline to August 23 - that’s 20 additional days to build your Spark enterprise app. (View the revised competition calendar HERE.  We're giving you more time because....

We’re adding new enterprise data resources to the site and we want to give you a chance to incorporate these into your projects, if you so choose.  Our awesome data co-sponsors Yelp and Uncharted Software have generously shared some of their enterprise data sets for you to use during the hackathon.

Yelp’s data includes 2.2M reviews by 552K users for 77K businesses. The Uncharted data includes Bitcoin network transactions from processing the Bitcoin blockchain as of mid-2014 and Amazon product reviews from 1995 through 2003. For a fuller description and data access, visit our resources page.

Uncharted Software also has a couple cool Spark data visualization libraries you should check out: Salt and SparkPipe.

And, in case you’d like to weigh the effects of weather on business operations, we’re also offering access to the full suite of Weather Company APIs for the duration of the hackathon.

Finally, if you’re looking for a hosting solution for your Spark app, we’re now offering extended Bluemix trials for all hackathon participants. Using Bluemix services to build your project is totally optional, but might be a good way to get your app up and running — particularly with the IBM Analytics for Apache Spark service.

You can request your extended Bluemix trial code here.  For all hackathon participants, trials will extend through November 1, 2016. Now go forth and optimize for the enterprise!

---------------------

Build an Apache Spark application to address a real business problem or core concern related to customer care, marketing, risk management or operations. Join IBM and Devpost for a global hackathon using Apache Spark Makers Build.  There are $100,000 in cash prizes.  Submissions can be sent in up to August 23rd.

Participation Details: To participate in the global virtual hackathon, you can register here.  Please review all registration guidelines.

For the hack, you will apply Apache Spark's powerful analytics capabilities to enterprise and other relevant data so data scientists and software developers can build an analytics or mobile/web app that tackles a key business problem in marketing, customer case, operations or risk management.  The grand prize is $50,000, and the top three winners each get a meeting with the judge or
Spark community expert of their choice; the judging panel includes data experts from Tesla, Netflix, and Silicon Valley Data Science.

Go to apachespark.devpost.com for full details and registration.  Please review all registration rules.

Questions?

We're here to help. If you have any questions about the hackathon, post on the discussion forum or email support@devpost.com and we'll respond as soon as we can.

Streaming analytics and Internet Of Things ( IOT) are gaining momentum in the data and analytics industry. Apache Spark established itself as a leader in fast data processing with its ease of use. With its single execution engine and unified programming model for batch and streaming workloads, it stands out from other distributed stream processing engines. 

Join this webinar to go over basics and internals of the Streaming module of Apache Spark along with code samples. This topic is intended for audiences with some familiarity or working experience with Apache Spark core.​


Webinar is 3:00 pm EST.  Please adjust to your time zone:  http://bit.ly/2iHw6yy


Apache Spark Streaming:​


- Architecture and Execution Model
- Spark Streaming I/O 
- Programing model and Streaming Operations (api)
- Fault tolerance and reliability
- Performance Considerations


Presenter Bio: 

Suresh Matlapudi is an Open Source Analytics Solution Engineer with IBM. He is a hands-on Engineer with deep experience in distributed data processing, Big Data, Data Warehousing and Hybrid Information Architectures. His current work involves supporting sales teams with pre-sales and technical specifications for Open Source Analytics tools, specifically Hadoop/Spark and execution of several outreach programs to support Open Source adoption by Analytics teams. 

Before joining IBM he was involved in building some of the large-scale data processing systems at companies like eHarmony, Deem, American Express, Knights Bridge Solutions.
column13: Adjust time to your time zone
column17: Streaming Data Analytics with Apache Spark Streaming

column3:
Greetings Streamers !! 

Spark is recognized as a great analytics engine. One of its benefits is its inclusion of machine learning algorithms that can group, predict, classify and even recommend based on the analysis of a corpus of data. Once the model is created, it can be applied to new data. In some situations, there is a need to score the model while the data is streaming to decide what to do with the new data.

In this latest Data Science Central Webinar event, you will learn how to process the data to arrive at a model and how the resulting model can be used to score streaming data using IBM Streams.


Register Online Here:  http://bit.ly/2o4YZag

CALLING ALL DEVELOPERS .... JOIN THE BIG DATA FOR SOCIAL GOOD CHALLENGE

Big data exists in just about everything we use and do. It comes from phones, cars, roads, power lines, waterways, food crates, and innumerable other items you’d never think of as computers. This data speaks volumes about our collective behavior and society – so let’s use it to do something incredible! IBM invites developers and data enthusiasts to take a deep dive into real world civic issues using big data and the IBM Bluemix Analytics for Hadoop service. Analyze one of our curated datasets or bring your own (provided it meets these requirements)! Use Hadoop and your data to create a clickable and interactive data visualization to highlight insights that you’ve found.

Ready to get started? $40,000 in prizes will be awarded....

Register here:http://ibmhadoop.challengepost.com/

What to Create: Participants must create a working, clickable, and interactive data visualization utilizing the Analytics for Hadoop service on IBM Bluemix.

Data Requirements: Your data visualization must analyze one or more datasets included in the curated list of datasets on the Data page OR meet the data size, content, and licensing requirements described on the Data page. The total size of the Datasets analyzed must be between 500MB - 7GB in size.

Check out the requirements then go get your IBM Bluemix extended promo code and check out the datasets!
column17: Big Data for Social Good Challenge
column33: Big Data for Social Good Challenge

column3:
In this meetup, I'll be sharing details of my recent experience deploying BigInsights (IBM's distribution of Hadoop) in a recent Customer Engagement.

I'll talk about the use cases and approach we took to bring Hadoop into their corporate environment and culture (hint: much more than just technology enablement). I'll also touch on GPFS - IBM's General Parallel File System which has its heritage from large scale grid computing applications. GPFS can be used as a drop-in alternative to HDFS and we'll talk about the reasons why GPFS was chosen.... and things we learned about that. Maybe do a bit of a demo too...

Beverages and light snacks will be served.
column17: Lessons Learned: Real Deployment of Hadoop (with GPFS)

column3:
This is a new thing we're gonna try. 

Each time we do this meetup, we'll start with this Big Data and Hadoop Introductory session because we're getting new people all the time and we want a "standard way" to get them up to speed. 

This will be a 1 hour session and content will be the same every time.


Immediately following these intro sessions, we'll dive deeper into a topic related to Big Data and Hadoop.

If you're just getting started with Big Data, this session is for you.

Location to be determined, but it will be downtown Vancouver.
column17: Big Data and Hadoop - Just the Basics

column3:
VERY Excited to have Benjamin Leonhardi confirmed for our Deeper Dive session (see Bio below), which immediately follows our "Big Data and Hadoop - Basics" session. 

If you have some Knowledge of Hadoop and want to learn HBASE (which runs on Hadoop) - we created this for you. AND, we're going to get hands on... so bring your laptops.

If you are new to Hadoop, you should attend the 6pm session for a primer as a pre-requisite for and this session.

Location: Almost confirmed - but will be downtown Vancouver. 

Meetup Description:

HBase is a (open source), massively scalable, NoSQL distributed database that runs on HDFS. In this session we will give an introduction to its architecture and the main differences to traditional database systems. HBase was designed to solve traditional database problems like scalability, high-availability, and an easy integration with applications. We will discuss use-cases and give a small overview over competing NoSQL technologies. 

Attendees will get hands-on with software provided to learn how to create and populate tables and how to query them. You will learn the basics of HBase table modelling and get an a quick introduction into the use of BigSQL over HBase. 

Agenda: 

7pm - 8:15 pm: HBase Presentation
- Introduction to HBase
- Use cases
- Architecture
- Competing Technologies
- BigSQL over HBase
- Q&A

8:15 - 9 pm: Hands-on lab


If you want to do the lab, you need to prep:

Please download the BigInsights Quickstart image ( Link InfoSphere BigInsights Quick Start Edition VMware Image on the right side ). You may need 7zip to unpack it and VMWare Player to run it. We will distribute the lab files in the meetup. http://www-01.ibm.com/software/data/infosphere/biginsights/quick-start/

Speaker Bio:

Benjamin Leonhardi is a BigData Specialist for IBM Canada. He is an expert in Hadoop, parallel databases, and streaming solutions. Before that he was the team lead for the BigData/Warehousing partner enablement team. He started out as a Software Developer at the IBM Research And Development Lab in Boeblingen, Germany. There he was a developer in the data mining, text mining, and mining reporting solutions.

column3:
We will be live-streaming in Vancouver.. (Burnaby)..

IBM is hosting a Spark Community event in San Francisco, California: IBM | Spark - The Start of Something Big in Data and Design. There will be a Town Hall discussion featuring some of the most trail-blazing data scientists in today's Spark Community, including:

- Edd Dumbill, VP Strategy, Silicon Valley Data Science
- Mike Tamir, Chief Science Officer & VP of Data Science & Education at Galvanize
- Fernando Perez, Staff Scientist at Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory & Founding Investigator of the Berkeley Institute for Data Science
- Haoyuan Li, CEO and Founder of Tachyon Nexus
- Shankar Venkataraman, Distinguished Engineer & CTO, IBM Analytics Platform at IBM
- Paco Nathan, Director, Community Evangelism, Databricks

Spark Community members will also deliver 5-minute lightning talks to describe exciting projects they're working on.

We will provide a livestream presentation of what these Spark leaders have to say.

Agenda:

6:00 pm - 7:00 pm - Refreshments & Intro to Spark
7:00 pm - 8:15 pm - LiveStream From San Francisco
8:15 pm - Q&A

Don't miss the opportunity to see this major announcement "live". (location is tentative and subject to change)

---------------------------

Apache Spark is an open source processing engine built around speed, ease of use, and analytics. If you have large amounts of data that requires low latency processing that a typical Map Reduce program cannot provide, Spark is the alternative. Spark performs at speeds up to 100 times faster than Map Reduce for iterative algorithms or interactive data mining. Spark provides in-memory cluster computing for lightning fast speed and supports Java, Scala, and Python APIs for ease of development.

Spark allows data scientists to build models quickly and supports iterative jobs on distributed datasets. This means more people can apply deep intelligence into applications to make everything smarter, including the Internet of Things (IoT), machine learning, web, mobile, social, business process and more.
column17: Spark Party - 5 minute Lightning sessions...

column3:
You've heard of HDFS,.. how about GPFS?

GPFS is has been powering the worlds largest supercomputers for more than a decade - for example:

- Leibniz Supercomputing Centre in Munich @ 9500 nodes
- National Center for Atmospheric Research (NCAR) @ 4500
- Argonne National Laboratory Mira System 49,152 compute nodes

Now this technology is available for Apache Hadoop and we'd like to show you what's under the covers.
column17: A closer look at IBM's General Parallel File System (GPFS) for Hadoop

On June 6, 2016, leading minds in data and analytics from Tesla, Netflix, Silicon Valley Data Science, and IBM will come together to demonstrate how open data and analytics technologies such as R, Spark, Python and more are forming a vibrant ecosystem.  The community has a shared goal of working with all data to build unexpected insights and launch new business applications.

The Apache Spark Maker Community Event will bring together data scientists, data engineers, data developers, and data designers June 6th @ 6pm at Galvanize, San Francisco. Here’s the plan:   

- The Big Reveal – New sample Apache Spark apps and tools

- Use Cases – Monsanto will share how they are using R and Spark to optimize their supply chain

- Learning Session - Hear from experts working on Spark projects and building the Spark ecosystem of open data and analytics technologies

- Networking Opportunity – Food, drinks and data, explore a Hall of Innovation showcasing Spark demos

Join us. Learn more here:  Apache Spark Maker Community Event 

Registration begins at 5:30 PM and the discussion starts at 6:30 PM; food and drinks will be served. You must register for this event.

THIS IS A GLOBAL ON-LINE HACKATHON THAT BEGINS MAY 23, 2016 AND NOW ENDS AUGUST 23, 2016.  SUBMISSIONS DUE AUGUST 23rd BY 5:00 PM EST. 

We’re extending the hackathon deadline to August 23 - that’s 20 additional days to build your Spark enterprise app. (View the revised competition calendar HERE.  We're giving you more time because....

We’re adding new enterprise data resources to the site and we want to give you a chance to incorporate these into your projects, if you so choose.  Our awesome data co-sponsors Yelp and Uncharted Software have generously shared some of their enterprise data sets for you to use during the hackathon.

Yelp’s data includes 2.2M reviews by 552K users for 77K businesses. The Uncharted data includes Bitcoin network transactions from processing the Bitcoin blockchain as of mid-2014 and Amazon product reviews from 1995 through 2003. For a fuller description and data access, visit our resources page.

Uncharted Software also has a couple cool Spark data visualization libraries you should check out: Salt and SparkPipe.

And, in case you’d like to weigh the effects of weather on business operations, we’re also offering access to the full suite of Weather Company APIs for the duration of the hackathon.

Finally, if you’re looking for a hosting solution for your Spark app, we’re now offering extended Bluemix trials for all hackathon participants. Using Bluemix services to build your project is totally optional, but might be a good way to get your app up and running — particularly with the IBM Analytics for Apache Spark service.

You can request your extended Bluemix trial code here. 

For all hackathon participants, trials will extend through November 1, 2016.

Now go forth and optimize for the enterprise!

---------------------

Join IBM and Devpost for a global hackathon using Apache Spark Makers Build.  There are $100,000 in cash prizes.  Submissions can be sent in up to August 23rd.

Participation Details: To participate in the global virtual hackathon, you can register here.  Please review all registration guidelines.

For the hack, you will apply Apache Spark's powerful analytics capabilities to enterprise and other relevant data so data scientists and software developers can build an analytics or mobile/web app that tackles a key business problem in marketing, customer case, operations or risk management.  The grand prize is $50,000, and the top three winners each get a meeting with the judge or
Spark community expert of their choice; the judging panel includes data experts from Tesla, Netflix, and Silicon Valley Data Science.

Go to apachespark.devpost.com for full details and registration.  Please review all registration rules.

This webinar will cover an overview of Watson Data Platform capabilities and how to empower users across the organization to make the most out of their data. What if you can shorten the time it takes to create value out of your existing organizational data ? 

What if you can provision a common analytic engine with managed services that will enable you to embrace multiple cloud platforms ? IBM Watson Data Platform is the first cloud-based data and analytics platform to support cognitive businesses. It enables access, collaboration and paths to insights by connecting all users through trusted access to a variety of data, discovering new possibilities and opportunities with built-in intelligence, automation and machine learning and accelerating outcomes with rapid deployment of new data models and fast embedding of insights into processes, applications and services. 

Let us show you how Watson Data Platform can be the milestone of your organization analytics strategy and empower your organization into the new Cognitive analytics era.

Speaker Bio:
Gerardo Rodríguez Díaz – is an avid traveler, technologist enthusiast and Big data and Analytics cloud solution specialist focused on communications and computer systems integrations industries across North America. GRD areas of specialization are IT, Marketing and Business Intelligence having worked across European, North and South American markets.

column3:
Streaming analytics and Internet Of Things ( IOT) are gaining momentum in the data and analytics industry. Apache Spark established itself as a leader in fast data processing with its ease of use. With its single execution engine and unified programming model for batch and streaming workloads, it stands out from other distributed stream processing engines. 

Join this webinar to go over basics and internals of the Streaming module of Apache Spark along with code samples. This topic is intended for audiences with some familiarity or working experience with Apache Spark core.​

Webinar is 3:00 pm EST.  Please adjust to your time zone:  http://bit.ly/2iHw6yy

Apache Spark Streaming:​

- Architecture and Execution Model
- Spark Streaming I/O 
- Programing model and Streaming Operations (api)
- Fault tolerance and reliability
- Performance Considerations

Presenter Bio: 

Suresh Matlapudi is an Open Source Analytics Solution Engineer with IBM. He is a hands-on Engineer with deep experience in distributed data processing, Big Data, Data Warehousing and Hybrid Information Architectures. His current work involves supporting sales teams with pre-sales and technical specifications for Open Source Analytics tools, specifically Hadoop/Spark and execution of several outreach programs to support Open Source adoption by Analytics teams. 

Before joining IBM he was involved in building some of the large-scale data processing systems at companies like eHarmony, Deem, American Express, Knights Bridge Solutions.
column13: Live Webinar is EST.  Adjust to your time zone.
column17: Streaming Data Analytics with Apache Spark Streaming

column3:
Greetings Streamers !! 

Spark is recognized as a great analytics engine. One of its benefits is its inclusion of machine learning algorithms that can group, predict, classify and even recommend based on the analysis of a corpus of data. Once the model is created, it can be applied to new data. In some situations, there is a need to score the model while the data is streaming to decide what to do with the new data.

In this latest Data Science Central Webinar event, you will learn how to process the data to arrive at a model and how the resulting model can be used to score streaming data using IBM Streams.


Register Online Here:  http://bit.ly/2o4YZag
column13: Live Webinar is PST.  Adjust to your time zone.  Register online.
column17: Apache Spark and IBM Streams Working Together in Streaming Analytics

Seattle Area... join us on Monday, June 23rd at 6:30pm in the lively WeWork South Lake Union location! 

Are you a born-on-the-web and mobile developer, or startup/entrepreneur, or an independent software vendor looking to make services available in the cloud? Are you looking to leverage Big Data in a fast and friendly manner? Maybe you need to iterate on something quickly. Maybe you want to experiment with different technologies. Maybe you just want to build, extend, and deploy with the efficiency of a cold-blooded cyborg. Whatever you want to do, Bluemix offers a single solution environment that lets you develop, deploy and manage apps of all types (web, mobile, big data, new smart devices) across multiple domains.  If the answer is yes to any of these questions, you don't want to miss this meetup session. You will learn how to deploy your application and have it running in a matter of hours.

column3:
REGISTRATION IS NOW CLOSED.  IF YOU ARE PLANNING TO ATTEND AND HAVE NOT REGISTERED AT THE LINK BELOW, YOU WILL NEED TO FILL OUT AN ON-SITE REGISTRATION AT THE EVENT.

http://ibm.co/1u9QE3b


Hadoop has extended the analysis of large data sets beyond that of traditional Data Warehouses.  But as IT professionals begin to migrate traditional BI/DW services (e.g., OLAP, ROLAP, Ad-Hoc, etc.) to the Hadoop environment, they are presented with a challenge regarding how best to integrate traditional BI tools with their Hadoop environment.

This session will discuss Hadoop in general, and then we will explore the use SQL to access data persisted in the HDFS.  Next, we will take a detailed look at "BigSQL" & "BigSheets" -- two tools that are bundled with IBM's Hadoop offering, known as "BigInsights." Each overview session will follow with a demonstration of the technology.

This event is free and lunch will be provided.

Agenda (subject to change).

11:00 am - Registration & Welcome

11:30 am - Lunch

12:00 pm - Big Data / Data Warehousing / Hadoop Overview

12:45 pm - Introduction to BigInsights (IBM's distribution of Hadoop)

1:15 pm – Demonstration of BigInsights

1:45 pm - Introduction to SQL on Hadoop (BigSQL) & spreadsheet-like analysis / visualizing of data (BigSheets) on Hadoop

2:15 pm – Demonstration of BigSheets and BigSQL

3:00 pm – Closing Remarks


TO CONFIRM YOUR SEAT IN THIS EVENT, PLEASE REGISTER HERE:  http://ibm.co/1u9QE3b


We look forward seeing you there.
column17: Getting started with SQL on Hadoop

column3:
CALLING ALL DEVELOPERS .... JOIN THE BIG DATA FOR SOCIAL GOOD CHALLENGE

Big data exists in just about everything we use and do. It comes from phones, cars, roads, power lines, waterways, food crates, and innumerable other items you’d never think of as computers. This data speaks volumes about our collective behavior and society – so let’s use it to do something incredible! IBM invites developers and data enthusiasts to take a deep dive into real world civic issues using big data and the IBM Bluemix Analytics for Hadoop service. Analyze one of our curated datasets or bring your own (provided it meets these requirements)! Use Hadoop and your data to create a clickable and interactive data visualization to highlight insights that you’ve found.

Right now, IBM is placing its biggest bet on open source innovation since we led the adoption of Linux through hundreds of business solutions. On June 15th, we are announcing our commitment to Apache Spark, an in-memory compute engine that delivers eye-opening speed and flexibility to data scientists and developers working with big data at scale.


In fact, we are bringing the speed, agility and power of Spark into our Analytics Platform to make sure we're meeting the emerging needs of data-driven enterprises.


After our initial launch on June 15th in San Francisco, we will be hosting a regional Spark Signature Moment Event in Seattle on June 17th, 2015.

You are invited--Seattle tech summer party!  This event is in partnership with IBM and Pivotal Labs.


Join us for great drinks, delicious food, and a celebration of our growing entrepreneur and tech community in Seattle. We'll be raising a glass and toasting a vision of making Seattle the best place in the world for entrepreneurs, data science talent, and technical expertise.

You must register for this event:

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/galvanize-seattle-tech-summer-party-tickets-17787553050


We've been working hard to set up a beautiful multi-use startup, student and event space in Pioneer Square to serve this vision for Seattle. From startups, data science students, technical talent, partners and companies who are hiring, we are looking forward to officially christening the building with you and other insiders from the Seattle tech community.

As part of the event, members of the startup community including Galvanize will also be sharing an exciting update about a mutual commitment to train and support the next generation of data scientists in Seattle.

Schedule:

6:00-10:00pm
- Local dishes Curated by Maxime Bilet of Imagine Food, including Taylor Shellfish and The London Plane

- Whiskey Tastings by Westland Distillery
- Live Local Music
- Galvanize Start-up Member Expo
- Open House for Galvanize Web Development and Data Science

About Galvanize:

Galvanize is an education company that blends the lines between learning and working. We believe in creating easy access for anyone who has the drive and determination to jump into the tech world - especially in entrepreneurship, engineering, and data science. Our campuses are home to founders, students, VCs, mentors, and other folks who are engaged and excited to level up their career.

In Partnership with IBM:

IBM is focused on educating today's data scientists and data engineers by providing the skills that will propel these roles forward in the enterprise. Following the recent commitment IBM made to the Apache Spark project, IBM and Galvanize have teamed up to lower the barrier of entry to the field of data science. The IBM team will discuss brand new initiatives to bring exceptionally skilled contributors into the data science mainstream through accessible education.

About Pivotal Labs:

Pivotal Labs is the agile development services unit of Pivotal. We help transform the way the world builds software. Through education, training, tools and our rigorously tested methodologies, our team of world-class product managers, designers, data scientists and agile developers work in concert with customers to solve real problems and transform digital experiences. Because we work collaboratively, our customers learn cutting-edge technology and best practices. At Pivotal Labs, we're dedicated to giving back to the communities in which we live and work and are proud of our close partnership with Galvanize.

Attendees will include:

- 400 Entrepreneurs, Engineers, and Students
- Corporate Technology Leaders in Seattle and beyond
- Technology Investors and VCs
- Seattle Policy Makers
- The Arts, Music, and Food Community of Seattle
- Press / Media

THIS IS A GLOBAL ON-LINE HACKATHON THAT BEGINS MAY 23, 2016 AND NOW ENDS AUGUST 23, 2016.  SUBMISSIONS DUE AUGUST 23rd BY 5:00 PM EST. 

We’re extending the hackathon deadline to August 23 - that’s 20 additional days to build your Spark enterprise app. (View the revised competition calendar HERE.  We're giving you more time because....

We’re adding new enterprise data resources to the site and we want to give you a chance to incorporate these into your projects, if you so choose.  Our awesome data co-sponsors Yelp and Uncharted Software have generously shared some of their enterprise data sets for you to use during the hackathon.

Yelp’s data includes 2.2M reviews by 552K users for 77K businesses. The Uncharted data includes Bitcoin network transactions from processing the Bitcoin blockchain as of mid-2014 and Amazon product reviews from 1995 through 2003. For a fuller description and data access, visit our resources page.

Uncharted Software also has a couple cool Spark data visualization libraries you should check out: Salt and SparkPipe.

And, in case you’d like to weigh the effects of weather on business operations, we’re also offering access to the full suite of Weather Company APIs for the duration of the hackathon.

Finally, if you’re looking for a hosting solution for your Spark app, we’re now offering extended Bluemix trials for all hackathon participants. Using Bluemix services to build your project is totally optional, but might be a good way to get your app up and running — particularly with the IBM Analytics for Apache Spark service.

You can request your extended Bluemix trial code here.  For all hackathon participants, trials will extend through November 1, 2016. Now go forth and optimize for the enterprise!

---------------------

Build an Apache Spark application to address a real business problem or core concern related to customer care, marketing, risk management or operations. Join IBM and Devpost for a global hackathon using Apache Spark Makers Build.  There are $100,000 in cash prizes.  Submissions can be sent in up to August 23rd.

Participation Details: To participate in the global virtual hackathon, you can register here.  Please review all registration guidelines.

For the hack, you will apply Apache Spark's powerful analytics capabilities to enterprise and other relevant data so data scientists and software developers can build an analytics or mobile/web app that tackles a key business problem in marketing, customer case, operations or risk management.  The grand prize is $50,000, and the top three winners each get a meeting with the judge or
Spark community expert of their choice; the judging panel includes data experts from Tesla, Netflix, and Silicon Valley Data Science.

Go to apachespark.devpost.com for full details and registration.  Please review all registration rules.

Questions?

We're here to help. If you have any questions about the hackathon, post on the discussion forum or email support@devpost.com and we'll respond as soon as we can.

Let us show you how Watson Data Platform can be the milestone of your organization analytics strategy and empower your organization into the new Cognitive analytics era.

column3:
THIS IS A WEB CONFERENCE ONLY.  TIME OF WEB CONFERENCE LOCALLY IS BASED ON LIVE-STREAM START - PACIFIC DAYLIGHT TIME. DETAILS TO CONNECT TO LIVE-STREAM ARE INDICATED BELOW. 


Apache Spark is an open source processing engine built around speed, ease of use, and analytics. If you have large amounts of data that requires low latency processing that a typical Map Reduce program cannot provide, Spark is the alternative.

Spark performs at speeds up to 100 times faster than Map Reduce for iterative algorithms or interactive data mining. Spark provides in-memory cluster computing for lightning fast speed and supports Java, Scala, and Python APIs for ease of development. Spark allows data scientists to build models quickly and supports iterative jobs on distributed datasets. This means more people can apply deep intelligence into applications to make everything smarter, including the Internet of Things (IoT), machine learning, web, mobile, social, business process and more.


Do you believe in the value of Spark, in the speed, efficiency and flexibility of this in-memory compute engine? IBM does.  Emphatically.

That's why we're committed to do everything we can to accelerate the adoption of Spark for enterprise analytics, where Spark promises seemingly unlimited value. On June 15, 2015, IBM will host a Spark Community event in San Francisco, California: IBM | Spark - The Start of Something Big in Data and Design. There will be a live demo showcase, refreshments, and a Town Hall discussion featuring some of the most trail-blazing data scientists in today's Spark Community, including:

-  Edd Dumbill, VP Strategy, Silicon Valley Data Science

-  Mike Tamir, Chief Science Officer & VP of Data Science & Education at Galvanize

-  Fernando Perez, Staff Scientist at Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory & Founding Investigator of the Berkeley Institute for Data Science

-  Haoyuan Li, CEO and Founder of Tachyon Nexus

-  Shankar Venkataraman, Distinguished Engineer & CTO, IBM Analytics Platform at IBM

-  Paco Nathan, Director, Community Evangelism, Databricks

Spark Community members will also deliver 5-minute lightning talks to describe exciting projects they're working on.

We will provide a livestream presentation of what these Spark leaders have to say.

To get additional details about Spark and access the live-stream, you can sign up now for a reminder.  Please go to :


http://www.ibm.com/analytics/us/en/technology/spark/

Scroll down to "Can't attend in Person"?  Sign up for a reminder and add it to your calendar.

http://bigdatauniversity.com/bdu-wp/bdu-course/spark-fundamentals/

http://www.ibm.com/analytics/us/en/technology/spark/


Happy Sparking.
